review: The app that I chose to review is called Headspace, and it is a meditation app that helps manage stress by showing mindfulness excercises, and offers information on how to manage other things such as anxiety or worry. This app did an amazing job at helping me be more mindful throughout the day. In the "Headspace library", there were tabs for certain scenarios like "navigating injustice, reframe stress and relax, mindful money, anger/sadness/growth, mindful eating, and guide to sleep,". Each tab had different podcasts and meditation methods that corresponded to that subject. I enjoyed using this app because as a person who worries often, this tool allowed me to take time out of my day to clear my head and do something that betters my mental health. This app is relevant to abnormal psychology because it includes ways to manage anxiety and worry. Although it is not an app that diagnoses or properly treats symptoms of anxiety, it does relieve some worry by the various methods used in the app; it helps people who may want to feel better, but may not be ready to see a professional, don't have access to proper mental healthcare, or wants to try something quick that is available by simply pulling out their phone. Overall, this app was a game-changer for me as freshman in college, and it is a great way to meditate and reflect, all while teaching me how to manage my constant worry I feel throughout my day.
title: This is a very useful app!

review: The best mindfulness app. User friendly, the mediation teachers come from all different walks of life & you can tell that they truly LOVE what they do, so passionate helping others and one person at a time are slowly changing the world for the better. They even have things for families & kids. I‚Äôve grown into a better person in all aspects of my life and was able to accomplish things that the ‚Äúold‚Äù me would‚Äôve never imagined. I‚Äôve learned so much over these 2 years about myself and the world around me. Andy and Eve were the first ones I started listening to & then they got Kessonga and Dora who I felt even closer to (through culture, headspace and their added vulnerability to speak about their lives on a level I could relate with). I truly believe in investing in my mental health & have tried other guided meditation apps, but never truly connected with them & it never impacted my life like Headspace. I decided to joined Headspace in 2020 & started with the monthly payments. March 2022 I upgraded to the yearly membership. 14,601 minutes later, I can honestly say it‚Äôs the BEST thing I‚Äôve ever given myself. TLDR: If you‚Äôre thinking about trying headspace, give the 30 day free trial a run and with consistent practice, you‚Äòll want to  invest your money in your mental healthy too! Podcast: Radio Headspace is also a part of my morning routine & I listen to it every morning on my commute.
title: An Absolute  Life Changer

review:
I began using this application a few years back, in the middle of my college career. I was so stressed out at that time that I could hardly perform day-to-day tasks and I was so broke that I certainly couldn't afford help from a specialist. 
Enter HeadSpace. I found the app through an online search and began a free trial to try to calm my tumultuous inner consciousness. Though I cannot say that the improvements in my thoughts and behavior were immediate, the guidance of Andy's voice (the only option at that time and still my personal favorite) did help to calm me in times of immediate need. If nothing else, this app taught me to breath. My father was so impressed by my lack of mouth-breathing that he took up the monthly fee once it began and I have used Head Space (now on my own dime, thank you) ever since. 
Anyway, whether you are looking for help breathing, getting into shape, falling to sleep, or in quieting those misguided negative inner-voices that come to plague the chronically unhappy, HeadSpace has something for you (often more than one thing, in fact). If you're reading this and thinking about a trial or a membership, give it a shot. It's a judgment-free, stress-free, and until your trial runs out, a free-free way of beginning the mission to exploring and conquering anxiety and exestential dread. 
Consider it one small step for you, and one giant leap (in the right direction) for your mind.
title: Head Space, The Final Frontier

review: I have use this app for several days I have taken notes throughout just to see how I feel about this app and how it works. And what are the first sessions, I decided to do a breathing exercise which I realize the instructor was having us focus on breathing from our chest. I‚Äôve done almost the exact same breathing exercise in my abnormal psychology class but then main difference was headspace how do you focus on your chest and breathing through there instead of what we did in my abnormal psychology class which was breathing through your stomach and focusing on there.I have learned through my psychology class that breathing exercises can help people with anxiety by increasing the oxygen exchange which is known to reduce your blood pressure and slow your heart rate these two factors combined have been shown to also release tension that has been held in your abdomen. for example when you were panicking your abdomen tightens and constricts your ability to breathe which often times makes you panic more. Breathing exercises also work because the increase supply of oxygen to your brain stimulates your parasympathetic nervous system which helps promote a sense of calmness throughout you and you begin to calm down. Although some of their breathing techniques are different from what I have learned in my psychology classes this is still an app that is known for meditation and breathing exercises that can really help.
title: Compared to what I have learned in my PSY classes

review: I was introduced to meditation more than 25 years ago and have had a relatively steady practice. So why do I use Headspace? Like any practice it is tempting to slack off or feel like you ‚Äúgot‚Äù all the benefits and do not need to do it anymore. Other times it can feel like one is alone in the practice and it becomes hard to motivate oneself. Headspace helps me stay motivated and consistent. And no matter how long one has practiced, having a community of meditators is very helpful to continue practicing. I also have a tendency to get bored with things including meditation, so the variety of approaches, techniques, and goals provided keep it fresh. During 2020 I really appreciated the improvements made by Headspace especially the daily conversations by other meditators, the addition of the Move feature, and the Sleep tools. These were very helpful to keep my spirits up, my body moving, and my meditation practice on track. I also discovered the Pro series for advanced meditators. I am listening to it for a second time because as I have learned in my practice, you are never ‚Äúdone‚Äù learning and growing as a meditator. The same session at a different time gives you different insights. I am grateful to the Headspace team for creating and continually evolving the app to meet the challenges of today. And for helping a seasoned ‚Äúpro‚Äù stay fresh and present. Thank you Headspace!
title: Support for seasoned meditators

review: You won‚Äôt regret buying a Headspace subscription. I often joke with people that Headspace is the one thing I would want to take with me to a desert island. If I were to cancel all of my subscriptions today, Headspace is the one exception I would make. I‚Äôm a high school English teacher, and our administration put together a month-long mindfulness education program for our students shortly after I subscribed. I had already raved to many of them about the app and the benefits of taking a couple of minutes out of their day to sit and be present. Lo and behold, Andy pops up on the next slide as our Ted Talk speaker of the day! On a more serious note, I suffer from debilitating chronic pain. I‚Äôm currently on long-term disability and a leave of absence from the classroom. Mindfulness, and the courses on managing pain, have been a tremendous help in my journey. Not only that, but I struggle with insomnia. My favorite part of Headspace, because of my (admittedly) vivid imagination, are the sleepcasts. I love falling asleep to Rainday Antiques. I can‚Äôt imagine doing anything but that ever again. I have learned to manage stress and anxiety in a way that I had never thought was possible. I have meditated in the waiting room of The Cleveland Clinic before my appointments. I once laughed at the idea of mindfulness and meditation. Now it‚Äôs an integral part of my life. It‚Äôs part of my journey, and I think everyone could benefit from it.
title: A Bright Spot in a Dark World

review:
This app has given me tools to deal with constant change. This past year, I‚Äôve needed to pivot every day to face some new challenge outside as an essential worker, and at home in isolation with my partner. The tools I Iearned to use to be present in the moment and to accept change has benefited my partner and colleagues at work as much as my own peace of mind. I have very little control over my environment, but I can see my reaction, accept the emotions that rise up, and move on instead of getting lost or bound by them.
This app has also benefited me by helping me get through insomnia. Sometimes it helps me get to sleep in the first place. Mostly it gives me tools to use to calm my mind and body when I wake up in the night buffeted by anxiety or lingering frustration from the day. 
Lastly, this app has given me a language to express the emotional upheaval and troubling questions that I used to just call anxiety. Naming what makes me feel upset has brought clarity to what can feel like a tempest at the time and allow me to look at my thoughts or, rather, face them. After acknowledging them, I can let them go. Sometimes I‚Äôm better at that than at other times. 
Regular exercise strengthens my focus, my ability to pivot and refocus, and builds roads of calm and quiet that the brain finds easier to fall into and travel due to constant use.
title: The most useful thing I‚Äôve done in 2020

review:
It was easy to go through life unaware of the benefits of meditation, and aside from other people‚Äôs accounts of the practice, there wasn‚Äôt much to tempt me to try.
  But as soon as i tried it and put in considerable effort to be consistent*, i was hooked. I could feel the difference between a day i remembered to practice and when i forgot to. I loved it so much i started taking time throughout my day to practice, sometimes in my car/somewhere else by myself, or sometimes I‚Äôd take a minute to just focus on my breathing or the sounds around me or how my body felt. I was hooked.
  Then i went through a big life change occurred that i allowed to take me away from the practice for over a year and a half. Now I‚Äôm here to say that the me that was consistently practicing vs the me now are not even close. I‚Äôm struggling to get back in the swing of this because i desperately miss the emotional stability and overall sense of ease i had. I just need to take it one day at a time and remember that it‚Äôs a process, there‚Äôs no such thing as doing meditation perfectly.

*tried setting a time to practice but couldn‚Äôt follow through so i resorted to just 5 minutes in the day, until i could consistently practice at a certain time in the morning, if that helps anyone w a similar struggle
title: It‚Äôs a drug in a way

review: For anyone with the slightest doubt about whether or not they should begin (or continue) their meditation practice with Headspace, do yourself the greatest favor of your life and do it - surrender to whatever is holding you back and I PROMISE you will blow your own mind with everything you will gain from it. Just trust, put in the time (even 5 minutes a day) and the rewards you will reap from it will speak for themselves. As someone who was a vicious doubter, non-believer, and did not think it was humanly possible to get me to sit still for even 1 minute - I didn‚Äôt realize that the thing that I was most resistant to, was actually the thing that I needed the most. I am now going on 3 years with headspace happier, healthier (used to suffer from terrible GERD), more compassionate, resilient, focused, and more. It brought attention to my mindless eating habits and even helped me lose weight (and keep it off). I didn‚Äôt realize that I was living in a ‚Äòcloud‚Äô, on auto-pilot until headspace helped bring me back to myself. Today, my cure for EVERYTHING (bad day, good day, breakup, can‚Äôt focus, bad mood, feeling anxious, grumpy, lethargic, etc.) is to sit down and do a 10 minute meditation. It truly has been life-changing and I am forever, eternally grateful for Headspace.
title: If you‚Äôre reading this - it‚Äôs a sign, just get it!

review:
I heard about this app on tv and saw ads in The Today section of the App Store. I decided to give it a try and it really does help me out. I feel less stressed, calm, and feel ready for anything. It‚Äôs like a guide or tool which helps push you to be a better you. So then comes the question, is it worth it? I think so. For instance if you have ADHD or feel stressed most days (maybe because of work or school) use this. 

Everything is not sunshine and rainbows. For one, $13 to me feels somewhat pricey. Other meditation apps that I found are cheaper than what Headspace currently offers. Another thing is that it lacks free content. There‚Äôs only very little that Headspace offers and it‚Äôs not a lot. It‚Äôs almost as if your forced into paying for a subscription in order to use it. I really didn‚Äôt want to do that and I have now canceled it since I felt that it was overly priced. 

Headspace is great and I may say that‚Äôs is better than most apps I‚Äôve used. But I don‚Äôt like the fact that after going through the tutorial it locks most of the content Headspace offers you and forces you into a subscription that feels overly priced. Yeah, they give you a free trial but after that your pretty much forced. Offer more videos that are free and let people decide for themselves. If you do those things I may bump my stars to 5.
title: Headspace is a excellent, but isn‚Äôt truly free

review: I freaking love this app. My anxiety was starting to become bad again and I could feel myself falling into depression. I have some experience with meditation and mindfulness and it‚Äôs helped me in the past but I‚Äôve never been able to stick with it for more than a couple of weeks at a time. Then one day while listening to Huberman‚Äôs podcast there was a month free trial and I decided to try it since I‚Äôve always wanted to give this app a go anyway. WELL, let me tell you...this app is changing my life. I am proud to say I am on my 33rd day streak. I can feel myself overall being more present and aware throughout the day. Now, when I start to feel anxious I almost immediately catch myself and can begin using some of the tools and practice I‚Äôve accumulated from headspace. I do want to add though, the key word is PRACTICE. Medication, like Andy says, is a skill and like any skill you must practice. By practicing enough, it does truly become second nature. I know it‚Äôs only been a month but I can already feel the difference and I am looking forward to the future. Thank you headspace team. P.S every little thing about this app is great. I especially love the different courses, the wake ups, the animation shorts, the sleepcasts, the focus music and yoga.
title: Grateful for headspace

review:
I truly enjoy using the headspace app, and after my free trial it was no question for me to buy the subscription. Others may say it is a little pricey, but the amount of features and genuine support included in this app is incredible. As someone who had to stop going to therapy appointments because of the cost, meditation has been a grounding practice for me, and this app really has a meditation for every scenario. I especially like the SOS section, where you can find small meditations for when you‚Äôre feeling burnt out or anxious. Another great feature is the sleep section, especially sleep casts. The calming stories really help me unwind, and there are new ones coming out all the time.

 The app interface itself is also very well designed, calming and minimal. I enjoy how you cannot browse the app while listening to a meditation or sleep cast as well ‚Äî a subtle touch that reminds me to stay present!

I would definitely recommend this app (and also all the headspace podcasts) to someone who would like to let go of unwanted habits and build self kindness. If you are going to invest your money into anything self help related, a headspace subscription is definitely worth every penny. Thank you headspace team!
title: A perfect start on your healing journey

review:
I‚Äôm in recovery & while I was in rehab they had a woman come in & teach a mindfulness meditation class. It was really helpful so when I left rehab I was looking for something to help me continue that practice. I had seen & used Headspace on Netflix so I decided to try out the app. I have used it every single day since I got it. It has been a crucial part of my recovery, giving me new coping skills & teaching me to be present in the moment. I was someone who thought meditation & all that stuff didn‚Äôt work. I am thrilled to say Headspace has proven me wrong. I just celebrated one year clean! 
I could go on & on about how great this app is & how much it has to offer because there is SO MUCH more to this app than meditation but I‚Äôll leave it there. I HIGHLY recommend you try Headspace.
There are two small things I‚Äôd change about the app‚Ä¶.
I‚Äôd love it if ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs Meditation‚Äù could be saved like other things can. Those are usually very helpful & something I‚Äôd like to be able to go back to.
Also the Sleepcasts. It would be great if you could fast forward. Sometimes I don‚Äôt want/need the wind down, I just want the story to start so I can fall asleep. Besides, there‚Äôs already a separate section for wind downs.
title: Worth every penny & then some

review:
I‚Äôm a long time paid subscriber and don‚Äôt plan on going anywhere else. However, at some point over the last year or so, this app has become absurdly difficult to navigate and find what I want. What used to be a simple and elegant interface and experience is no longer so. I don‚Äôt know if this is an attempt to encourage users to see more of what the app offers or what, but the result for me, a long time user (and not some technophobic grandfather) is frustration and wasted time. I still use the app daily, but please, consider simplifying it back to more the way it used to be, when there were more clearly organised sections for finding the meditation I want. You have some kind of impossible to meld with structure now. It‚Äôs terribly laid out with all kinds of weird and distracting subcategories and stuff I don‚Äôt care about. I just want to find various packs of guided meditations as I go from one to the next. The newer extras are nice and some great ideas, but the clutter is not. Thanks.

25 April 22 update
The app has been changed again and now I don‚Äôt see the option of continuing the series I‚Äôve been doing in the opening page and have to click through to find it. There may be some improvements to what I was unhappy with before, but this new hindrance sort of canceled that for me.
title: Please simplify the app to how it used to be
developerResponse: {'id': 29521178, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback around the changes we have made. We are sorry for any frustration around this, but please know we value your feedback. If you haven't already, please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to chat further and offer some guidance on how to navigate some new areas of the app. Hope to hear from you!", 'modified': '2022-05-03T00:09:19Z'}

review: This app has been somewhat of a life saver for me. I‚Äôve experienced a lot of trauma during my life, and a few years ago I came across this app or it came across to me via Instagram. I travel quite a bit and I love that I‚Äôm able to pick my environment of choice to meditate. I always thought meditation meant quieting your thoughts etc... but when I learned that it was part of being mindfulness and being present in the now it helped immensely in my day to day well being. When I did the anxiety course that really helped in so many ways because I thought you could get rid of it. But learning to become aware of it and being present with it, I felt it wasn‚Äôt so much of a burden. I‚Äôve had trouble on and off sticking to it consistently but I‚Äôm trying it again. It‚Äôs nice to be able to have it there especially when I know how much of a positive impact it has had on my life. I am a parent and it‚Äôs something I want my child to learn and partake in so she has the necessary tools through out her early years to when she is grown up. This is worth every penny to maintain a healthy mindset and wellbeing. You‚Äôll view the world and stress differently than you did before.
title: An amazing tool to have on the go wherever you are!!

review: So I‚Äôve been using headspace for quite awhile now and personally I think it‚Äôs great! But the thing is since I don‚Äôt have premium, I have to keep on repeating the same old things like the rain day antiques sleepcast I‚Äôve heard that sleep cast so many times and now I keep getting annoyed with it. That goes the same with the other sleep stuff too like the sleep music I‚Äôve heard ‚Äúdoze‚Äù so many times I wake up like every 30 minutes or so. Also goes the same with the two free wind downs. The first time I used the free wind downs I fell asleep instantly the second time after that I couldn‚Äôt sleep for ten minutes. So after that, I wanted to do a free trial for the premium but I didn‚Äôt realize I was short on money. Since most people do a free trial for like a week or so they cancel there payment the day before the payment is due. So I tried doing that but it asked for but then I realized they need to know my payment information before doing my free trial. I think it was because they don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm gonna cancel my payment or actually do the payment. So yeah, I think this app is amazing it just needs to either lower down the price by like 3-4$ or maybe add one or two me free sleepcasts and same goes to the wind downs, and music. Thank You.
title: Very good but expensive

review: I‚Äôve used this app off and on for years, coming back to it when I needed guided meditation more. I have been extremely disappointed to see that as time has went on they have made their free selection thinner and thinner. It‚Äôs really sad to see an app that‚Äôs supposed to be for mental health, just trying to get more and more money out of its users. I used too love this app and used it very frequently at one time. Now I cannot even have a quick sleep guided breathing exercise or even the basic starter classes. I have commented on this before and it was deleted. Every comment where they do reply to this issue, they are just promoting their social media or trying to get people to participate in their free trial. Not yet have a seen them address why they have eliminated all free and accessible options on their app whatsoever. Many people who came to this app cannot afford a subscription like this just for guided audios. Me and many more, came to this app because we wanted free, quick, and stress-free mental relief. And do not have the time or money to pay for a class or anything along those lines. I am sure I am one of many who will now be forced to completely stop supporting this company because not only can I not afford $12 a month for some recordings, but I do not want to support someone who once cared about helping people with stress, on a budget, and now using the tool as a money rag.
title: Have decreased their free library more and more.
developerResponse: {'id': 30458610, 'body': "Thanks for your review, we're really sorry to hear that you're not satisfied with our recent updates. I will make sure to pass your feedback to the right ears. In the meantime, If you would like to discuss some pricing options that may work best for you, please send us a note at help@headspace.com. Also, we're still offering a free content outside of the app on social media channels like YouTube, Snapchat, and Instagram, plus our podcast Radio Headspace and our series on Netflix. We'll also continue to partner with K-12 organizations to provide educators with access at no cost in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada, as well as our Headspace of Teens program in the US.", 'modified': '2022-06-20T15:15:33Z'}

review: THIS APP IS FOR THE STREETS! I have been through quite a bit of trials and tribulations lately. It has surely been a time where I knew it was necessary for my young son and myself to focus on spiritual and mental health and growth. I‚Äôve only used this app for one day and have already been quite impressed with the ease of use and the instant peacefulness it allows to flow through me and my child. I have tried many mindful apps, this by far is the best, the most diverse, and absolutely worth upgrading and keeping beyond the free trial period. It is not only a way to invest in your relationship with yourself but also a way to invest in your relationship with your loved ones, your colleagues, and the outside world. I believe it aides to increase awareness of yourself and your reactions. The sessions are organized exquisitely, which allows you to find a fitting activity for the ambiance you wish to establish. It is tailored to fit all demographics, for children, for parents, for couples, for singles, nurses, sales execs, beauty bloggers, celebs, or snake wranglers. It‚Äôs an app that works your mind and body. The yoga flows were a bonus I was not expecting. Overall 10/10, I simply love it!
title: Rapidly Fell In Love, It‚Äôs For Everybody

review:
I give this app 5 stars because the build of this app, the contents of this app, the flow of this app is great. well done. Every app can be improved and this one needs work in some ways 1. the watch app: the only thing I every get on the watch app is a 1 minute "breath mini". the watch app is basically useless. Why can't I see my today screen on the watch and start my various mediations from the watch. the watch app gets 1 star. 2. Shortcuts: on the iphone I have setup a sleep schedule. On the "good night" screen I am given the option to run shortcuts. Headspace offers a few shortcuts that can be called from this screen. One is the nightly "sleepcast". the sleepcast is supposzed to be different every night. It is different on my today screen, but the shortcut always plays the "Rainyday Antiques". therefore the shortcut is useless. this part of the app gets 1 star. Lastly, the philosophy behind this app is mindlessness. It is taught as a universal fix for bringing the mind to a place of ease. As such it is a religious philosophy. I think they need to be more open about this and they need to state that the point of this is to alleviate suffering.

This app looks like they did version 1 then stopped before finishing the details.    Shortcuts must work for this app to be fully functional
title: A great app.  Needs work

review:
This is really helpful! The only reason I didn‚Äôt give a higher rating is because there‚Äôs a strong overlying tone of a sales pitch there. Which is unfortunate, because I think people would be able to see the value easier if there wasn‚Äôt a push for money after every meditation and for many of the things on the app people would want to explore. Kind of stalls progress of the meditation itself when you‚Äôve just worked so hard to pull yourself back, only to be instantly asked for money right after. From a company stand point I also think it would be more beneficial to work on building value and then freely offering the option to see what monthly costs are and also show a detailed description of what‚Äôs involved with a paid membership. I know this has worked well financially for other services and I‚Äôve seen increases in sales by simply looking at things from the customers perspective. And I feel like the customers perspective is a miss here :(
However quite and easy fix and overall this app is amazing! It not only teaches the basics of meditation, but teaches different techniques as well. This makes it good for beginners all the way to experts. I truly believe that the basis of this app is pure in intention and I can see what a help it is to many people who walk the path of life.
title: Great resource!

review: I downloaded Headspace when it was free for health care workers in 2020. I was pregnant at the time and was under a lot of stress at my job. I started with the pregnancy course on the app. This was so amazing. First of all, Andy‚Äôs voice is incredibly calming. Then the pregnancy meditation helped me feel closer to baby. I was diagnosed with gestational diabetes, and when I was less stressed, my glucose was lower. This app helped me a ton with that. Then, when I went to my 29 week check up, I had just read a work email I was very upset about. The nurse took my blood pressure and it was high. They sent me to the hospital for monitoring. While I was there I practiced the meditation I had learned and was able to get my blood pressure down so I could go home! The meditations also helped me get through labor! Now that I had my baby, I‚Äôm still using this app because it just helps me find calm in my crazy world of being and full time working mom during a pandemic. If you are at all interested in meditation, you need this app. I promise it‚Äôs worth the money. When my free subscription is over, I‚Äôm paying for it! I never write app reviews, but I just want everyone to know how great Headspace truly is.
title: I can‚Äôt recommend this enough

review: In my abnormal psychology class we learned anxiety is not just a fight or flight response but instead can be a future oriented response. Abnormal anxiety usually is characterized by presenting when there is no real danger. Therefore when I lay down in bed to sleep and I start getting an increase heart rate, feel extremely hot and sometimes nauseous at the idea of future situations and work that I have yet to do, it‚Äôs abnormal. Even if many people experience this is is abnormal because there is no real threat just my brain over thinking future situations. Therefore on my quest to look for ways to relax my mind before bed I downloaded headspace. I usually listen to a guided meditation before bed. Followed I will set one of their sleep music for 60 minutes and lay down. I now am normally asleep before the sleep music stops. Even though in my class we talked more about biological and psychological treatments, I felt as though there might be an easier way for me to deal with this anxiety. Headspace has created a way for me to clear my head before bed allowing for more and a greater quality of sleep. I would suggest this app to anyone, not even for just sleeping. But as a way it relax.
title: The wonders of headspace

review: I signed up for my free trial in fall 2019, at the recommendation of a family member. I thought it was great, but wanted to shop around and see what all of the individual meditation apps had to offer, but Headspace is the clear winner. I signed up for an annual subscription (and I hardly ever do that). The general organization of the interface is great in its simplicity, because you can easily toggle between the app‚Äôs different features with the navigation on the bottom, and there‚Äôs only five options so it‚Äôs aesthetically pleasing to me. Speaking of aesthetics, the graphics shown while meditating are very uplifting, simple, and non-intimidating. I think apps like Calm that have the ability to show/do nature sounds are cool, but that feels like too many decisions as to what graphic to choose. The soft Australian accent that Andy has is very calming but feels more non-judgmental, like an old friend who‚Äôs just being your guide through the meditation. The daily video content pieces are cool, too. So far I‚Äôve learned about how music affects the brain and about snake plants. This app leaves me feeling inspired and refreshed. 10/10. Great job, devs!
title: Tried several apps and this is the clear winner

review: I‚Äôll be the first to say that I‚Äôm a big supporter of the original intent of headspace and it‚Äôs creator (not sure their name but the Australian person who was the voice on the original version of the app). I used the app a lot in 2018 then took my meditation practice further and no longer used the app. In 2021 I saw a subscription deal and recommended headspace to lots of friends and I also rejoined. The new app is just a confusing and an overwhelming mess of information and cross-branding. I opened it up today and see an advertisement for Arcade Fire‚Äôs playlist and dances moves form Lincoln Center? Sure that‚Äôs interesting but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs necessary for this app and this whole project to have such interference of information when actually trying to calm the mind. I‚Äôm sorry to say but the expansionist vision of headspace studios has lost the core of whatever is supposed to be happening here. There are tons of nuggets of goodness in here but you gotta dig and by that time you find what is useful, it‚Äôs just annoying and you‚Äôve wasted time in your screen instead of meditating. Take yourself offline and away from your phone and find/create your own stillness. That doesn‚Äôt cost a monthly fee. I hope Headpace reads this - please tell your investors that the integrity of your project is at stake. Now it‚Äôs just another business in the wheels of the market.
title: Mindless space

review:
Today is day 5 of the worst week of my life. It has humbled me immensely and brought me back to the most important things in my life. One of which is meditation. 
Today, The Wake Up was about setting realistic and healthy goals for yourself, burnout, and more. The most important thing that I heard, however, was that the speaker themselves have a disability that impacts their work and goal setting. It made me tear up to hear about Amanda Morris‚Äô perspective on running yourself down trying to meet expectations and lofty goals. ‚ÄúThis is someone I trust to talk about this,‚Äù I thought. 
Headspace not only champions helpful and relevant information, it seems to champion diversity in the way that really matters: who, with the most real experience with this problem, can be trusted to be the face of this process as users work through it? I see how you put users needs and concerns first. It‚Äôs wonderful. It is bare minimum - but it is wonderful and should be said. 
This is an incredible app with an incredible goal. The people who work for Headspace have my heart. I hope to see more from Amanda Morris soon!!!!
title: This app saves my life daily

review: Headspace is honestly one of the best "fall-asleep-quick" apps out there, and I'm personally convinced it's the best. It's amazing, lets you keep track of your goal(s), and you can choose what type of audio you'd like to listen to! However, as the title states, we need more audios read by Darren. I, personally, believe Darren is one of the best story-readers there are, and he honestly makes me feel genuinely happy amd loved. Now, I know Darren has a life, as everyone does, but I believe there needs to be more sleep audios read by Darren. Currently, there's only 5(Five) audios read by him, and as someone who has attatchment issues, I'd enjoy more audios read by him. If it's (at all) possible, you could maybe also have every story-teller have their own versions of each audio, Darren included, and the listener could choose who they want to listen to. You could also do this same thing with the variations of the audios, making it so that the listener can choose which variation of the story they want to listen to! Other than having more Darren in Headspace, I believe Headspace is an amazing, awesome, and fantastic "fall-asleep-quick" apps in the world.
title: Amazing stories - Needs more Darren.

review: I started meditating in January 2021, I had never meditated a day in my life. I was suffering from a mind that would not stop, it was spinning out of control and sleep was non existent for me. My therapist suggested I try meditating to help still my mind and ground myself in reality. I did a quick google search and found this app. Fast forward a year + meditating 10-15 minutes every morning and I can honestly say my life is changed. Now I am connected with my mind and body in a way I never have been before. I have a greater understanding of my physical/emotional responses and am able to ground myself in reality and the present moment where as before this was one of my greatest struggles. For years I took 2 sleeping aids every night to try and help me sleep, I have completely stopped taking those and am getting better rest than I ever have in my life. This app has taught me how to still my mind and find a peace that I never knew existed in myself. Meditation has singly been the biggest transformational thing in my life. I am so grateful for Headspace and cannot recommend it enough!
title: New life

review:
Been using the app for over 4 years and recently they‚Äôve made changes that made me want to review the app. They‚Äôve taken features away that they use to have. For example, they‚Äôve taken away the history I used to track my mediations and replaced it with a stupid message ‚ÄúRemember your run streak doesn‚Äôt reflect your growth‚Äù horrible.üôÑ They taken away the little icon that lets you know if you‚Äôve taken a course or class. So now you have to click into the course to see which ones you‚Äôve taken. 

Primarily I think they‚Äôve focus on content ( which it has been great, but recently it‚Äôs like they‚Äôre trying to hard.) I think they need to spend more time on app engineering. I‚Äôve reached out expressing why you keep taking functionality away. I got a message that‚Äôs basically says here how you can delete the app and cancel your subscription. (Paraphrases)

I‚Äôve used the app so long because I do like Andy‚Äôs mediations and has really helped me growth my mind and body. I just feel recent changes have made the app less enjoyably and like they‚Äôre trying to hard or something. I hope it improves but pretty disappointed in the direction the app is going.
title: Recently disappointed.
developerResponse: {'id': 30127431, 'body': "Thank you for your review. I'm really sorry that you're not satisfied with our recent updates, we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-06-02T15:22:53Z'}

review: I absolutely love Headspace üíÜüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è. I bought anannual membership on Groupon last year and gladly renewed when that had expired. It has helped me to establish a daily meditation practice. Meditation is something I‚Äôve wanted to do but I didn‚Äôt know whom or what to listen to, or didn‚Äôt have a consistent discipline a routine around it. I love that Headspace has multiple meditations you can choose from, and you control how long the meditation is from 1 minute up to 30 minutes if you want ! There are even meditation courses about focus, stress, productivity - all the reasons we should even be meditating in the first place! I love the daily tracker that shows how many days in a row you‚Äôve meditated and the total amount of minutes that I‚Äôve meditated- it definitely keeps me motivated to want to continue to do it. I‚Äôve definitely noticed a shift in my behavior over the past year and in my mindset since I have been meditating. I am more calm and less irritable and things don‚Äôt bother me as much.I highly recommend this app!
title: Headspace has helped me to establish a daily meditation practice

review:
Truly I rarely subscribe to apps or trust their proclaimed effectiveness. But headspace has been shockingly life changing. My partner does the meditations and really loves them. He‚Äôs started meditating at least once a day and I think it‚Äôs improved both of our lives. He‚Äôs just been much more thoughtful and calm. I‚Äôve been trying To incorporate them more into my life and they are lovely. I love all the specific programs. However my biggest take away from this app are their sleepcasts and wind down meditations for sleep. 

I have struggled with insomnia and falling asleep my entire life. I lay in bed for hours trying to fall asleep but cant stop my mind racing. Now with headspace I am out in 10 minutes or less. No joke. I‚Äôve been using it every night for a month now and I‚Äôm just so astonished.

My one gripe with the app is it‚Äôs limited free content. The paid content is 100% worth it but I wasn‚Äôt convinced until my partner purchased it and I could explore what I was missing out on. But The free sleep cast that is offered(rain day antiques) is still one of my favorites.
title: Life changing

review: As someone just getting started with meditating, I began with ‚ÄúBasics‚Äù and appreciated the functionality of selecting how much time  I can choose on a meditation session. After completing Basics, I didn‚Äôt see any direction on where to proceed next. There were a lot of courses that didn‚Äôt seem to apply to where I wanted to grow. After trying some courses here and there, I saw in the ‚ÄúToday‚Äù tab a video acknowledging they received feedback regarding how to navigate to the next group of sessions after Basics.  I started ‚ÄúHeadspace 365‚Äù and the functionality of selecting the amount of time I had to meditate disappeared from the settings within each course.  Sessions are stuck at a little over 21 minutes for the remainder of the 10 months I‚Äôve been using this app.  For several weeks the sessions started out with the presenters voice sounding like digital noise.  Instead of sessions being ‚Äúguided‚Äù throughout, the sessions include long periods of silence that make me wonder if either I or the presenter fell asleep. It seems like the same things are said over and over with little new information or areas to improve mindfulness.  This app is good, it just needs some work.
title: Disappointing
developerResponse: {'id': 26668030, 'body': "Thank you for your review; we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2021-12-06T11:59:29Z'}

review: I‚Äôve been using Headspace for more than four years now. It was great until I got my Apple Watch but the integration with Apple Watch has been really bumpy. Very frustrating that I still have to carry my phone around in order to choose a meditation, for example. It‚Äôs also frustrating that the rollout of fresh material seems to have stalled. It would be nice if they introduced other forms of meditation for those of us who‚Äôve been doing this for a while. I‚Äôm now on my fourth rerun of the pro series. Granted meditation is not a top 40 station, and new material is not what meditation is all about. But there are other forms of meditation which I read about in books, but find no mention of at all in the Headspace sphere. Which stalls my education and hence my practice. Tonglen, Insight, Loving Kindness, to name 3. I could be wrong and maybe these things are buried somewhere in the Headspace curriculum, and I just haven‚Äôt found them yet. So my mind could be easily changed. (And changing the mind kind of IS‚Äîat least part‚Äîwhat meditation is all about.) But for the moment I‚Äôm trying another app and may or may not renew my subscription to Headspace when it comes up.
title: I used to love this app, but‚Ä¶

review:
I‚Äôve used Headspace for over 3 years now. I‚Äôve tried several other meditation apps, and nothing compares to Headspace‚Äôs courses, variety, and overall production quality. However, there are two main flaws with this app.
1) The Apple Watch app is garbage and has been for years. That‚Äôs actually why I‚Äôm writing this review. I expected them to have fixed it by now. There are only a few meditations available and you don‚Äôt get to chose them or their timers. I really dislike that the first thing I touch in the morning and last thing I touch at night is my phone because of this, which is bad for your digital wellbeing, especially as someone who battles phone addiction. Also, you can only use the app with Bluetooth headphones, which is not always preferred.
2) The app has gotten very cluttered. As the app has progressed and they‚Äôve added more courses, videos, tips, etc. the app has gotten EXTREMELY bloated. It takes me much longer than it used to to find a meditation that I want to listen to and I usually just default back to one I‚Äôve already listened to.
title: Amazing app, but the Watch app is terrible
developerResponse: {'id': 29882655, 'body': "Thank you for your review; we'll be sure your feedback is heard. We are sorry for any trouble that you are having within the app, and the experience that you are having, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com and we will further assist you.\n", 'modified': '2022-05-21T19:54:03Z'}

review:
I use this app exclusively for the sleepcasts, so that‚Äôs the only feature I can comment on.
I love them, and they‚Äôre the only way I can fall asleep now. I wish they were a bit longer, but I understand it‚Äôd be hard to record a story that‚Äôs hours long. I have a couple suggestions: When a sleepcast ends, can it just skip to the next sleepcast (or at least have that be an option in settings?). Also, I can only fall asleep to male voices, so I‚Äôm very limited to a few sleepcasts.. it‚Äôd be great if all stories were recorded by both a male and a female and we could choose which we‚Äôd like to listen to. Lastly, I really would like a setting where we can skip the breathing wind-downs. If not, then at least have a trigger where when you‚Äôve already done 1 wind-down, then the next sleepcast you listen to should automatically skip this part. It‚Äôs frustrating wanting to dive right into a new story and having to go through the same breathing session you just did. I really hope you hear my input and take it into consideration! If not, I‚Äôll send them via email to developers. :)
title: Sleepcasts!

review:
Upshot: IMO, headspace shines with (typically) well grounded and philosophically informed perspective that goes far for empowering those who take that perspective to heart, mind and ongoing self-reflection.

Rarely, do I take the time to review an app. I have too many more important things. However, headspace has been so fundamentally profound as not only a meditation tool, but also a source of surprisingly deep and nuanced philosophical perspective across a number of topics. And that‚Äôs really what sets it apart- not only do you get access to good guided meditations, but those meditations (many series‚Äô are excellent companions towards better manifesting things such as compassion, appreciation, patience, etc) tend to come with some particularly enriching sentiment. 

Where typical guided meditations that offer perspective along with the meditation, that perspective upon deeper consideration tends to be shallow, ultimately taking shortcuts to arrive at some commentary which *sounds profound* yet really lacks true depth at meaningful application within one‚Äôs life.
title: Headspace his head over heels the best meditation app I‚Äôve used

review: I used to have this app back in 2020 because I was having trouble sleeping and I was going through a lot of anxiety and other things at the time and this was a great app to use, it had great meditation sessions, it had great sounds to help me go to sleep and all that stuff but now that I‚Äôve re-downloaded it it‚Äôs absolutely awful. You literally have to pay for EVERYTHING. Which I find ridiculously inconvenient because right now it‚Äôs 1:35 AM and I have to go to work later today and I cannot sleep at all, I‚Äôve taken four melatonin gummy‚Äòs, I‚Äôve taken a bath and I‚Äôve drink tea and none of that is working. so I was just thinking I wonder what could help me go to sleep and then I remembered this app and I re-downloaded it being super excited because I was like I remember how great of an app this was and I don‚Äôt remember why I ever deleted it in the first place and I‚Äôm just so excited because it‚Äôs going to help me with all the stress and anxiety I‚Äôve been going through and it‚Äôs really going to help me go to sleep but now that I‚Äôve downloaded it I haven‚Äôt even had it for five minutes and I‚Äôve already deleted it because you have to pay for everything it‚Äôs ridiculous. I miss the way it used to be
title: not what it used to be

review:
There are many tools available to help anyone who puts their mind to easing and alleviating their mind of a bunch of ‚Äúsmall stuff‚Äù. Headspace is one of those tools. Andy, or any of the two female instructors, do an awesome job in guiding you through the meditation process. There are a variety of topics: Happiness, Anxiety Management, Anger Management, and so on, which are featured as courses, ranging from 10-30 sessions, each one being as short as 10 minutes or up to 20. The teachers start each session talking about a certain aspect, a thinking pattern, that applies to the topic in question, which lasts about one to two minutes, as a means of providing a tangible mental visualization to accompany you in the session as it begins.

Aside from these courses, the app features exploring meditation fundamentals such as breathing, visualization, and so on. Q and A sessions, ‚ÄúStart the day‚Äù routines, this app is really, really good. If you want to experience a more guided meditation as opposed to only music accompaniment as featured in ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù, give ‚ÄúHeadspace‚Äù a try. You will not be disappointed!
title: Essential

review:
I used to not be able to fall asleep. My dad had been using Headspace to help him sleep. One night I couldn‚Äôt fall asleep at all. So on a new google in my bedroom he turned on a sleepcast. I immediately fell asleep. This was in November 2021 btw. So my dad saw how much it helped me and bought the subscription because he said it was worth it. So ever since then we got it on my phone and I listen to sleepcasts every night. It IS worth buying the subscription. Dear producers, Thank you so much for Headspace and sleepcasts! You changed my life! ü•π I am so thankful for you! Love, Unicorncandy444 PS. There is one slight bug which is that it won‚Äôt let me add friends. It won‚Äôt let my dad either. (Update: Thank you! You fixed the bug!)
(Update 2: There is a new bug where my sleepcast plays for a minute and then turns off and kicks out the app by itself. I have tried kicking out the app myself, powering off my phone and turning off my wifi. It isn‚Äôt working no matter what! Please fix this! This is the only way I can sleep nicely. üòî)
title: Changed my life.

review: I‚Äôve worked with the headspace app for over a year and it has been absolutely life changing. I‚Äôve wanted to learn more about meditation for a long time but haven‚Äôt been able to connect with an appropriate teacher. The lessons and stories that have been created in this app (and that continue to be added) are simply wonderful. Easy to follow, supportive, compassionate, mind expanding, and even funny! I work with the parents and kids section every night with my grade schoolers, practicing breathing exercises and listening to stories while we gently (and quickly!) fall asleep. The two areas of my life that have improved significantly since beginning work with this app have been stress reduction (I‚Äôve learned to manage myself throughout the day) and improved sleep quality (it‚Äôs just so much easier for us all to fall asleep now). Thank you THANK YOU for creating this incredible plethora of calm and wisdom. It‚Äôs a joy and immense privilege to pay for this and work with these guided meditations every day. üíö
title: Life changing

review: personally, i love this app. the meditations are really helpful for my crippling anxiety, and i thoroughly enjoy watching the daily videos and doing the mindfulness moments. i also really like the new updated version with the dark mode and everything. however, i‚Äôm not as happy with headspace as i thought i would be when i got the app. i‚Äôm still a kid, and i‚Äôm not going to spend money to get headspace+, so i‚Äôve had the normal version, however i‚Äôm very disappointed about the lack of content i have unlocked. i can only do a few meditations and they‚Äôre limited. this is very upsetting to me, and i‚Äôve heard that others have felt the same way. i‚Äôm considering deleting headspace for exactly this reason: there‚Äôs not enough free content. soon enough i will run out of meditation sessions. i am not satisfied with this app. PLEASE unlock more content for those who don‚Äôt want or CANT spend money on headspace+!!!! you might lose this costumer to your app for just that reason. i need more content because my anxiety lately has been through the roof, so i would be excited to try out some new meditations but i CANT. please fix this!!!!!
title: Ok but could be better

review: This app has helped me tremendously in just a few days of usage.   I am in my mid 40s married with a child and owner of a small family business.     The stress of trying to keep up, being a addict (past) and trying to just live today is really hard to grasp. I do go to church weekly, pray daily, believe in my spirituality.   Yet with all this going on I felt I was missing something.    A void.   Im beyond grateful for every breathe every day but there was a void that I couldn‚Äôt grasp.   Headspace is helping me find that balance to help me become aware of who I am, my purpose and the direction I need to go.    Yes it can be costly but there is a great deal going on now.    Listen, if you feel empty at times, lost or very alone, this app can help.    We all grow and change over time but one thing remands.   Our breathing.   That is constant throughout.    This will help you center your breathing and give you meaning to who you truly are.   Def recommend and could be life changing.   Awareness is key and this app will help you achieve that
title: Centered

review:
Update: The app now works in landscape view!  I‚Äôm very pleased. I still use Headspace every day.  

Previous: This app has great content, but it doesn‚Äôt work in landscape view on an iPad. I got around this by turning my iPad on its side using the keyboard as a stand. With a more recent update, though, when I do this, the app is completely upside down‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt turn with the iPad like most apps do. This is frustrating as I prefer using it with my iPad for a larger viewing screen. It‚Äôs essentially asking people to turn their laptop on end to use a particular app. For most apps, not having landscape view is an automatic delete for me. I really love Headspace, but it‚Äôs useless if it‚Äôs upside down. It works best for viewing for my keyboard to be on the right, screen on the left. I hope they fix this feature. Just let it work in landscape view, please, so I don‚Äôt have to turn my keyboard on end. Or at least let it be upright in portrait view, no matter which end is up.
title: Great Content But the App Needs to be Fixed
developerResponse: {'id': 26461909, 'body': 'We truly do appreciate you and we understand this issue. Thank you so much for your feedback, we hope to come around to this in the near future. ', 'modified': '2021-11-24T20:41:53Z'}

review: I have read from others that this app is complicated and has changed over the last couple of years. It is very difficult to navigate. I made an appointment for an intake video session but then could not find, or even got an email, confirming this appointment. The app timeline said I still needed to make an appointment even though I already had. Due to the complicated app I cancelled my subscription to it and left comments that reflect exactly what I say above. This cancellation was two days before this appointment would take place so I assumed, if there still was some sort of appointment it would also be cancelled. I looked over the app before I deleted from my phone and still, no verification of an appointment that was easily found. Today I was charged $125 for the ‚Äúmissed appointment‚Äù. That is an INSANE AMOUNT OF MONEY to charge in the first place and a terrible way to practice a mental health app!!! This app obviously wants to make money rather than try to figure out a way to make the app easier to navigate for people. If I am going to be charged $125 for a missed appointment I BETTER see the appointment on my front page as soon as I open the app and I sure as heck should receive a confirmation email!!!
title: $125 later‚Ä¶.terrible business ethics

review:
As a long time subscriber, I‚Äôve stayed with Headspace because the content and courses are great. I like the teachers and there‚Äôs a lot of variation with the courses and different focuses (like sleep vs active meditation!). 

The app itself has gone from great to a mess. The layout and organization has changed many times and unfortunately I find each revision to be worse than the previous. It‚Äôs harder than ever to find simple guided meditations. Everything is hidden behind guides, articles, and videos now. Even picking up the next phase of a meditation course you‚Äôve already started is not easy to find. The today tab is filled with things you didn‚Äôt add, the explore tab is a confusing collection of topics that takes several taps to get to any real content, and the biggest call to action on your account tab is to invite others. Like how is anyone supposed to find regular meditations without getting lost or dealing with decision overload? I really want to keep this app but each year they make it harder to use. And now there‚Äôs workouts thrown into the mix? Is Headspace not for me anymore?
title: Great content, app is becoming a mess
developerResponse: {'id': 37517577, 'body': "We appreciate your feedback and will make sure it is heard by our team.  We're sorry to hear you are not enjoying the new app layout.  If you have any further thoughts or suggestions, please send our team an email at:  Help@Headspace.com", 'modified': '2023-07-06T15:34:00Z'}

review: I was very vague on the definition of meditation before I downloaded this app. As a Marine, I wish I had discovered it sooner, quite frankly. It fundamentally breaks down and Guedes the user in the basic techniques of meditation, much as an instructor would go over the basics of a martial arts maneuver. Through the basics set, I was able to recognize a major benefit of meditation. Then I started getting into the targeted meditation courses, and let me tell you something: I honestly believe that this program should become an integral part of the VA‚Äôs Mental Health program. Combat Veterans, those dealing with PTSD, those dealing with an array of problems from substance abuse to codependency, could benefit MASSIVELY from integrating this app into the treatment regimen. It has already made an enormous impact on my life, and as I become more skillful with it, I notice a directly proportionate advance in many areas of my life, including focus, productivity, and general mental health. ABSOLUTELY recommend. Well done, Headspace team, and THANK YOU. -Semper Fidelis Pete Gamel
title: Should be recommended by the VA

review:
Not every technique works equally well for everyone, and I feel like they put an over emphasis on the body scan (which is admittedly one I‚Äôm not particularly fond of). They have courses like ‚Äúdealing with anxiety‚Äù or ‚Äúmanaging anger‚Äù, but they‚Äôre all essentially the same: ‚Äúhere‚Äôs some basic advice you‚Äôll get from every therapist for 30 seconds, now let‚Äôs do 20 minutes of body scan.‚Äù I don‚Äôt feel like they really apply the meditation to the issues often enough, but the advice is decent.

Also, in the beginners courses they mention a lot of abstract concepts that are supposed to help you but they don‚Äôt explain them very well or reinforce them very often. So half the time I find myself thinking ‚ÄúWait, what does he mean by that again and how was I supposed go about it?‚Äù 

There are enough great meditation pointers though that it‚Äôs been super helpful to get over some hurdles I was struggling with and the voices are very relaxing. Unfortunately the content is a bit sparse given how much stuff they have posted and it can be difficult finding the gems when there‚Äôs so much filler to wade through.
title: Was hoping for more

review:
A really robust app with loads of great content in the way of the daily videos and the mini sermons before a meditation. I like that this app helps me to maintain my practice. I can visually see my consistency when using the app as opposed to meditating independently which makes it easier and more fun. However a HUGE drawback is that this app is really terrible for mindfulness. There is entirely WAYYYY too much ‚Äúguidance‚Äù and talking during the meditations. There should be a setting to turn off or reduce the amount of interruptions in the meditation session. All I want is to get a chime when I reached my target meditation time. 

My work around is that I listen to the sermon at the start of the daily meditation, then I turn the volume all the way down so I can‚Äôt hear the guide, then I turn on my phone‚Äôs timer, and meditate silently. This way the app still captures the length of my meditation session but I don‚Äôt get constantly pulled out of my meditation. But sometimes I forget to do this and I‚Äôm always irritated. I reach moments of peace and being totally present then the voice interrupts and pulls me out of my peace. Counter-productive.
title: TOO MUCH TALKING

review:
This app is a game changer and is leaps and bounds above anything this accessible to the public that I have seen before. They fixed many bugs I once had issues with. The sleep casts no longer have issues buffering. They also developed important modules for people who have experienced genuinely discouraging situations. 

The UI is amazing, and now that headspace is adding more tracks than we know what to do with it might be wise to have some way of jumping to our favourited tracks in one favourites sleep tab or day favourites tab. For example, water sounds always make me rush to the bathroom, so the sleep tab opening to the plentiful marina-type tracks might not be ideal for me. I know what I like but I end up listening to the same one over and over again because they‚Äôre too spread out for me to remember to listen to them. 

Also, I love the fireplace sounds; great idea. I hope to see all tracks done with all gender voiceover options. Amazing app, keep growing!
title: Amazing but missing something
developerResponse: {'id': 16546248, 'body': 'So sorry to hear of any issues with the Sleepcasts! Please send our team a note at help@headspace.com so we can look into this for you.', 'modified': '2020-07-11T00:04:21Z'}

review:
I tried headspace a few years ago when it was ‚Äòthe new thing‚Äô, but over time stopped using it because work‚Ä¶family‚Ä¶time constraints‚Ä¶ Lately though, the world seems crazy and I found my mind churning on situations I have no control over, really ratcheting up my anxiety. I thought of headspace and the meditation practice that helped calm my mind and decided to try it again. WOW. JUST. WOW. The app has expanded over time to include so many more features: breathing practice, coping strategies, podcasts, personal stories, and of course, terrific meditation practices. A whole daily schedule of short exercises, talks, and meditations - also, *BONUS* nighttime wind-down which helps me fall asleep faster with soothing narrations and sounds. I have to confess though, I‚Äôve listened to ‚ÄòCat Marina‚Äô during the day, just because the cat names and descriptions were so adorable‚Ä¶ha!  :-)

We‚Äôll done, Headspace! This is the one app I‚Äôll always have on my phone. Thank you, from me and my quiet üß†
title: Just what I needed‚Ä¶thanks Headspace

review: Just last year i started to use headspace after witnessing a close friends passing and going to therapy. i was diagnosed with ptsd, anxiety and bipolar. During this time in my life i was extremely overwhelmed with my own emotions and could barely complete or comprehend day to day task. When i had breakdowns i would use headspace to recollect myself and calm down my racing thoughts. i have always been spiritual and into meditation, so finding an app that helps with guided meditation practices and unusual sleeps schedules made me feel good and comfortable. It made me feel like i was getting back to myself. I recently learned in my Psy class that controlled breathing can help with sudden outbursts or breakdowns, as well as meditation. We once did a an activity in class similar to the breathing techniques on headspace and doing this activity made me feel as if i was doing something right within my mental well being since i brought it upon myself to experience the usage of headspace.
title: very helpful!

review: I‚Äôm so glad I bought the year-long subscription to the Headspace app. It‚Äôs been a game changer for me and my sleep troubles that I‚Äôve had for over ten years now. If I start listening to the sleep portion of the app about an hour before bed, then it usually means I‚Äôll have much better sleep that night. I fall asleep fairly easily in the evening, but my anxiety sometimes wakes me up in the middle of the night. On the evenings where I use Headspace to calm my mind down with the radio app of relaxing sounds and/or the night time meditation, I usually am less likely to have anxiety in the middle of the night and am more likely to sleep through the night. Sometimes I‚Äôll use the app in the middle of the night to calm down my mind. This is a very professionally produced app that you can tell is well researched. Before I downloaded this app, I was desperate and was willing to try anything. So glad I did. That and also a weighted blanket. Oh so relaxing.
title: Best Investment Ever for Sleep and Anxiety

review: This app is wonderful for people looking to explore the world of meditation, and understand how to incorporate it into every day life. The sessions are short but incredibly effective. I wish, however, that there were ways to bookmark/favorite certain sessions and even add some to a ‚Äúlisten later‚Äù list. I often find myself scouring to find one I saw a few days earlier but by the time I see it again, it‚Äôs not as relevant. Also, it‚Äôs be awesome if there was a way to see your progress with the app ‚Äî perhaps a chart or analytics page that shows your which type of meditation you lean towards, how many days you‚Äôve listened, or something to help visualize your meditation journey. Lastly, it‚Äôs time for them to update the sleep meditations. I‚Äôve been using this app consistently at night for a few months, maybe even a year now, and it gets a little old. Wish there was some more variation. This app is fantastic though, and I will continue gladly paying for my subscription. I believe in what they are doing and trust that it has been helping me a ton
title: Good but needs some UI enhancements

review: I have been using the Headspace app for about 5 years now.  From the very beginning I felt I was embarking on a magical journey - a journey that would teach me the tools I needed to lift myself out of feelings of constant fear and inadequacy.  Tools that would help me open my heart and mind to new possibilities and a more peaceful and compassionate approach to myself and the world. With the gentle and insightful guidance of Andy and the other practitioners, I feel safe and supported in my efforts to face and walk through difficult times.  I am able to embrace joy and be present for myself, others and my life as it is today.   It is always going to be a daily practice, as it should be, for that is the essence of being in the moment.  I am also thrilled at how Headspace has evolved to include so many different guided topics for meditation as well as adding exercise to the program!  What better way to integrate mind and body.  Thank you all for what you have done to create Headspace and allow it to thrive!  In gratitude,  Pamela Llewellyn
title: I love Headspace !!!

review: I have borderline personality disorder, insomnia, depression, and adhd. I have tried everything! This is the first thing that has worked. I read an article about meditation reconnecting lost neural pathways and producing mood stabilizing neurotransmitters. I have a short attention span with uninteresting things and they do a really good job at teaching focus, relaxation, and connecting the body and mind. I feel empowered. I feel different. I feel happy and content. It has helped bring some regulation and anchorage into my dysregulated lifestyle. It is basically teaching you how to calm down and how to become in touch with yourself. If you feel out of control, you‚Äôre out of touch with yourself. It has also helped significantly with my insomnia. It taught me how to sleep better. If you have a mental health disorder please try this. Especially if u don‚Äôt want to pay for expensive therapy and are looking to self treat. Worth every $. I would pay double for this app.
title: Truly Life changing!!!!!

review:
I‚Äôve used Headspace for pretty much my entire college career. It helped me get through a lot of inner turmoil I had managed to build up in nursing school. Headspace helped me find a very useful outlet to get out some of the negative thoughts, anxiety, and tension I had built up in my mind and body. 

I will say that for users that do not pay for the subscription will find that this app can be very limiting in regards to courses available to them. I think that is what had me cave and utilize the student discount which was very much worthwhile. However, now that I‚Äôm not a student and work in healthcare I think it would be nice if the app offered other discounts outside of the student and workplace realm. This would be one of the reasons I am unfortunately leaving the app and trying others. Discounts to veterans, first responders, teachers, and medical personnel. I think would be very helpful for those in these lines of work as they tend to be very stressful.

Otherwise, fantastic app. Would love to see how this app progresses in the future.
title: Great Meditation App

review:
I always liked the content that Headspace offers: the meditations are well structured, well paced, and the teachers are great. None of that changed. What did change at some point was the apps interface, and the current iteration makes it SO MUCH harder to actually find that content.

Look. I don't need a curated menu of things you think I should do today - maybe for some people it's helpful, but not for me. And I don't need a bunch of arbitrary sounding categories to browse, because they are not intuitive to me, and never seem to map very well onto my actual needs.

What I want is the simplest, most straightforward way to present a collection of things, that is somehow now missing from the app's navigation options: a list. I just want to look at ALL of the courses, in a single list, with no other grouping and no attempts to guess what I am looking for. The absence of such a basic option is, to be honest, incredibly irritating, which is not really a feeling you want to be getting from an app that is supposed to help you achieve piece of mind.
title: Used to be better

review: My adult son has a lot of anxiety. The bad kind that is debilitating. He was about to start a new job and of course, got hisself all worked up and already has a history of insomnia. I told him daily about my Headspace App. I told him, I would pay for him to get it for a year. He kinda was interested but basically blew me off. The next day, his first day at Disney, he heard the the company would give the app to all the cast members! I was so happy. I don‚Äôt think he pursued how to go about any of it and I don‚Äôt think he still has used it. I wish he would because he is already stressing about various things in life and work. He just has a really bad clinical case of anxiety. I‚Äôm going to keep encouraging him but I live in a different state. As far as myself goes. I never have trouble falling asleep anymore. Mow I need to start meditating so hopefully that may help me stay asleep among many other things.
title: I love this app, very similar to a self hypnosis recording I had in the 80‚Äôs

review: This app is the best app I have used, and I love everything about it. I love how the instructors give slow directions. This is a very calming app for first time use. I have not found a single other app that makes me feel comfortable with myself. It‚Äôs so calming and it helps me focus on my mindfulness. I think this is a great app for some people with insecurities, headspace makes me feel like I can be who I want to be and not have any stress on my shoulders. This isn‚Äôt a bot review, I live for this app and if you use this often you most definitely will be able to change your mindset completely. I started putting my feelings out on my journey and this has been an awesome experience with this app. I think this has helped me tap into my good side and improved me a lot. Yes, today is my first day but I still feel the same about it. This is a really nice meditation app if your looking for something to help calm yourself. I 10/10 recommend it!üòåüòÆ‚Äçüí®
title: This app is amazing.

review:
Have been using this app for years, since 2017. It has completely changed the way I manage my anxiety. Not only do they have a course for anxiety, but there are also SOS meditations that are super helpful when you‚Äôre in the middle of panic mode. Since I first got the app they have added so many new meditations, courses, and even instructors. It has grown with me as my meditation practice has grown and it is always a great day when I use the Headspace app. 
As far as the price it is definitely on the expensive side. I first started using the app when I was in college and was lucky to be in a financial situation where I could afford it. I know they are offering it for free to those who have been affected by the coronavirus. However, my one critique is that they should make a student version, so more people will have access to this life-changing app. 
Thank you Headspace for this amazing product! I will continue to be a customer for many more years, I am sure.
title: Changed My Relationship With Anxiety

review:
Where do I start? This has changed my life in the best way I can ever imagine! I deal with a lot and i mean a lot (depression, anxiety, stress, etc & the year 2020). I was in such an uncomfortable place with myself  like i wasnt happy with myself, and i was my worst enemy and then I found Headspace on Netflix and I thought why not. I was never good with mediation I‚Äôve tried it before and I thought it was a waste of my time, but wow was i wrong with this. It‚Äôs so much different and then i found the app and everyday i mediate! I‚Äôve been working on my anger, my depression, focusing on me. Being kind to me and I‚Äôm telling you this has helped me so much. Each recording is about 10 - 15 minutes and Andy walks you through the mediation, helps you to focus on what you need to take care of yourself. 
If you‚Äôre having trouble with yourself or feeling like things dont go your way, please try this. Honestly I haven‚Äôt had a day where I‚Äôm feeling uncomfortable with myself or feeling depressed. It‚Äôs worth it
title: Life changing!!

review:
Updated October 2023:
Seriously! Please stop moving stuff around and just adding more and more fluff. My kid and I got in a nice nightly habit of doing the daily meditation. It has just‚Ä¶ disappeared with the last update. But, sweet, I can wade through thousands of other offerings to try to find something short and applicable. It would also be nice to be able to filter by ‚Äòvoice‚Äô since I really prefer Andy‚Äôs. 

Have used the app for years and have been happy to pay for it. But it is starting to get bloated and perhaps a victim of its own success. There is so much extraneous content that it‚Äôs hard to actually find what you know has been great for you in the past. I feel like the extra ‚Äúcelebrity‚Äù content is pretty cheesy and takes away from the app but I could handle it if things were better organized. Then I wouldn‚Äôt have to wade through all the fluff. So, still like the app and find Andy‚Äôs voice sedating (in a good way) but I truthfully liked it a lot better a few years ago.
title: Please stop moving things around and/ organize it better!
developerResponse: {'id': 39507459, 'body': "Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback with us!
