Our intention is not to stray away from what makes Headspace so special and unique. If anything, our hope is to continue offering a variety of beneficial content and topic areas to help our members find mindfulness in all areas of their lives.  If you have any suggestions or additional feedback for us, please send our support team an email at help@Headspace.com.", 'modified': '2023-10-14T06:56:02Z'}

review:
I have been using the app for maybe 4 weeks and I am completely new to meditation. I have tried tapping. For the simple reason. It is very hard for me to stay still and try and clear my head and not have thoughts. So I believed tapping would be easier since I do a movement as I putting positive thoughts into the movement. Don‚Äôt get me wrong I love tapping. But I also know meditation has great benefits. So I really really want to be somewhat able to master or be able to also meditate. I feel like this app really really helps understand you can have thoughts. And how to control them and stay focus and keep moving forward in your 10 mins of meditation. 

Again I am a beginner. But I am truly enjoying it and I keep waking up in the am and being drawn to opening the app and start doing my little breath work exercise and then the next and then the next. Lol

It just makes me want to keep moving forward. GREAT app. So far üí™üèΩ
title: Beginner

review: I want more! New longer guided meditations .. I like the packs that build over months.. make you feel more connected and more accomplished. I like the idea that we‚Äôre practicing and learning because it still feels new to me after a couple years. I‚Äôd like a pack that is a daily life meditation that focuses on learn how and what meditation is, the natural ups and downs of mood and feelings and that helps connect us to our personal peace. Love this app and my meditation time! I tend to re-do the packs .. so I need to look a little deeper into this app there might be something I‚Äôm missing. I wish they taught this in school would have been very useful! Everyone should have this! Fantastic life tool! Only issue I have is the cost, my app automatically renews at the highest price but then my news feed I see it for half the price! I think renewing customers should get a discount for it! Anyway, Thank for helping me with my Headspace!
title: It‚Äôs great

review:
I was skeptical when someone recommended this to me, but I figured it was worth a shot. When I downloaded this app, I quickly discovered all that it had to offer. Anywhere from waking up exercises, to wind down bedtime meditations, this app has it all. It has courses for meditations, and even starts you out at beginner level‚Ä¶ if you‚Äôre like myself and never have truly dabbled in meditation, look no further. This app has it all, give it a shot! 

I would like to add they have excellent sleepscape sounds, beautifully narrated stories told in gentle soothing tones, sleep courses, self-esteem courses, even mindfulness activities for your day to day life (or night). (For example, mindful eating, mindful brushing teeth‚Ä¶yes! Really!) 

I‚Äôm so happy I was told about this app, I have a year subscription and I couldn‚Äôt feel more confident putting my money toward something I know works for me and others. I‚Äôve seen it, and I feel it!
title: Worth a shot!

review:
I am having my COVID shot the next day and REALLY wanted to have a nice sleep before that. I took one meditation session before going to bed in headspace. As usual, it worked nicely BUT when I reached to my phone to close the app, a pop up message showed up saying ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt sleep? Try our new sleepcast‚Äù it immediately triggered my anxiety of afraid of losing sleep, and I wasn‚Äôt able to sleep that night and had to cancel my COVID shot appointment. 
This is really disappointing from a meditation app as this kind of message can easily trigger someone who‚Äôs already anxious (and those are often the users of headspace). Especially this is an in-app pop up that you cannot disable in the iOS system setting. 
I am not sure why this message will show up at that time and I don‚Äôt want to assume bad intentions (after all Headspace had helped me quite a lot and I am thankful). Please stop sending these kinds of anxiety-triggering messages or at least allow us to disable them!

From a 5-year customer.
title: Please stop those anxiety-triggering pop-up messages!

review:
This app can change your life if you let it. Just over three years ago, I used this app to meditate daily for six months. It‚Äôs the right blend of gamification and psychology. Once you get on a bit of a streak, it reinforces the desire to keep it going, which is exactly what you need if you‚Äôre new to mindfulness and meditation. The life lessons of that six month period never left. To this day, I have a situational awareness that I simply did not possess prior.

Which is why I‚Äôve returned. Life moves quickly. I feel like I am struggling with several priorities. It had such a positive effect last time, I am curious to see what it can do for me this time. I know it won‚Äôt be the same. The app has changed‚Ä¶ I have changed lol‚Ä¶

Headspace provides all the flexibility of an app, and the structure of a guided practice of meditation. No shame. No guilt. One of the few things in life where taking the easy path can be deeply rewarding.
title: Life changing‚Ä¶

review: I came across HeadSpace doing research for an assignment for grad school. At the time, the price tag was intimidating; it still is, but it is absolutely worth it. It really has helped me calm my anxiety enough where I can get sleep. It had gotten to the point where just hearing certain words in Andy‚Äôs soothing voice was an automatic trigger for my body and it instantly knew what to do. I love that there is a library of meditations to chose from depending on situation and time you have. I really utilize the soundscapes at night to fall asleep to, but one frustration I have with the soundscapes is that they are only TWO options of running time to chose from - either 45 minutes OR 8 hours‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs no in between or the ability to choose how long you‚Äôd like the soundscape to run for. For that reason, I had knocked off one star. It is definitely worth downloading and trying. It became such an important tool for my mental health during quarantine and I am grateful for that.
title: Really Has Helped

review: I love the app for its content and its ability to increase my focus via the soundscapes. However; if you want to listen to anything on the computer while listening to one of these soundscapes you will find that there is no independent audio adjustment to dial the background sounds relative to other audio sources. (The volume adjustment is only achieved via apple's global adjustment and it means that Headspace will often play the background noise at non-background levels). I believe incorporating this feature would greatly improve this app's functunality for people who mainly use its productivity based content in noisy environments. Also, if there was a lightweight three band EQ as well that would allow users to really dial a nice seperation between foreground and background audio. (both features could be hidden in a advanced audio toggle in the settings icon in the playback window to keep the interface looking lightweight).
title: Great App: 2 features away from 5 stars...

review: So when I first started headspace I didn‚Äôt know if this app was for me but when I looked more into it the ratings were really good so I downloaded it and first I did meditation üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è it was my first time and meditation helped me clear my head the I tried sleep noises and that was great it helped me fall asleep faster and usually I have trouble sleeping also meditation can also help you sleep and every thing else was a 5 out of 5 in my opinion and meditation the sleep noises it was all really good  and this kept popping up it said rate this app and write a review so the first couple of times I ignored it but then since the app was really good I decided to write a review and rate it and I gave it five out of five so I highly recommend this app for every one ‚òùÔ∏è and I even recommend for the kids who would like to do headspace and have trouble calming down so this is my review I hope you like this app as much as I  doüôÉü§óüëç
title: This is amazing

review:
I‚Äôm still fairly young, 24 years old, but in my life so far I‚Äôve acquired a lot of emotional stress. Clinical anxiety and depression, mostly stemming from trauma. But also just becoming aware of aging and time. Cosmologically feeling small and insignificant, that life is pointless. Existential anxiety has seemed to take hold of my mind every day, exacerbating the anxiety and depression I already suffer from. 

This app is something I‚Äôm truly grateful for. (Along with the series they recently added on Netflix!) More than aware there‚Äôs no cure or abolition of negative thoughts and feelings in their entirety. Realizing it‚Äôs all part of the human condition and important to learn how to be aware and navigate stress. Headspace is easy to use and perfectly introduces meditation to people like me who never thought they needed it. Especially when it comes to attention/focus, the guided meditation is exceptional. The interface is clean and smoothly designed. I can‚Äôt recommend this enough!
title: Incredible tool for mindfulness

review: I first heard of this app when Ryan Reynolds mentioned using it to manage his anxiety. On a whim, I downloaded the free trial and, wow, I was hooked immediately. Been worth every penny. Calms me down with all the different graphics, breathing exercises, and short videos. It's not "woo woo" and no one is "talking at you" or "preaching" - it's all just so good. And the sleepcasts of nature sounds and being talked thru calming scenes get me to sleep every time which is amazing. I watch short videos about re-potting plants, molding clay etc. - who knew how effective this stuff is, but man it works. All I can say is, whoever created this app Really Understands anxiety and knows how to address it. Love getting a new "menu" each day & I can save favorites to come back to. And Andy is a guy who can talk anyone down off the ledge - thank you to him! This app is worth every penny to stress-cases like me. Subscribe, you won't regret it!
title: Game changer APP for anxiety, insomnia

review:
Quality: The app never glitches, the content is bountiful and inspires curiosity of oneself and the world around. I‚Äôve had this app for over a year now. It is the only yearly subscription worthy of my money from the App Store. I‚Äôm glad I had this when COVID hit. 

Benefit: These meditation courses and singles have been a life saver for my gifted 10yr old daughter working through PTSD in therapy from trauma. Through the kid section she has learned how to use her breath, and at night, calming sounds or stories to help keep her brain wandering into negative places. She has even worked her way through the grieving courses to help her cope with COVID closing our schools. Her understanding of coping skill usage has increased exponentially and has learned awareness of her feelings in her body.

But, I too have benefited. Without this training, I would have a hard time helping my daughter. Aside from that, the app has reminded me about how to be my creative self again. From gently progressing meditation courses to the video and clever animation shorts that help you to understand foundational concepts, I am feeling enjoyment in my life no matter where I am or what is happening. My favorite treat is the morning wake up video shorts. They range from the wonders of nature to affirming financial struggles. The saguaro cactus video has been my favorite. 

Headspace team, can the app have access to the library of these morning video shorts?
title: Great Quality for Mental Health

review:
Headspace is fine; they have a pretty good product. Make sure to cancel your subscription right away during the trial, because when that time is up they WILL charge you $70, or whatever the price is, and all indications are that they will not refund it. I used the app one time and proceeded to forgot entirely about it for the next seven days (had a busy week). Then came the $70 charge for the yearly subscription. Whoops. I know, I know. I messed up, but most subscription services are reasonable about these things nowadays. I thought, ‚Äúit‚Äôs Headspace, not an AOL trial on a CD that came in the mail inside of a cardboard sleeve, or some kind of sketchy video service with exotic dancers and livestock. My girlfriend‚Äôs mom uses headspace! How risky could it be? I will remove this review if my payment is refunded, but ultimately I am still disappointed with Headspace. If they don‚Äôt refund the money then that first 3 minute meditation will have cost $70, because the thought of Headspace will stress me out too much to meditate. Please, don‚Äôt be as naive and careless as me. Seven Day Free Trial‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt do it.
<update> Surprise‚Ä¶ they refused to reverse the transaction. Lame.
title: 7 Day Free Trial‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt do it

We are sorry to hear this is not the experience you were hoping for. review: I have dabbled in self-guided meditation before downloading Headspace, and having this app has been a game changer in so many different parts of my life. I fall asleep faster by listening to the sleepcasts religiously every night. I focus better at work using the brilliantly realistic nature soundscapes (I find other soundscapes overly dramatic and more distracting than soothing, but these are perfect). I listen to focus playlists when I walk my dogs. Since one of my dogs has leash aggression, our walks used to be stressful, frustrating, and an activity I dreaded. Now, I do a walking meditation the whole time and things go so much better. My dog still freaks out at other dogs, but I‚Äôm much better at remaining calm and redirecting him. I love the wide variety of things Headspace has to offer. It all fits so seamlessly into every kind of activity I do. It is worth every penny. Thank you, Headspace, for making such an incredible and accessible meditation app.
title: a life-enriching app

review: I‚Äôve recommended Headspace to countless people over the years but am disappointed with all the recent updates. Missing the days when Headspace was a clean and simple space that didn‚Äôt try to be anything other than what it was (a meditative respite). I look forward to the mindful moment notification every day, but now I keep on getting push notifications for working out within the app or to watch a new video with some influencer I couldn‚Äôt care less about. The only notification I have turned on is for mindful moments and I still keep on getting these other notifications even though there‚Äôs nothing mindful about them. Please Headspace, stop trying to be like every other app with your incessant notifications and suggestive design, and go back to being the app we all loved you for in the first place. Every UX redesign has made navigation worse, and it‚Äôs clear that the intent has been to get people to stay on the app for longer (i.e. the opposite of being present).
title: Used to be better

review: I only come here to write a review about Sayana app, but, Headspace bought it already. Using Sayana app makes me feel relaxing whenever I encountered stresses. I love the narrator‚Äôs voice when she talks to me. The background music, the stories, the tips that i learn after every check-in are super helpful! All the stresses seem to be ok the moment i opened the app. It eases my mind right away.  I‚Äôm an user who already tried many different apps relating to mental health and meditation, however Headspace and Calm did not reach me deeply as much as Sayana did.I don‚Äôt have the same engagement level as i did with Sayana. It‚Äôs sad to me that the company is bought and will be joined with Headspace. We all know when a company is bought, its original path will not be the same. However, i hope Headspace won‚Äôt disappoint me after acquiring Sayana. Keeping Sayana‚Äôs unique characteristics should be the priority in a long term. Sincerely,
title: Headspace + Sayana

review:
I‚Äôve used headspace for 2 years and it was okay. 
I used them first through apple and when I wanted to cancel, they offered me a deal and I thought I was still through apple. 2 months ago, I got the only email notification that my account would be renewed. I tried to cancel through apple and it wasn‚Äôt there and then through the app which gave no access to my account. After a few attempts, I put it to the side and it was forgotten about‚Ä¶ that is till today when I was charged. I immediately reached out and then discovered there was a headspace website that was the only place I could cancel. I reached out and explained my issue and they refused to refund me. $70 for an app I haven‚Äôt used in months. They refused to assist me or refund me. It‚Äôs very disappointing because I did think it was helpful but it only seems that they are money hungry and greedy. For an app that based on a religious and spiritual practice, they are very unkind and inconsiderate to their members. Also, there is no customer service number. Only email. They refused to let me speak to someone else.
title: They don‚Äôt remind you of upcoming charges!

review: When I first downloaded the app, I had to sign up and submit my email in order to even start using the app. Then, there was a simple breathing exercise they had you do right off the bat, followed by a question of how the the breathing exercise made you feel and what you wanted to focus on in improving your ‚Äúheadspace‚Äù. After answering those questions, a main page popped up which I would assume is like the home page of an app and it shows you different course like objectives for you to complete in the morning, afternoon, and evening. There were even specialized courses for getting better sleep and for focusing on certain things specifically such as anxiety, stress, worries, and depression. Unfortunately, I rated it so low because you had to pay for all of it!! I immediately deleted the app before doing the one week free trial. All I wanted to do was focus on my mental health and I was really excited because the app seemed to be really cool. Of course, I got my hopes up and was deceived yet again with the high cost of the payment plan.
title: Smart Idea, But Not Worth It!!
developerResponse: {'id': 35448824, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your feedback and experience with us! we would definitely take it to improve our members' experience, we hope to see you back soon, in the meantime, you can check out our free content available on our social channels. \r\n", 'modified': '2023-03-17T19:56:17Z'}

review: I highly recommend the paid version of the Headspace app for anyone who would like to give meditation and mindfulness a try. I have‚Äôt been perfectly consistent with it yet I still feel it has helped me to become calmer and more optimistic and to sleep better at night. As an added bonus, the app offers some absolutely delightful nature videos, as well as an uplifting daily video feature called  The Wake-Up. There is a LOT of content in this app, with meditation courses and short videos for a large variety of life situations. I recently lost my father and my sister, and I benefited from the courses on grief and sudden loss. I started a mindfulness practice as a treatment for depression, and later started using this app in order to improve my consistency in practicing. I notice a difference in how I feel even if I only meditate for 10 minutes a day.
title: Excellent choice for giving meditation a try

review: Love the app but your PR using racial and gender political agenda starts to get annoying. Can you guys pls stick to meditation / related areas and not try to push politics, agendas and ideologies on what justice is and what it is not? (A lot of the ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù ideas pushed on society by ultra leftists that are actually destroying the left as a valid movement (and only give more power to the right), actually result in ‚Äúinjustice‚Äù overall so really hope you guys are not going to be part of that (just dig in a bit deeper and dont follow the herd w/o thinking pls). Yes, it is a trend but dont try to ‚Äúlook good‚Äù as a company using this stuff. Also, a lot of people who meditate are not dumb and understand the absurdities being pushed by the authoritarian ultra left (that destroys the actual liberal left) so you do not want to align yourself with that movement. Please Headspace - stay sane :)
title: Love the app but your PR using ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù and racial/gender agenda starts to get annoying
developerResponse: {'id': 28616864, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the trouble. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.\r\n", 'modified': '2022-03-16T20:36:22Z'}

review: My Dr prescribed medication for my anxiety. Not wanting to take drugs, I asked her if I could see a therapist instead and work on my ptsd with other means. She agreed but wanted to see me in a month to see if there were any improvements. My therapist suggested that I try some meditation classes, so I did. It was only four sessions but I learned how important it was for my mind and body. I started reading books on boundaries and ptsd. Than I read the reviews on this app. I first thought it was too expensive so I moved on. I looked at others but always came back to this one. Was I worth this and more important, would it work for me? I can honestly say that this app has changed my life. I hope you find something that works for you. Oh and my Dr was and still is very impressed with my growth. I will never not have ptsd but I now more than ever feel that I can live with it a lot better.
title: Life Changing

review: Headspace is fine and it definitely has some interesting videos with insights from experts, but all of their mediations are the same. They have the same structures and the same repeated phrases even (having been through three different courses all having the same meditations, I can recite it by memory now: tune into your body, listen to the sounds around you, now tune back into your body, do a body scan, focus on your breath, now count your breaths, just for a second let your mind go where it wants to, now come back to your body and the space). It‚Äôs a little frustrating to be honest. If I‚Äôm doing a series on sleep then I‚Äôd like to have a mediation fitted to that rather than a one size fits all mentality (which really REALLY doesn‚Äôt work for mediation, at least not with me). Like I said, I appreciate some of the other things it has to offer, but since it is a mediation app and the mediations are all the same AND YOU HAVE TO PAY FOR IT? Not worth it. Hope this helps someone.
title: All Mediations the Same
developerResponse: {'id': 35618320, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your feedback; We apologize for any bad experience you've experienced with Headspace, we're constantly making updates based on feedback such as yours, and I'll make sure your feedback is shared with the right team. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.\r\n", 'modified': '2023-03-27T18:54:00Z'}

review: Meditation used to be a daily practice for me. I got very busy with a consuming career. The headspace app has helped me get back on track and keep to a routine. Additionally, it has so much more to offer besides just guided meditations. The courses, the music, the uplifting stories, the sleep cast, and the morning breathing exercise are wonderful! I especially love the sleepcast.I fall asleep to it at the beginning every night since I started using the app. I listened through it during the day just to hear what happens after the breathing exercise since I‚Äôve been asleep by then. It has been interesting to notice how much my mind wanders during meditation after not meditating as a daily practice for several years. I am noting and know from experience that with practice I will be more present. I have only been using this app for a week but I already feel a difference. There is an inner calm.
title: So helpful

review:
The last several large updates to the app have made navigation incredibly annoying and unintuitive. It‚Äôs more difficult to find what you need. It‚Äôs more difficult to easily resume a series. The autoplay when you do go into a series is frustrating with no way to prevent it. The app no longer correctly shows downloaded content, and favorites aren‚Äôt accurately displayed on the meditation/series page when you load one you have previously favorited. If you manage to find where they moved the overall favorites section (hint: now it‚Äôs at the top of the home page in a spot you are not likely to even look), then everything is listed correctly.

I love using the app (prior to these poorly designed changes), but it feels like nobody working on it actually uses it themselves at this point. What was once simple and straightforward is now convoluted and frustrating. I‚Äôd happily raise this review level if the app ever returns to a more polished state, but the current direction does not seem like this will be the case.
title: App updates have been a net-negative

review: I have been sober for coming up close ton3 years now and I work a 12 step program in AA. One of the biggest aspects of my program is staying in the moment, feeling feelings, validating them, and letting them pass. Life can get so overwhelming that I forget to use healthy coping skills and this app is a great way to help me stay on that path. I use it in the morning as a routine to set the tone for my morning. I notice a huge difference when I am not able to meditate in the morning before all of the chaos starts. I just love this app. I love how there is a section for different types of people and situations, like kids. I have shown my kids little clips from this app. I learned the ‚Äúblow out the candle‚Äù technique for my son from this app and it has been a game changer. Love it. I would give it more than 5 stars if I could. Definitely worth the price!
title: Great addition to my 12 step program!

review:
‚Äúthis is not fair at all because my subscription was canceled IMMEDIATELY after signing up just as the directions said on the HEADSPACE WEBSITE. i cannot believe how much of a disgrace y‚Äôall are to the mental health industry. it makes no sense as to why i can‚Äôt get a refund when i canceled my subscription. y‚Äôall are actually SICK & obviously care nothing about mental health. this is not an inconvenience, it‚Äôs a direct slap in the face to your consumers. you guys are robbing people that WORK LIKE A DOG DAY AND NIGHT FOR PENNIES & IN SCHOOL TRYNA MAKE ENDS MEET W NO FAMILY ALONE. i have to use ALL the little money i have for gas to get to and from work. Thankfully I have EBT so i can eat. so now my cell phone will be off & i won‚Äôt be able to use the app even if i tried. i have no other device to use or wifi so please do me ONE favor & just cancel the whole account,  i‚Äôll never use the app again. no need to respond, you can close the ticket. 

thanks a lot joel, you were no help AT ALL. may yahweh bless you anyway. ‚Äú

this is a copy of an email i sent. i do not recommend this app to anyone. the 30 day guest pass is a SCAM.
title: will not refund even if subscription was canceled

review: Not only is Headspace an app with amazingly accessible tools over a wide range of individually-applicable topics, but they are adding things all the time and extremely active in keeping the app up-to-date with current situations and circumstances in the world on a general level. The Daily Wake Up is something I do on a regular basis, as well as the Sleepcasts (I personally love Rainday Antiques, Sandy Cove Cottage, and Midnight Launderette, to name a few of the ones that have been around for the longest (like I said, they‚Äôre always adding content) In one capacity or another I‚Äôm using this app on pretty much a daily basis, definitely worth a shot if you‚Äôre looking at getting some non-gimmicky help! As it says it doesn‚Äôt substitute therapy but honestly it definitely helps take the edge off. (PS an app to look into for mental health in addition to this one is WoeBot, for anyone interested)
title: EXTREMELY well done and thought through

review: I love using the Headspace sleep stores to fall asleep to. The soundscapes are fantastic as well, although I wish I could have more selection options other than 45 minutes or 500 minutes. I‚Äôve found that I like to set ambience sounds to 180 minutes. 45 minutes isn‚Äôt quite enough but 500 is too long and the sound eventually wakes me back up. I haven‚Äôt found that to be the same with the sleep stories and I love that I can choose how loud I want the ambience or the voice to be. I used to have a subscription to Calm and I loved the sleep stories and ambience but the meditations didn‚Äôt work well for me. I just tried the Letting Go of Stress course, episode 1 and I really enjoy having the calm visual play on the screen which gives me something to focus on. I can‚Äôt wait to continue that course and many others! I definitely recommend this app.
title: Helps with sleep!

review: I use it basically all day every day. I love the sleep casts and sleep music in the background when I‚Äôm wrapping up my day, and the soundscapes really help with my insomnia. In the mornings I put on some focus music while I attend my online university classes. If I have time in a day I pull out my yoga mat and put on a stretching walkthrough,  a specialized yoga form, or a guided meditation. It really helps me feel more in control of my thoughts and feelings, and I love that it‚Äôs such an easy and simple way to encourage me to move my body when I‚Äôm stuck at home. Even when I‚Äôm having a bad day, Headspace is my go to. I‚Äôve worked through a lot of pent up emotions and automatic negative thoughts with guided meditations, and with the daily meditations I learn a new strategy or life tip every day. This app is basically the little steady calm in the insanity of my busy days. Whether I‚Äôm starting my day or ending it, Headspace is the app I‚Äôm on. I highly recommend!
title: I love this app.

review: This app has a lot of traditionally based vipassana-style meditation, which is very helpful for learning to meditate and gaining its benefits. However, the app has recently uploaded a lot of political content directly supporting movements such as Black Lives Matter and the ideology of critical race theory. It‚Äôs hard to emphasize enough how disastrous of a decision this is. It is reducing the transcendent method of meditation to a mere ideological political tool. Meditation allows you the psychological freedom to see passed concepts that you‚Äôve established unconsciously your whole life and to use that freedom to live deliberately and compassionately with all peoples. Critical race theory attempts to add concepts such as privilege to push you to act in a particular way not necessarily aligned with your deepest intuitions and compassionate motivations. So, it‚Äôs a reduction of what the practice could be (vipassana, insight, and metta, loving-kindness) for the short-term aims of a political ideology. If you are interested in meditation and not politics, I recommend the Waking Up app, which has vipassana and meta meditations as well as dharma lectures from some eminent practitioners. Good luck on your journey!
title: Meditation should transcend politics

review: From socially anxious and feeling that a part of myself was lost to overcoming my self deprecating mindset and finally loving myself, headspace has been my guide through it all. No therapist, self medication/prescriptions, has been able to help me the way that mindfulness meditation has. I cried when my free trial was finished and I continue to buy headspace annually since 2017. I am eternally grateful for this application, it has sincerely been a beacon of hope for me from the beginning. I‚Äôve seen it grow so much in popularity and for good reason, it is the easiest way to learn how to meditate. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without you, Andy. I hold a very special place in my heart for you. Self development, spirituality and love is my main focus in this life thanks to this newfound way of dealing with my neurosis that I have been blessed to have given the opportunity to grow from. ü•∫‚ô•Ô∏èüß†ü´Äü´Å üßòüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèµ
title: Nothing Short of Life Changing.

review: I love the app overal but there is one problem with the family plan. I recently started using the app and I got the 14 day free trial to make sure I liked it and then I canceled it to join the family plan and it would not let me get the family plan so my mom invited me and I tried to except it but the thing said that I had a plan even though I had canceled it and that made me very frustrated so headspace I would like for you to try to fix that! But over this app is awesome and so useful and you should 100% But just saying you will have to pay a few bucks to be able to use all the features of the app. Also headspace let‚Äôs you chose what you want to use it for and you have a day plan we‚Äôre you can basically do a breathing exercise an afternoon lift and a sleep cast and a few more witch I love! So get the app if it seems like you would like it!
title: Awesome but one problem!

review:
Headspace is so much more than an App on my phone. Life feels crazy busy. Uncertainty seems to have been a stronger presence for everyone these days. Headspace is part of my daily practice. I am so glad I was introduced to it and have stuck with it for over a year now. Only missed a couple of days in a year. I find it easy to include one or more headspace sessions into a day. If I haven‚Äôt done one and it comes towards end of day, I want to get it in. I now understand it‚Äôs the building impact. A single session is helpful, but over time I have really noticed the difference and the impact on how I approach each day, each situation. Yes, being aware, being mindful and it has helped me to be more at peace with the ups and downs. More able to enjoy all the good and the bad has less impact. It used to be the other way round. 
Thanks to the team at Headspace, for providing me with some head space each day.
title: The app that is there for you :-)

review: This app has helped me make a habit out of meditating, in a large part because there is a daily meditation that starts off with introducing a new concept or variation for two minutes before getting into it. This has helped me deepen my understanding of the practice, while at the same time giving me a reason to come back day after day, year after year (this is my fourth year as a subscriber). Previously, I was just using the same recording over and over again, which got stale. With Headspace, the experience becomes familiar (in that you go through the same steps every day) while allowing me to develop curiosity by being exposed to the new concepts that help me refine the approach right away (a little like training wheels). Over the years it‚Äôs become routine enough that I can successfully meditate and lead others through meditation without the recordings.
title: Sublime

review: Andy is a wonderful teacher of mindfulness meditation. He artfully teaches the core skills and integrates them into a psychology of care for self and others that can only bring more peace and happiness to you, and through you, to those you love. I have done several headspace packs over more than once until they have become part of my vision for a life that allows for sitting with whatever comes up without letting it get me tangled up and off track. I am a therapist and have been able to teach some of the skills I have learned from Andy‚Äôs recordings to others and have recommended headspace to clients as well as students I teach and  supervise. There are many wonderful meditation resources online but headspace organizes key material in a library of practice that helps you learn and use the skills say by day. Thank you headspace and Andy P!
title: Headspace can change your life for the better

review: I have been using headspace for over a year and a half and I have been amazed. Over the past year I have been going through some personal difficulties, but I could always count on headspace. This is because of Andy‚Äôs soothing voice, the amazing variety, the sleep tab, and many more services headspace offers. I have been a bit disappointed on how they have changed the platform. It is a bit harder to navigate and I don‚Äôt see everything right in front of me. That aside, this app is amazing and definitely worth it. You will fall asleep in minutes, discover new ways you can calm yourself down, and much more! Headspace also brings a great sense of community in the ‚Äúwake up‚Äù, where you get to hear from the community, and the group meditations where you can really feel a sense of community. Headspace has done so much for me and I hope it will help you.
title: AMAZING

review: It‚Äôs not just about helping calm the mind, or helping you work through difficult life challenges. Headspace is about find your inner sense of gratitude, joyfulness, and peace. Helping you to not only live a better life for yourself, but also helping you create more meaningful relationships with other, and in turn helping other in the process as well. But it doesn‚Äôt come instantaneously, the mind is like any other part of your body, if you want it to become skilled at meditation, you need to practice, and headspace is like the best coach, trainer and friend you‚Äôve ever had rolled into one. It cheers you through the good days, and sits with you to ease the mind on the bad days. Headspace is honestly the most unique app I‚Äôve ever seen, and it truly is life changing. Thank you Andy and the entire headspace team for helping people live a bit more mindfully every day.
title: Headspace is a true blessing of an app

review: I do love this app a lot. It is very calming, the selection is pretty big for sleep casts although, paying $75 I feel like it should be expanded a bit more. I have my few favorites and then it‚Äôs like I‚Äôm only listening to the same 5 over and over. They say they slightly change each time you listen but they barely really do. I try others but some just come off as creepy to me lol. So, I would like to see more sleep casts added. More along the lines of the styles of raindrop soaps and salon nights. Also, maybe better ways of navigating them; by voice would be nice since I prefer female voices it would be nice to have a section of just female voices. I would also like to see more added for the kids. More characters for example, as Sesame Street isn‚Äôt very with the times currently. Another app has peppa pig, but I‚Äôm not going to be spending another $75 on another sleep app. All and all it is great, but for the money I feel like you could add just a bit more content.
title: Very nice

review:
I‚Äôve been using Headspace going on close to five years, and I continue to find it so helpful in my life.

When I first started using it, I didn‚Äôt have a lot of money so repeated through the basic courses until I was in a better place financially. Just those basic courses got me on the right track in my life.

Since then, I‚Äôve been a regular subscriber and have continued to find the guidance so inspiring. I‚Äôve been through the Pro courses and many of the other short courses. Even the Everyday Mediation is so impressive with the messages it provides on a daily basis. I completed the Pro series probably a couple years ago. I recently went back to it and can‚Äôt believe how much deeper it all means to me. The teachers have told me that the practice is small steps everyday; there is no doubt to me now how important it is to understand that now.

If you are looking at a meditation app and starting a regular practice, I highly recommend Headspace. My meditation practice has developed into connections and a life that I was seeking a few years ago but wasn‚Äôt sure how to get there. I‚Äôm happy to say that Headspace has been the ideal guide to figure out that journey and am very grateful for my ongoing relationship with all the wonderful teachers and courses the app offers.
title: Still inspiring and meaningful after many years

review: I signed up for a free year of headspace when the pandemic began and have been so impressed by both the app and the quality of the meditation courses and the sleep stories and meditations. I also think that the offer of an entire free year to folks who were financially impacted by the pandemic shows a real concern for mental health beyond pure financial gain from the people behind the company. So far, there have been options for both male and female voices which I appreciate, and I hope to see more diverse voices in the app moving forward. With some new voices on their roster from folks outside of the white community, it looks as though that‚Äôs something they are working towards. It‚Äôs been a valuable tool for me and I will be subscribing when my year runs out. Although it‚Äôs not a cheap subscription, if you can afford it I would definitely recommend.
title: Wonderful experience

review: I got this app in a time of need. Life throws so many things at you and you will always end up in tough times no matter what. Downloading headspace is the single best thing I‚Äôve done for myself ; Meditation is the single best thing I‚Äôve done for myself. This app makes it easy - start with guided 5 min sessions. TAKE YOUR TIME. There is no rush whatsoever. The structure of the app is perfect, it guides u threw the foreign practice and eventually you will feel confident to sit alone in unguided meditations & truly deepen the practice. Use this app; follow the learning path; improve your life. Mediation will never fix your problems - it will only allow you to approach them in the most healthy and productive manner. That is where u find peace, that is where u find solace in those moments of pain & anguish. Download this app, learn this practice, change your life. You will never regret it.
title: Read this please

review:
Great app to accompany your day. You have a button at the top left where you can choose the moment of your day: morning, afternoon, evening. With this you get a program for each moment of the day. Great!

Something strange though: on Today‚Äôs page, there is a category called ‚ÄúAlso for your goal‚Äù but there is nowhere where you can define your goal. So every day, for morning, afternoon and evening I have the ‚ÄúSleep‚Äù course. Sleep is not part of my goals so I don‚Äôt know why this course rather than another.

It would be better if I could choose a specific course in the Explore section. In the explore section, there are a lot of interesting courses that need to be studied over several sessions and that I could select for my Today‚Äôs page. There seems that there is no way either to put these courses in my favorites. 

For example if I want to go through the courses ‚ÄúThe shine collection‚Äù or ‚ÄúFor challenging times‚Äù, I have to go every day to the Explorer section and scroll down to the course, before continuing the next video. It seems to me that it would be convenient to select one of these courses and be able to put it on today‚Äôs page as a replacement of the ‚ÄúSleep‚Äù course that I am offered every day.

Still manageable though and it doesn‚Äôt stop me to use the app regularly. It does help me a lot, so thanks for it!
title: Great but something strange

review: I‚Äôm a professional in mental health and have recently decided to become completely sober with alcohol and also make some life changes regarding my nutrition. I‚Äôm about six months sober and I‚Äôve been encouraged by other friends to take a meditation as a means to deal with heavy emotions that alcohol was suppressing in the past. I have to say that the headspace app has been a life change for me. I fallen in love with meditation and meditate now about 3 to 4 times a day. I just completeThe NV and jealousy meditation for this morning and it was amazing. I‚Äôm excited for this new chapter in my life and his journey that meditation is going to help weed me down. I‚Äôve also introduced my 10-year-old son to meditation. He currently plays at a high-level golf and is utilizing meditation in order to navigate through stressful situations while on the golf course. Thank you so much headspace!
title: Life change

review: I have learned many life lessons from this app. I‚Äôve been using it since I was a sophomore in college for the past five or six years it has helped me understand my own anxiety better it has given me tools for managing stress I struggle with anger and depression, and this app has helped me realize many things about what I deal with and what other people deal with as well. This app I have used to help improve my view of my own relationships. There was also a. Where I didn‚Äôt use it due to technical difficulties with my subscription, but when I reached out to headspace, they were quick to respond and they helped me merge my student account to my regular account even though I didn‚Äôt know my password. These people seem to care and they are constantly adding new content. I am very thankful for this app.
title: This is the best meditation app and its not close

review: As I‚Äôve learned to meditate and used this app over the years I‚Äôve come to the realization that there is a profound and significant difference between how my days go when I use this app as opposed to the days I don‚Äôt. I am in a phase of my life where I try not to chase happiness because it‚Äôs a fleeting emotions but instead I choose peace. You can‚Äôt be happy at a funeral but you can be at peace. Peace is a state of mind I‚Äôm always trying to keep myself in because it allows me to flow throughout my days. This app is a game changer in the sense that it allows to to maintain that mindset. This has quickly become a staple in my morning routine and I‚Äôm trying to encorperate it before bed as well. Can‚Äôt recommend this app enough and I‚Äôm so grateful to Andy Pudicombe and the rest of the headspace team for provided such an amazing experience. 10/10 would recommend
title: I CANT GO A DAY WITHOUT THIS APP

review: I started this journey of mediation based on a recommendation from Netflix.  Your video popped into my suggestion, and I thought why not.  As I played the video not knowing what to expect, if there was to be anything expected at all. I felt instantly relaxed from the voice and ‚ÄúAndy‚Äù.  He announced what I thought in my head.  The thought of a city tuff guy like myself.  Learning for the first time in my life how to BREATHE!  Wow!!! Thanks to the eye opening experience that headspace has provided me, I have been able to continue down the path the mindfulness, and opening of thoughts that I wasn‚Äôt able to control previously.  Now, thanks to the teaching provided from headspace as an anchor I‚Äôm able to accomplish task I didn‚Äôt realize were there for me.  Thank you Headspace for doing exactly what your name implies, opening headspace!  From a forever fan, Curtis.
title: The opening I needed

review: Mediation and mindfulness is KEY! ‚Ä¶but the Headspace customer service team is the complete opposite. Long-time subscriber and advocate for the app but the most recent experience has been TERRIBLE. Had an issue for my annual renewal on a special rate plan (which took FOREVER to setup initially), reached out to CS multiple times and NO response. Days passed, rate plan had lapsed and was unable to renew. Broke my 1200+ day ‚Äústreak‚Äù. Signed up on a trial period as temp fix. After more contact ignored email attempts, I was FINALLY able to get thru to Support via Twitter nearly a week later. Support did NOTHING absolutely nothing in regards to righting the wrongs. Instead, just responded to issues and troubles with Copy & Paste script that can easily be found on the FAQs section of the website. Don‚Äôt even get me started on the recent technical issues the app‚Ä¶IYKYK. Do better, Headspace.
title: 5 Star to 1 Star ‚òπÔ∏è

review: I downloaded this app like a year ago and I couldn‚Äôt use it because it‚Äôs all talking in the meditations and stuff. But I contacted them to let them know that, while this app rocks, I couldn‚Äôt use it. I downloaded it again just now to see if it had been changed, and sure enough, it seems like captions have been added to a lot of these things. I just did one of the lessons and the voice was streamed to my hearing aids but I‚Äôm deaf enough that I still require captions (I have 110 db loss!) so that one had captions, and I did a breathing activity and they even had (waves whooshing) in the captions below it so that‚Äôs awesome!! I‚Äôm so thrilled to see this, so many apps just don‚Äôt have this kind of thing so they‚Äôre useless to me (and all other people who have this disability.) app developers, thank you so much!!!
title: This app is finally accessible for the deaf!!!

review: I have been battling a lot of anxiety and depression and this is a tool I use to help counteract my feelings of feeling  alone.  It‚Äôs not a get rid of everything that is stressing you out promise, rather it‚Äôs a tool to use that gives you an advantage. It helps with the process of grief and with feelings of unease, doesn‚Äôt get rid of them, but helps make them manageable.  I meditate daily now. If I can I try to find at least 10 min, but there are shorter 1-3 minutes for those who are completely stressed out with little time to make.  It‚Äôs a really good tool and I am glad I am using it.  It‚Äôs definitely worth the subscription. I recommend for all, no matter what is happening.  This app will help if you use it correctly with the right expectations. There is no cure-all, but this is a tool that will help you reach points where you feel happier and feel less of what you feel now.
title: Super helpful

review: I just signed up this morning and wanted to thank the YouTubers called Yes Theory for their video about climbing up to the Loneliest House on Earth. They are sponsored by Headspace and highlighted it during their journey. I was moved by Thomas's description of his struggles with overcoming his fear of heights and his anxiety. It sold me on getting this app because I realized that I am only going to start my own journey through managing anxiety if I commit to a daily pursuit and I only seem able to do that with technology. I quit smoking over a year ago with help and realized it is time to go further into an exploration of the 'why' behind my own anxiety. So, thanks to Thomas for his honesty and desire to share - I know he's sponsored but I also know that doesn't mean it's not genuine. I look forward to exploring this app! Thanks for offering it and not charging an arm and a leg for it!
title: Just started

review:
I love this app, and I usually don‚Äôt pay for apps if I can help it. That said, this has been a great purchase for my mental health. I‚Äôve been using it for morning and evening meditations, and for short mental health breaks during the day for the past two weeks. 

My recommendation/request of the developers: please allow users to add more notifications through the app for specific activities like a yoga break or a walking break. I‚Äôd like to take advantage of more of the features of the app‚Äôs activities but need to schedule them separately in my calendar app at this time. I use the morning wake up and bedtime notifications in the app which have been great. Basically, any opportunity to further incorporate moments of relaxation and mindfulness throughout the day is greatly appreciated.
title: Love the app, would like to incorporate more specific reminders

review: I got this free through an offer last year because of my essential work as a health care provider. I didn‚Äôt think much about it at first but really used the ‚Äòmorning wake up‚Äô during the first few weeks of quarantine. Months past and I started using it again-this time to meditate. My family started as well. Within two months it has completely changed how we live! My stress levels are down, my kids breathe before reacting (so do my husband and I) and we are doing so much better as a family. You have to stick with it, but the app has tons of different options to use and a variety of teachers. They even have Sesame Street for the kiddos! I also have grown to love the English accents and my kids say ‚Äòwhen are we going to listen to Andy?‚Äô if it‚Äôs been a couple of days. This app is a game changer!!!
title: The BEST app ever

review: I was going through pretty tough times during Covid and a few months before and after due to the loss of a job and stability, and also due to social isolation. I felt trapped in the race of life despite being a believing Christian who has hope. Disciplining my mind to slow down, to physically quiet down and learning helpful breathing techniques has been a very positive experience. My favorite feature of Headspace is their collection of night time stories to help with ambiance while falling asleep; my favorite is called Monsoon Hour; another favorite is Cat Marina. I love that the stories are familiar, but change subtly every night. We have favorite narrators and settings. To me headspace is a wonderful resource led by a compassionate team of talented professionals, whose insights and stories I appreciate. Thank you for the positivity and for enriching our days in a new way!
title: Excellent Resource to help Rest the Mind

review: Improving my perspective has been a long journey  and relationship with Headspace. It took me perserverance, and lots of repetitions. I had many roadblocks. One was Andy was doing most of programs and u cud say I got addicted to his voice and the solace it gave me. As more presenters joined I tried but cud not adjust to a different voice. I continued with Andy‚Äôs sessions for a long time before I cud begin to incorporate the techniques in my daily life.  It remains a significant challenge but including different perspective when I‚Äôm caught in an escalating anxiety moment and to be able to objectify the anxiety from my person has improved my life tremendously. Some close friends have commented on noting a lightness in how I present. All I can say any amount of time invested in yourself is so small in comparison to the time feeling more free with more head space !
title: Your life will improve

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for about a month now, and it‚Äôs really helped! It helps with stress, eating, sleeping, and getting to know more about the mind and body, and how to feel comfortable.

I‚Äôve been having ALOT of stress in my life, from school, to siblings, to friends, to the sleeping disorders and the depressions. To the lost loved ones and moving houses. 

I‚Äôve become so stressed that I become really sick. I‚Äôve developed this thing called ‚ÄúAnxiety Nausea‚Äù I became so sick I thought I was dying! Headspace has helped me deal with and understand with what‚Äôs happening with my body, and I appreciate it! 

I recommend this app to ANYONE. Even if you don‚Äôt suffer from bad anxiety or any disorder, I still recommend. It helps you a lot, and you may learn something you never knew about your body before. 

From the help of my family and headspace, I‚Äôm recovering. To anyone going through this, or something similar, you will recover. And you‚Äôll find people who support you. If you don‚Äôt, find a hobby! Or go out on a walk! 

And yeah.. maybe anxiety will never go away.. but you can help your body by knowing some solutions to help! Treat your body with the kindness and respect it deserves.

To anyone reading this, you will make it through!

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
Much Love, Ava ‚ú®‚ù§Ô∏è
title: ‚ú®Some Advice To People Dealing with Anxiety!‚ú®

review: I have attempted to start a meditation routine several times over the past four years, but struggled greatly. Instead of feeling relaxed I would quickly feel panicked and found breathing difficult. When I first began meditating with Andy, I immediately tried the guided meditation for dealing with anxiety. It was so comforting to learn that my anxious tendencies resulted in overly trying to control my breath and in turn created an unhealthy pattern. I took heart knowing that if it was on his app, surely this must be something many others have faced. With his expert guidance I have learned to look forward to meditation and how it relaxes my body and mind. As I have explored the app more, I find that Andy has addressed many other hurdles I have had with meditating. I have benefited so much already and look forward to see where this path takes me.
title: Daily Calm

review: The audio quality of some of the recorded voices is truly awful (super distracting background hiss). The app looks really nice, but I wish there was a way to give feedback about what mindfulness practices work best for you, so you only get personalized recommendations for mindfulness. For instance, counting breaths has the opposite effect for me (draws me out of a mindfulness state), so it is frustrating when I‚Äôm 5+ minutes into a mindfulness exercise and they drop a breath counting exercise in there. The persistent in-app pop-up notifications are obnoxious‚Äîit is amazing to me that someone making a _mindfulness_ app doesn‚Äôt understand that pop-ups are always unwelcome interruptions. Lastly, I wish there was a way to fully disable any tracking of my mindfulness time‚ÄîI don‚Äôt want my mindfulness time spit back at me.
title: Distracted by terrible audio quality
developerResponse: {'id': 25798908, 'body': "We sincerely apologize. We're more than glad to help and follow up on this issue, which we are working on. Please send us an email over at help@headspace.com", 'modified': '2021-10-20T19:34:12Z'}

review:
I‚Äôm coming here as someone who was practicing meditation from a physical studio pre-COVID, and who struggled when this studio was closed during the pandemic. I wasn‚Äôt a fan of zoom sessions, and also had a hard time finding a practice that wasn‚Äôt just tied to some other facility (yoga, fitness, etc.) 

Listen, Headspace is not bad per say- the graphics are cute, the app works seamlessly, and it‚Äôs certainly accessible to a wider population to get into some much needed mindfulness and awareness. 

But the main lesson plan is literally so repetitive, there are no options for longer sessions beyond just below 15 min, and there is a lack of true depth in the programming. I‚Äôve never left any Headspace session with an out of body experience. I‚Äôve never felt profound understanding. It‚Äôs very much a Beginner‚Äôs course in meditation. Great for starting the practice but just doesn‚Äôt do it after that.
title: Basic, Repetitive Meditation

review: I don‚Äôt rate apps, however I just had to to give Headspace five stars. It‚Äôs not just the best meditation app out there by far, but one of the best apps ever created in general. I‚Äôve been using Headspace since 2015 and no other app comes close. My favorite part of it is the ‚Äútoday‚Äù view that gives me a custom tab of meditations and ‚Äúthe wake up‚Äù which is a carefully curated video series that covers an array of useful subjects. The sleep casts are amazing because of how thoughtfully each are put together. They made the app a full experience with thoughtful art and music to go along with their meditations and videos.  Headspace is an endless resource with meditations and videos covering just about every topic one can think of, each one tailored for those specific experiences. Andy is a meditation guru and it shows through Headspace.
title: Best app ever created

review: I had purchased the app because someone had told me about it. I knew nothing about meditating or how to do it. I just dove right in and now with the help it has guided me, I can almost do it on my own. It‚Äôs something I turn to when I get stressed, angry or sad. Or even need to sleep. The videos have been so soothing and helpful in every way. It has changed the way I look at my day and helps me remember to focus. Not a day goes by where I don‚Äôt use one of the audio recordings to help me tackle and problem I‚Äôm having. Also the work outs are very subtle and easy. Best app for a stressful life. Highly recommend. I‚Äôm better at controlling my struggles now. Thank you! ‚ù§Ô∏è I hope someone reads this because it‚Äôs a real experience and I‚Äôm so grateful it‚Äôs helped me, it may help someone else too. Try it.
title: Unbelievably grateful for this app

review:
ok, i‚Äôll say it: i was recommended meditation by professionals and non professionals so much for so many years, and i resisted because i thought it was for more neurotypical people and would never in a thousand years help me. 
i recently got really triggered and have been really emotionally turbulent, to the point of taking it out on others, and my anxiety has been out of control. i decided, with my partner‚Äôs urging, to try the free trial. 
this app has helped me so much more than i thought it would. it is a godsend. after every session i feel so calm and mentally ready for whatever comes at me, it‚Äôs insane. i‚Äôm nicer to everyone, they‚Äôve told me. i‚Äôve started journaling, set myself a schedule, etc. things that help me thrive and that i was not able to do before headspace. it is a part of my routine now and the best habit i have picked up. 
i have been doing a course on acceptance and it‚Äôs helping my self esteem so much, and making me realize i resist help. whenever i get worked up, i can easily take five deep breaths and center myself, which helps center myself and i can think clearly.
tl;dr: after being recommended meditation for years, i can‚Äôt believe i never tried this, it has helped me so incredibly much.
title: helps me mentally so much, totally recommend

review: This app is a great catalyst for connecting with myself and truly taking the time to be present. AND ‚Äî I do have critiques. Firstly, when I open the app, I see this ‚ÄúToday‚Äù screen which lists videos and meditations and whatever that I‚Äôve never done and did not ask for. Why isn‚Äôt the ‚Äúcourse‚Äù that I‚Äôve been doing consistently for 3 weeks the first thing I see? I have to go to my ‚Äúactivity history‚Äù at the bottom of the fourth tab to see that. Totally crazy to me. Also, the scripts for the meditations are riddled with sentence fragments. I know this is kind of a style thing, but it‚Äôs very annoying. ‚ÄúSo just noting when the mind wants to go back to that.‚Äù is not a complete sentence. The overuse of ‚Äú-ing‚Äù in these meditations is a pet peeve of mine. But please allow me to change the opening screen so I can get back to the course I‚Äôve been doing quickly.
title: Great Meditations, Poor Design
developerResponse: {'id': 36850934, 'body': "We're so glad you reached out and shared your feedback with us!  We will make sure it's heard!", 'modified': '2023-05-31T20:42:48Z'}

review: The sound is inconsistent and often robotic, which is so jarring I often just opt not to meditate. Apparently I'm not the only user with this problem, and it really negatively impacts the experience. It‚Äôs been happening for over over a year so it is one of those things I guess they just gave up on fixing. The landing page and navigation is also really stressful for a meditation app. Instead of showing my favorites or recent listens, they put together a weird mix of like 6 random short videos and meditations, and then I have to dig for a needle in a haystack to find what I want. The tabs provided are simply not useful. The way they lay out courses leads to a stressful paradox of choice where you spend an inordinate amount of time digging and scrolling, which causes me additional anxiety when I am trying to prevent it. I want to love this app but these are huge design/UX problems that have existed for years.
title: Want to love, needs to improve
developerResponse: {'id': 33748364, 'body': 'Hi, we are always looking to improve the experience for our users, and really appreciate the feedback. If there is anything specific we can look into, please contact us at help@headspace.com.', 'modified': '2022-12-15T17:57:04Z'}

review: I never forget, It was nearly 5 years ago and i was 16, I heard about a meditation app called Headspace , The first thing that got my eyes was it‚Äôs beautifully designed videos that guided me to learn new skills, At that time only Andy voice was available and i really liked it, It had lots of plans and singles for different situations And I installed it after 5 years with free student subscription ( Thank you for caring about teachers and students during pandemic), and wow, it feels totally like a new app, you guys have grown so much much big. Thank you for taking me to meditation app! Before Headspace I used to think that meditation is like what we see in movies, you should sit somewhere for hours and stay calm and i thought pooffff, that‚Äôs so boring, but Headspace changed my mind so thank you ‚ú®üôÇ
title: The app that took me to Meditation world!

review: I downloaded this app back in 2018 and used it here and there for a while but stopped for a few months and I came back to it to find that most of the content I had been able to use before for free had been locked behind a pay wall which was really frustrating especially considering just how much content there is overall (there‚Äôs a lot) so I just used what little I could for free and now I‚Äôm coming back to it in 2023 hoping for some free meditation guidance and I come to find that it seems like almost everything is locked behind the pay wall. Literally couldn‚Äôt find ANYTHING that I could listen to for free and if it‚Äôs there they are definitely making it intentionally difficult to find. I understand they gotta make their money some how but I seriously just want some free mediation guidance from this app, the content is all great I love the soft narrative voices but it‚Äôs safe to say that they won‚Äôt be getting my money.
title: They want your money not your well being
developerResponse: {'id': 37801913, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback! We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. We still offer free content outside of the app on social media channels and still offer K-12 organizations free memberships in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada.', 'modified': '2023-07-20T14:49:27Z'}

review: I have really loved the variety of meditations. The series, the single meditations, the sleep ones are also great. There are meditation options for my kids as well! It‚Äôs strange for me that the scripts say things grammatically incorrect. (Which I‚Äôm sure is intentional to keep it in the present moment) for example the meditation BEGINS with : ‚Äúso just taking a moment to slow down‚Äù. It startles a little at first. Or is that just incorrect grammar in the U.S.? I‚Äôm not a grammar queen haha but when a sentence starts like that or throughout the meditation it continues in that tense even when it doesn‚Äôt necessarily make sense it kind of interrupts the flow of my mindfulness a bit. I‚Äôm not an English major, & really nothing like that has really ever bothered me before. It has just been so different that even after a couple weeks I‚Äôm not quite used to it.
title: Great variety of options & quality.

review:
I am literally in tears of frustration as I write this. I redownloaded headspace after a long time of trying it out (and paying for it) before. It said I would receive a two week free trial and at the end if I liked it I could pay $69.9 for a year. Well I got charged immediately. I canceled immediately and requested the refund to apple. Apple declined it. I disputed the decline- they declined again. I called headspace customer service and they said they can‚Äôt access apples billing and refunded me even though headspace itself acknowledged they would‚Äôve refunded me. So now I‚Äôm stuck with a $70 bill, which I can‚Äôt afford, for a product I don‚Äôt want. Imagine trying to download an app to make your life better and it makes it worse. 

Headspace customer service told me I wasn‚Äôt actually eligible for the two week trial and that‚Äôs why I got charged right away- so why would it pop up? How can you drag me into those terms when I never qualified for them? And then get a $70 payment out of me? Shouldn‚Äôt be allowed.
title: In tears of frustration
developerResponse: {'id': 35749239, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the trouble you're experiencing with this refund request. We kindly recommend you get in contact again with Apple support and explain your case, Go to https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT201232 to locate Apple's customer support number (it varies by location)", 'modified': '2023-04-03T18:56:19Z'}

review:
I‚Äôve been using Headspace every day for years now, and have completed many, if not most of the courses available. I could go on about meditation and how beneficial it is to having a healthy mind, and living a calm content life... but words aren‚Äôt the same as experience, and I could never do it justice. 

I am a better person because of this app, and hopefully I have had a positive impact on the world around me because of my practice as well. Headspace isn‚Äôt full of ‚Äúwoo-woo‚Äù and doesn‚Äôt conflict with whatever you believe. It‚Äôs just a thoughtful collection and presentation of the parts of mindfulness that are proven, practical and legitimate. 

Only you can choose to begin on a path of mindfulness practice, but for your own health and happiness, I hope you do (whoever you are)... and if you do, Headspace is a great way to start.
title: A better mind, a better life.

review: I ve been meditating since many years since i was so young and i ve learned everythings the hard way and i ve achieved do many spirtual expriences that requires alot of effort and time , when i ve seen this app i was not sure about trying it but after trying it its worth it for real , the exprience that gives you is so good specially for those who never meditated even me who i consider my self an advanced level in this , having this beside you is so helpful we all need human interaction no one can live alone because it will be so dry but this app gets you the good people who are meant to be your virtual environment but this must be helpful for soothing your meditation journey and it includes many other options, you d better try it so you understand what you we‚Äôre missing
title: Surprised

review:
Update - a year later - navigation is still crap. BEWARE: What shows in the screenshot previews us NOT what it looks like. The bait and switch is not appreciated. 

 I‚Äôve been a paying subscriber for several years and the meditations are quite good. But every time they change the interface the app gets harder to use. I don‚Äôt need frustration while trying to use the app I use to help manage stress. Latest change has made it really difficult to find my usual programs. When I emailed support I was told it was just an ‚Äòexperiment‚Äô and temporary. Not appreciated. If the developers want beta testers for something they should ask instead of forcing it on users who never agreed to be guinea pigs. If the interface isn‚Äôt repaired, I‚Äôm actually considering dropping my subscription, both because the app is hard to use and because I don‚Äôt like what this action says about how users are viewed.
title: A bit broken-hearted
developerResponse: {'id': 29412433, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the trouble. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.\r", 'modified': '2022-04-26T20:04:42Z'}

review:
I cannot emphasize enough how meditation has impacted my life. I have been through really dark times and went so long not caring about anything that I had forgot what it felt like. Headspace and specifically Andy has taught me more than any school or person has. how to be kind to myself, that you deserve to feel good and how to see things clearly. It amazes me that just a small practice can change in how I feel and how I view the world everyday. this practice has finally let me feel how grateful I am to be alive. 

I now am working to have my friends and loved ones practice meditation as well because I can see the benefits it brought me and I want that for those I love.

If you are struggling or even if you aren‚Äôt please give meditation a real chance and use headspace.
title: thank you andy, 10/10 app

review: The company I work for offered Headspace in our benefits package and it was interesting that this was offered along with the other incentives that a business would offer employees. We are in a high pressure, fast paced competitive business. It is very common, easy in fact to be overwhelmed by one‚Äôs job whatever your individual job is. Taking up a meditative practice was a different approach to caring for people who work for you. Interestingly it is something that helps manage the job, but also moves beyond work into your everyday life outside work. And keeps work at work. It is simple, and yet offers significant benefit. And once you get started you can cultivate it and grow with it. As you continue to utilize the app. The ‚Äúbenefit‚Äù becomes more apparent. So far, so good‚Ä¶
title: Head Space So Far‚Ä¶

review:
I‚Äôve been meditating with the app for over a year, skipping past or ignoring periodic ableism, political propaganda, and religious content that conflicts with mine. I appreciate that I can adjust session length when I need to, up to very short so I can always fit it in (at least on the dailies‚Äîmany others don‚Äôt have this feature).

But the newest update has removed the sleep button from the main menu, meaning that when you‚Äôre half asleep you have to hunt for it. And there‚Äôs no quick and easy way to switch back and forth between the day and night views. Headspace, I *already pay you* for all your content‚Äîthere‚Äôs no need to shove it down my throat. I know it‚Äôs there and I‚Äôll go look at it when I have time. Making the app experience harder and draining my brain isn‚Äôt going to make me use it more.
title: Update is clunky

review: I have listened to many of the meditations, videos, music and sleep meditations. This is the only year long subscription that I have purchased At first I thought this won‚Äôt do much, but after listening to Andy‚Äôs coaching through the first week of meditations I realized that this was effective. My goal this year to focus time for myself and this is a great way to focus for a couple minutes or many minutes. I have recommended it to many of my family and friends. Like a lot of things in life you think this isn‚Äôt going to do anything but line upon line you build the ability to calm self. This is an amazing app. This best money I have spent and thank you to Andy and others that have provided a very positive nonjudgmental experience. You will NOT be disappointed.
title: The best

review: I have blue shield insurance and when making a welvelution account and following the instructions, I got headspace for a year for free!!!  I‚Äôve been doing meditations in the morning and a little throughout the day(instead of scrolling on social media that will serve no purpose looking at it and scrolling for 30 mins) and I have seen an amazing change in my life. I‚Äôm actually smiling and find myself laughing at little things. I am a lot happier in life and this has truly opened my eyes to a happier more energetic life. It helps you be more productive because your are in a more positive mindset. Instead of marveling about how it is, get a mount subscription. (The free trial doesn‚Äôt do justice). Invest money for self, for your mind. I hope all of you try. Thanks you headspace!
title: FREE WITH BLUE SHEILD(but worth buying anyways!!)

review: After watching Netflix Headspace Guide I felt BRAND NEW. So I texted my bestie and recommended she watch it since we were both stuck in depressive episodes after a long/weird 2020.. She responded with ‚ÄòGIRL download the app I use it every night!‚Äô. Honestly love this app. It really has improved my overall happiness. Their lessons resonate most days which is more consistent than any other techniques Ive tried over the years. I genuinely look forward to meditation time now because it makes my day feel brighter even on days when I‚Äôm really struggling. Moms, if youre feeling burnt out this is the place for you üñ§this is where I found calmness and appreciation for my hectic everyday life. Feeling like myself again (only better). Thank you Andy and the Headspace team.
title: Don‚Äôt think Just download it

review: This app has helped me in so many ways. I often feel tired and lethargic in the middle of the day but if I just sit down and listen to the daily meditation I feel recharged and find the energy to get through the rest of the day. I have 3 kids and I have them use the breathing exercises that have the visuals. It‚Äôs just 5 simple breaths but my kids love breathing along with the cat or the sun. I do too! There are also great meditations on many subjects like anger, anxiety, letting go, sadness, etc. There are meditations for kids too which I love!! You will not regret getting this app. It has become my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù app. It‚Äôs my favorite. If I had to choose between all of my apps I would choose this one! Thank you Andy at Headspace for creating this app and sharing it wit the world! ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: I LOVE this app!!

review:
Pros: Love HeadSpace‚Äôs comprehensive approach to a healthier, happier mind/body life. The app includes easy, effective meditations as well as easy reminders, accessible teachers and great visuals. I also love that topics that cover not only meditation but also nutrition, meditation, yoga, movement, inspirational talks, etc. 

Wishlist: The only reason I‚Äôm deleting a star is because there is currently no way to save morning videos as a favorite for later replay. They disappear after that day‚Äôs sessions. For those of us with memory issues, it is disappointing that some of the most helpful or inspiring morning takes cannot be replayed again. Yes, it‚Äôs ironic that I‚Äôm hoping for something more ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù in an app which helps you let things go mentally/emotionally, but memory challenges make it difficult to integrate these great messages.
title: Wonderful with One Disappointment

review:
My son gave me This app as a Christmas gift. I did not think I needed it because I already pray, mediate and do yoga each day. But I have used it everyday since Christmas morning and it is AMAZING! The meditations are not too heavy. The screen on my iPad becomes part of helping me focus because the graphics are so fun and beautiful! And the wake up stories inspire me everyday. I already love this app and it is truly changing my way of being in the world. 

And by the way, I am doing a meditation series focused on mindful eating. I am only on day 6 and have made more progress in making peace with food than years of counseling has done. 

Get this app! I hope it impacts you as much as it has me‚Ä¶ you deserve peace and joy. This is a bridge for you to find it. I wish you love and light today!
title: The BEST gift

review: The Get Moving course claims to be ‚Äúconfidence building‚Äù and ‚Äúgreat for beginners,‚Äù but it‚Äôs actually far too advanced for anyone who wasn‚Äôt active before starting: you‚Äôre expected to be running on Day 5 and doing push-ups into downward dog on Day 6. I can‚Äôt keep up and it‚Äôs discouraging.
