Furthermore, you can‚Äôt airplay the videos onto a different screen, so it‚Äôs impossible to consistently see the instructor while you workout and your form suffers from needing to juggle the phone or just do it from memory of the demo rep. If you even rotate the video into landscape on your phone, a banner of dark overlay appears on the top 1/4 of the image. I‚Äôm grateful to the content for having gotten me into morning exercise‚ÄîI walked 4.5 miles in an hour yesterday, which is more than I walked in multiple days earlier this summer‚Äîbut it‚Äôs not beginner- or user-friendly.
title: Exercise content not suitable for true beginners
developerResponse: {'id': 31752962, 'body': "Thank you for your review; we'll be sure your feedback is hear about this Move session. If you have any question or would like to provide a more detailed feedback, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-08-30T21:12:06Z'}

review:
Headspace was recommended to me when I first started CBT around 2 years ago due to their excellent intro to meditation, and I've enjoyed using the app ever since. I took a hiatus from the app around the time they added sleep soundscapes, and coming back to it I see there's now a ton for various activities, as well as some yoga courses. I'm eager to resume my practice!

I'd love to give this app 5 stars, but it's lacking a crucial feature. It doesn't seem compatible with airplay or iPhone automation, so there's no way for me to play the soundscape through my homepod. It really tanks the utility of the feature that I can't use a speaker with the app. Automation is definitely a nice-to-have feature, but with it I could start playing the soundscape from my phone to the speaker when it's time to sleep, kind of like an inverse of an alarm clock.
title: Great meditation app

review: This app is for any and everyone. I had never meditated before getting this app and had no clue what to expect. I‚Äôm so glad i did and stuck with it even when it didn‚Äôt feel like i was doing it right, or felt challenging. I now meditate daily and feel so much more connected to this beautiful world and the people around me. It‚Äôs helped me reduce stress, understand and navigate angry emotions, and disrupt/abandon negative thought patterns that i didn‚Äôt even know i had. I‚Äôve learned so much about myself just by paying attention to my thoughts, which i couldn‚Äôt have done successfully without the practice of meditation.   It‚Äôs truly changed my life. One of the best investments I‚Äôve ever made (time wise and money wise). I‚Äôm forever grateful to the Headspace team.
title: Life-changing. I‚Äôm so grateful.

review: This app has changed my life. I have been using for a few years now and the app has only gotten better. Over the years my anxiety has become much more manageable. There always seems to be a course or mediation themed around something I‚Äôm worried about. This has been the best app I‚Äôve ever paid for. Trust me the year subscription so worth it. I notice a huge difference when I stop mediating for a few days or weeks. I‚Äôm always in a much better place when I practice often. This will take time. I did notice an immediate change of just a little bit more peace after each practice, but it took months and years to really see how far I‚Äôve come. If you‚Äôre on the fence, get it if you want to be a better version of yourself.
title: Changed my life

review: Truly I cant recommend this app enough! All of the content is sooo thoughtful, high quality, and well curated. I use this app daily for everything from meditating, to sleep, to quick breathing exercises if im in a moment of stress. Its amazing. Headspace has really helped me stay consistent with meditation too (currently on a 285 day streak! Super proud of myself and never been able to stay consistent like this before!). I can also tell they‚Äôre constantly trying to improve the app, add new features, and expand their (amazing) library. There is truly something for everyone in this app and all of the teachers are INCREDIBLE! (dora is my personal fav). Huge shout out to all of the hardworking and talented people who make this app possible. You are allstars! Xoxo
title: This app has changed my life

review: How do I even begin to describe how much I love headspace and how much it has helped me. This app is amazing whether you were looking to learn how to meditate, whether you‚Äôd like to work out at home whether you‚Äôre looking for focus music whether you looking for an app to help you sleep at night headspace literally has it all! I can‚Äôt recommend it enough, I tell all my friends and family about it. Anyone that is struggling with anxiety I recommend headspace to them. This app has helped me tremendously and I am forever grateful for its existence! Being on this app and following the exercises has literally changed my life for the better. If you were thinking about getting the app do it, do it now! You will not regret it I promise you. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Best app ever! Worth the yearly membership

review: Like the app and Headspace but I had shifted to using it more on Alexa than any other device.  Alexa skill support was ended yesterday.  I understand it was likely due to a lack of use, but to be honest it took some time to really understand what was actually available in the Alexa skill.  So circuitous, if people can‚Äôt figure out how to get it to do what they want, it is difficult to use so they won‚Äôt.  For example, in the evenings, it prompts you to listen to sleep casts, but I often meditate before bed.  It took me some time to figure out that I could play a 20 minute meditation just by saying play a 20 minute meditation as soon as the menu prompts stopped.  Alexa has no visual interface and little in the way of documentation.  This is a barrier to adoption for skills that don‚Äôt provide more info in their menus.
title: 3 year user but canceling

review:
This is probably the best mindfulness meditation app out there! Offers a ton of different practices and sessions and let's you choose a time that works for you. The animations are also a great added touch and help to clearly visualize what is being said. 

My only complaint is that the annual subscription is quite pricy. Not to discount the value of the content but in truth, for someone who may not use the app to it's full capacity daily, it just seems like a lot. They do offer some free options in the app but they make them incredibly challenging to find imo which gives the impression that they're really trying to push people to upgrade vs. offering more of a service to paying and nonpaying customers alike. Overall great app though.
title: Consistency is key

review: The app seems really great, and I‚Äôm sure it helps with lots of things, but the fact that basically every single exercise option is locked is why I gave this two stars. If you make an app for headspace and meditation and stress, do you really think it‚Äôs a good idea to make almost everything part of the premium plan? Imagine you‚Äôre really stressed out, and you‚Äôre scrolling through TikTok and find an ad for this app. You think it looks useful, and download it. Then you find calming meditations, or stress-relieving breathing exercises, but every single thing is premium. I‚Äôm sure people who are stressed about whatever don‚Äôt want to pay for a premium plan to unlock the meditation exercises, because I doubt half the people using the app have money to spend. It‚Äôs just a little stupid to me and I feel like the app could at least unlock a bit more than what they have so people could actually use it.
title: Kind of pitiful
developerResponse: {'id': 36449513, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback! We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. We still offer free content outside of the app on social media channels and still offer K-12 organizations free memberships in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada.', 'modified': '2023-05-10T21:03:23Z'}

review:
Marketed as a free app. Is not. 

I first downloaded this a few years ago, at that point there was an okay amount of free meditations available and they were good. Deleted after finding things that worked better and had a better variety. Decided to download again as I was once again having troubles sleeping and now literally everything is locked. There is not a single thing that can be accessed without buying the subscription or getting the free trail. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs good once you lay for it, but it should really just be marketed as costing money and should be an app you have to buy in the first place. The free trail is just not worth downloading the app for. I feel very bad for people who used the version where some things could be accessed for free and relied on that for their sleep or stress just to have that source taken away from them. Stupid update. Don‚Äôt waste your time unless your in the position to and intending to spend money.
title: Shouldn‚Äôt be marketed as free

review: I discovered Headspace years ago on the Rich Roll podcast. I love the guided meditation and the meditations with different intentions and how they reach so many different needs. I now have been checking out the morning wake ups instead of scrolling Facebook and it just starts my day off so much better. If I have trouble falling asleep at night, I tune into the Midnight Launderette and it is absolutely soothing and helps my mind calm enough for me to relax. Andy and Eve‚Äôs voices are so calming and I have learned the basics of meditation through their basic package and have moved on more specific guided ones, such as appreciation, or letting go of resentment or anxiety. It has created this beautiful, subtle change of me being much more aware and intentional and I absolutely love it.
title: So helpful!

review: After using this for a few days, I knew it was going to help me and was so excited. I shared the info with my family and a couple of them were interested so I decided to upgrade to the family plan. This is where everything went off the rails. Four emails later and I still have no resolution. I couldn‚Äôt ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù, I was told that I had to cancel and could then upgrade. I canceled but still couldn‚Äôt upgrade. Then I was informed that I needed to go through Apple to request a refund and I did but I still can‚Äôt upgrade. Now I‚Äôm being told I can‚Äôt upgrade until the app basically decides I‚Äôm no longer a member (and basically doesn‚Äôt work) in order to upgrade. All my meditation tracked progress is gone but the app still works. However it isn‚Äôt really relaxing me with all of this frustration and no real help. I‚Äôve wasted more than two weeks on trying to fix something that shouldn‚Äôt be this difficult.  Very disappointed.
title: Great, unless you have an issue
developerResponse: {'id': 22831993, 'body': "We're sorry for the trouble with the Family Plan. Since you purchased through Apple, you will have to wait until your subscription expires, then you can purchase the Family Plan. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com if you have any other questions. ", 'modified': '2021-05-16T17:30:51Z'}

review:
And I mean it. As someone who has dealt with extreme anxiety since childhood, this app has changed my life for the better. I recommend this app to everyone I know and don't know. 

We are all better humans and we create a better world when we all meditate. 

I want to give this app a 5 star rating, but there is one fundamental flaw. If you get any text or phone call during your session, then the audio stops - even on Do Not Disturb mode. You essentially just sit in silence for another 20 minutes wondering if you should break meditation and check your phone - which can be a really frustrating experience. It sometimes ruins the meditation itself because you run over your scheduled time for meditation. You don't get that gentle opening of the eyes and reflect on your feelings - instead you might end up angry that the session was ruined. 

I want to continue to support this wonderful program, but after almost 400 sessions, I am considering quiting my subscription and using a regular timer instead. That way I'll never worry about my time. If they ever fix this issue, I will gladly change my review to 5 stars.
title: The most essential habit I have - but a flawed app
developerResponse: {'id': 22036376, 'body': "Thank you for your feedback and apologies for the trouble this has caused you. We'll be sure to pass this along to our team, but please let us know if you have any other questions/suggestions by sending us a note to help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2021-04-04T17:30:11Z'}

review:
I have been in desperate need to make space for myself in all aspects of my life: my relationships, my goals, and sense of self-worth. Although I‚Äôm taking therapy, it‚Äôs only once a week and I want more time to dedicate to my mental health. This app is a perfect alternative to making time and practicing a healthy routine with self-care in mind.

I do wish the subscriptions were better priced as many of the meditating sessions, skills, and educational videos are not at all interactive (you must passively watch them or listen to them and I think it‚Äôs helpful to feel as though you‚Äôre participating in the meditations with someone present).

Nevertheless, Headspace has been incredibly beneficial to me and I plan on exploring their options in the near future.
title: Great Self-Therapy

review: This app used to be one of my favorite apps I had on my phone. I had a lifetime subscription that‚Äôs how much I loved it. I was even a part of the beta testers who helped give feedback and developed the app. They made an update that claimed that it‚Äôs easier to use but it simply isn‚Äôt. It doesn‚Äôt look better it isn‚Äôt easier to use nor more functional. This seems like an update that was done in order to keep things different and relevant but it‚Äôs just not good at all.  To put it in perspective I am an engineer for a living and it is difficult for me to understand how this app works now. I also was given a lifetime subscription to headspace after the development period for my participation during beta testing and suddenly with this new update my lifetime subscription was just stripped from me. If they treat someone who helped them develop the app, an original user who has been with them for so long, like they have treated me imagine how they will treat you?
title: its REALLY bad
developerResponse: {'id': 32175878, 'body': 'Thank you for reaching out! Rest assured that your word is important to us, we would like to hear all possible perspectives, this interface update has been a big change in the app, however if we receive this type of feedback it can help the content team to reconsiderate the update of the interface. We would also kindly ask you to contact us directly at help@headspace.com, so we can review your account and find out a better solution for the stripped Lifetime subscription.\n', 'modified': '2022-09-22T16:14:23Z'}

review: Hi this is me Lily I just got this app today on March 25Thursday and I barely been doing it and I just come to enjoy myself and peaceful and I want to get this out to the world and say that this is very very mindful and peaceful and I think it‚Äôs also nice that they provide not just sleeping stuff they also provide stuff that you‚Äôre having trouble with like I go to private school Sungro sometimes I have trouble focusing so they have one that helps me focus and I also have waking up so then I‚Äôm gonna try that out tomorrow and see if it goes and works but I think it‚Äôs just so far really good for me and my sister Stella and I wanna get this out to the world and say get headspace because it‚Äôs really really nice and relaxing for me and stuff and helps me out a lot so yeah so like I said get headspace
title: Quiet and mindful and in joyful

review: As someone new to meditating, I felt and still sometimes feel very overwhelmed by what I imagine meditation to be. The guided meditations in headspace are lovely and make this powerful tool so approachable and manageable to a newbie. Also, as a healthcare professional, I really appreciate what headspace did by making access free for healthcare professionals during the start of the pandemic. It was an unbelievably stressful time to be in my field and I turned to many things, including meditation, as a way to cope and process and get through the day. Thank you, Headspace team, for looking out for us in a real and tangible way that required financial sacrifice on your part but was so beneficial to me, and I‚Äôm sure, many others. You have a lifelong fan and customer.
title: Approachable

review:
I would highly recommend reading their book or at least watching their video first. I didn't get it when I tried it 5 years ago. But now, mindfulness just feels fun. I also questioned why I should pay for same sessions but the sleep sections make it worth it. I had trouble with racing mind while winding down and needed a TV show to fall asleep but with theirs guided narration, sleeping hasn't been a problem. It has been a week and I am still discovering, but I find it to be very comfortable. Again I highly recommend reading the book instead of videos to get the right idea and be grateful about mindfulness.

The privacy report is wack. So much ad and tracking for a paid app. The privacy policy don't sound good either. You can track stuff in app without linking data to users.
title: Sleep wind down is incredible. Data collection is terrible

review: I started using headspace in 2016. A young newly single mom of 2 under 2. With many things on plate as most. I felt I couldn‚Äôt find any solace. I‚Äôd run for hours. Workout for hours. My miles around my neighborhood went from a heavy barely half miles to 8 miles whether it was rain or shine. As my miles were racking up but my anxiety was continuing  to climb to new heights. I didn‚Äôt want to be on medication I just wanted to find some peace. So I spent 3 min one day on head space and that small effort would send me in a trajectory that‚Äôd change my lIfe forever. It sounds so cheesy but it‚Äôs true. Quieting the mind is so important. Now 2021, with the craziness our world is seeing I‚Äôm back again, a small step in the right direction.
title: A step in the right direction

review: I still use headspace everyday, but I simultaneously witness the everyday decline of the app. The app has a number of excellent meditation guides that seem to have valid credentials for what they do and can be trusted. But I guess to pursue financial goals, the app has opened its doors to celebrities who now want to become meditation guides! This might appeal to some of its users but for me personally a celebrity who‚Äôs money clearly is boosting financial objectives of this company is not a valid guide. It might sound playful and fun to others though. The app has a number of technical shortcomings that the developers and technicians are reluctant to fix. For instance, you cannot control the content on your homepage of the app. You cannot delete the content that app suggests, e.g. celebrity meditation videos or sleep guides. It‚Äôs sad to see how monetary goals lead to decline of a meditation application.
title: The App is commercialized!
developerResponse: {'id': 29097450, 'body': "Thank you for your review; we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-04-11T10:27:45Z'}

review: I was a complete beginner to meditation when I found this app. I decided to add this due to some stress in my life. It was a great decision for my own mental and personal growth. Not only do you meditate, but there a lot of good food for thought at the beginning of the meditation courses. It helps to challenge your current mindset for the better.  The sleep meditations have helped calm me during some restless nights or just simply help me relax for bed.  I have yet to utilize the move section of the app and I‚Äôm looking forward to exploring this more. This app helps guide you in learning this new skill that requires consistent practice. It is great for practicing sitting in the present moment and observing what is going on in your mind, body, and environment with clarity and calm. I highly recommend this app to anyone.
title: Best app for meditation

review:
I would give this app 5 stars but I really wish there was a feature to create a ‚Äúplaylist‚Äú of the meditations I enjoy. For example, in the mornings I like to do the meditation checkin, followed by meditation stretch and close off with the meditation work out. With my mental crazy I need my sessions to be longer‚Ä¶ 5mins is not enough to quiet this brain. 

In order to do this, I have to search each one every time. I‚Äôm not a programmer‚Äî please excuse me for over simplifying; how about a way to view all the meditations you favorited or hearted or liked? It seems the coding is there already. Collect all favorited sessions and display them in a list. 

I still love this app and will continue to use it. Just wished there was a way to organize the sessions I really enjoy. Keep up all the good work.
title: So close to 5 stars

review:
Nothing has worked for getting me to fall asleep effectively and efficiently like the sleepcasts. I started doing the basic meditations a few years ago and eventually got into using the app more regularly with meditations focused on managing anxiety. The regular practice has given me such great tools in my toolkit for reacting to anxiety when it comes up. One of my biggest obstacles has been getting to sleep, but once I started listening to the sleepcasts it was a game changer. I‚Äôve even used some of the wind down exercises throughout my days to keep me grounded. 

Biggest thing I wish to see changed in the app would be the addition of a feature that lets you mix soundscapes and sleep music!
title: Changed My Ability To Fall Asleep

review:
Headspace has changed my life in so many ways.  For one, pre CV19 I started Headspace when my underlying anxiety and depression was exacerbated by an oppressive boss that weaponized my mental disabilities against me and tried to get me to buy into his ‚Äúdestructive achiever‚Äù mentality.  I held firm to my values and while I suffered mentally in the long-run it as the right decision.  I am not sure if I would have made it without Headspace.

I then adapted and used my comfort animal during my meditation.  I simply had Dali with the Pink Tail, my little Sheepoo sit with me during Headspace.  Dali and I almost created a new form of Headspace - Service Animal Meditation.  I wish I could send you a pic of Dali - she is quite famous in our small circle with her pink tail and big smile and big brown eyes.

I also met Dr. Sahar Yousef though Headspace and she engaged with my company and we have thought many in our company to become Superhumans.  Her and Professor Lucas from UC Berkeley even came all the way from CA to OH to meet with our Board of Directors.  It was a big hit and proved to be a great tool to become more productive in less time.

I am beginning to ramble so let me end by saying - thank you.

Jim Perry
title: Changed My Life

review:
I was a former Shine App user. Shine was absorbed by Headspace. We were promised that Shine would become a viable part of Headspace. It is not to date.  I do hope a greater effort will be made to invite the likes of Jamilla Reddy, Joe-El Carabello, and Dr. Mariel Bugu√© to invigorate your menu. Although there is small Shine presence, it is not enough. I am not thrilled with the way Headspace is organized, especially the search engine, e.g., when I search Shine, it does not pull up all of the Shine speakers.

I will say you do have some sensitive speakers. However, for me, many of your cartoonish images and logos infantilize and distract from their message. They make me want to dismiss the associated information and move on and away or apart from, for example, a meditation exercise with a stick figure. I do enjoy your live interviews, something Shine never attempted. 

Thank you for the good that you do. I am adapting.
title: Shine
developerResponse: {'id': 37342137, 'body': "Thank you for your review; We apologize for any issues adapting to Headspace after the acquisition of Shine, we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2023-06-26T18:01:48Z'}

review: The app is fine, but just a heads-up that you may find it impossible to cancel without contacting customer support. In my case, I followed the cancellation processes which was tricky in and of itself, but the instructions were misleading. I was led to believe that my subscription was canceled and didn‚Äôt realize that it wasn‚Äôt until I was billed again. I contacted customer service and they claimed to have now canceled my subscription, but are still making me pay for the entire year even though I contacted them within hours of paying the renewal subscription. And, even though I was led to believe by their cancellation instructions that I had already cancelled my subscription.
title: Canceling subscription is impossible

review: Amazing app. Whether you‚Äôre looking for an entry into meditation or expanding your practice, this is a great starting place... specifically for meditation/mindfulness only, that is. In that way, it can be life changing. The UX is okay; you kind of have to dig around in a not-so-intuitive way to get into other features, but some essentials are laid out plainly upon opening the app. It‚Äôs still 70USD/yr. So, a tune up in that department wouldn‚Äôt hurt. The voices are very pleasant, but I wonder if using only British accents deters a more diverse audience (i.e., people who are already a tough sell [i.e., british accents = liberal conspiracy ~ U.S.A.] but would benefit tremendously from meditation, and people who might consider using British accents in this context to be appropriation/co-opting target cultures of some kind). Just some thoughts for a potential reality.
title: Headspace- what to expect

review: I love this app! I appreciate the help building my meditation practice and a huge variety of other tools. I woke up at 3 am with racing thoughts, struggled with them for awhile, and then it hit me that I should open Headspace. I did a Sleep SOS session and it totally helped! Racing thoughts were gone and I fell back asleep. The app offers so many different tools and I really like that each day it gives you a series of sessions/activities to do. If I could, I would have given the app 4.5 stars instead of 5.0 because I wish you could filter for sessions by time. For example, if I have 20 min and want to do an activity like meditate, listen to a course, watch a video, I would like to be able filter for things I can do in 20 min.
title: Love this app

review: For too long, years in fact, I have criticized and belittled meditation practices. I completely bought into the media perpetuated misrepresentation of these practices. The format of Headspace, and so many options guaranteed to fit in your day, encourages and enlightens this most skeptical user. My background is a single parent to two special needs kiddos for more than a decade, one of whom is now diagnosed as a disabled adult. Currently going through my second divorce and working two jobs. I assure you that if I can find the time in the day, so can you! I‚Äôm sleeping at night, and less anxious throughout the day. There is actually space in my head üòâ to make more thoughtful choices. So happy that I made this choice!
title: Too long was I wrong!

review:
I have been using headspace since 2017 and have always liked the content. It is soothing and helpful more often than not. That being said, the app has a lot more content now and it is easy to get lost in a sea of courses, videos and other details. 

For one, it‚Äôd be nice to have some kind of goal setting based on what I am going through in life. Right now, it is hard not to get distracted by the billion colorful cards and many other auto playing videos or moving images. Sometimes, that feels so counter intuitive for a service aiming to make you feel more peaceful. Overall a very nice service but I wish they improved their interface.
title: Lots of good content but hard to navigate

review:
I had read another review that has said there weren't many free items to use in the app, so I was prepared for that (and fine with it), but I couldn't find ANYTHING in there that wasn't locked! I like apps that offer a few elements for free and then entice you to pay to get more. But not to have any? Not even the simple 6-second (well, really 24-second) breathing cycle I saw in an ad in Duolingo, which made me interested in this app in there first place? 

I'm not a fan of free trials as a way to check something out, first, because I don't want to have to remember to cancel it at the end, and, second, because the trial period isn't usually long enough to get me hooked. I'm not paying $13+ a month without knowing how I'll feel about using this app over time. 

So, I guess I'll go uninstall this app now!
title: ZERO free components (outside of free trial)

review: I discovered Headspace during the Covid shutdown through a running ap that I use.  I thought I couldn‚Äôt meditate, that I wasn‚Äôt able to quiet my mind.  Headspace showed me that learning to calm one‚Äôs mind is a skill one builds, that showing up for myself by doing a session daily was a win all on its own.  And, with time, I started to realize I was actually learning to let my thoughts go and be with my breath.  I could notice when the endless scrolling voice in my head was starting to wind up and bring myself back to the present.  Meditation isn‚Äôt a magic pill you take to solve all your worries, it‚Äôs a strength and a confidence you build for yourself  one tiny moment at a time, and Headspace can show you how.
title: Transformative

review: I found this App at the beginning of the pandemic. It really helped me get thru those turbulent times.  I‚Äôd start every day with ‚Äúthe wake-up‚Äù. Now, 2.5 years later I have kept up with a near daily meditation practice and mindfulness has improved my life in so many ways. I‚Äôve always been someone to ‚Äúdo inner work‚Äù, and  this app has helped bring it all together. I‚Äôm an acupuncturist, and I‚Äôm constantly recommending it to my clients. Start small and aim for doing the daily mediation for just 3 mins! Be consistent, work through the courses and you will begin to see small changes in awareness that, with commitment, will have greater and greater impact on your quality of life. Thank you Andy and the headspace team!
title: Life-changing

review: I downloaded this app four years ago and it started me on a journey I didn‚Äôt know I was taking. I became very interested in meditation and learning about where it stemmed from which lead me to receiving my Bachelors Degree in Religious Studies where I learned about many of the roots for meditation. Taking the time to take some time for myself has given me more awareness of my mind which benefits not only me, but the people around me. Meditation, I believe, helps the most with preventing a snowball effect of emotions by noticing the bad thoughts before it‚Äôs nearly unstoppable which could ruin a whole day or weeks without even remembering what started the poor mood. Thank you Headspace for the skill of peace you have taught me ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: 4 Years of Progressive Peace

review:
I am training myself to use healthier coping techniques when handling my mental health symptoms. For example, I have utilized the SOS meditation feature from Headspace and couldn‚Äôt believe the results. I thought it laughable. How could a 3 min meditation remove that tightness in my chest and feeling of dread?!? And I‚Äôm not even ‚Äúgood‚Äù at meditating, doesn‚Äôt matter. I tried. I tried and it worked. And if the feeling came back. I just did the meditation again. I‚Äôd rather do 3 x 3min  meditations a day over an unhealthy response. Headspace is a blessing and an absolute must for my health and wellness.

It would be terribly sad to under estimate the power of meditation‚Äî I learned this first hand. I wish I would have been doing this years ago. 

Want to change your life? Here‚Äôs how.
title: You can‚Äôt afford not to meditate!

review: After experiencing depression and anxiety for close to a year, it was recommended to me to try a meditation app. I downloaded Headspace and have been using it now for 3 months. It has made a tremendous improvement in just a short amount of time. It is very easy to use and when you are ready to move past the ‚Äúbeginner‚Äù programs and move into other elements of practice, the app is ready with a vast library of solutions. I use it every day and am so thankful to have such a well-rounded app at my fingertips. I carry the morning meditations with me throughout the day, use the breathing exercises while at work, and also use the many options to assist with sleep hygiene. Thank you, Headspace!
title: Starting my Mindfulness Practice

review:
I‚Äôve noticed that I have been less on edge at work. When I‚Äôm at home I‚Äôve noticed it was good to use it after work to let go of the day, then enjoy family time. I can recommend.

Update on the app:  Price is ok for what you receive.  I would say the curation of items in general is bad.  A year ago I used to like the music for studying and I felt like it was easy to find.  Now every-time I sit to study it‚Äôs makes my anxiety build just trying to find the music.  For instance, if you click on the music section you get several videos and meditation that talk about how beneficial music.  Not knocking that but it‚Äôs under music when it should be probably be separated or easier to filter.  It‚Äôs just super inconvenient.  I hope this reaches the developers and they can make a change or recommendation.
title: Helpful for my anxiety

review:
I've been struggling with my mental health lately, I'm barely scraping by financially right now. I loved Headspace before and opened it in hopes they had at least one free sleepcast (they do not) and I was offered a free trial. Two weeks free for the annual subscription. Great, I'd have the money in two weeks time. Instead I woke up with a $69 overdraft the next morning. I called initially and got hung up on. I tried emailing after which is where I was told that I did not get the free trial due to paying with my apple iTunes account after already redeeming a free trial previously??? Something like that.

Why is it even offered to returning (ios/itunes using) customers in the first place??? 

I was told that they could do nothing and to contact Apple in hopes for a refund. Now I'm $69 overdrafted and will be charged an additional $30 in fees at 10pm EST.

The step I took to try to get me out of my bad headspace (ha funny pun) just dug me further into it. I have no means to pay it and I doubt Headspace will offer any help or compensation for the additional fees I'm going to accrue from this very unfortunate event.

TLDR; free trial was advertised, got no disclaimer as a returning user, and was instead charged the full monthly subscription price. now will owe $90 if its not refunded. no real help from headspace team other than a sorry i cant do anything, ask apple for a refund.
title: Bad Free Trial Experience
developerResponse: {'id': 32264474, 'body': 'Thank you for reaching out. We are very sorry for the trouble you had with the renewal charge of your subscription. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and provide us with your Headspace account information and we will provide you further assistance.', 'modified': '2022-09-27T20:59:35Z'}

review: This is a great app but I think it‚Äôs disappointing that you have to have a subscription to do anything on the app now. When I downloaded it for the first time a few years ago there were things on the app that you could experience without the paid subscription. It‚Äôs unfortunate that we live in a society where the things that benefit us and help us be better functioning adults and I mean this sincerely‚Ä¶people really benefit from all come at a price. You might be thinking what‚Äôs 5$ a month or 10$ a month but every single app/streaming service is doing the same thing and that adds up to hundreds of dollars in subscriptions. It‚Äôs funny how companies who are just starting out can offer a service for free but then when it gains popularity those same services that were once free‚Ä¶now have a price tag. Maybe they start out wanting to help people but it‚Äôs clear they turn into every other money hungry business.
title: Disappointing
developerResponse: {'id': 27676511, 'body': "The change means we‚Äôll always be able to offer high-quality, meaningful content that can help you stress less and find more joy in your everyday life. With a subscription, you‚Äôll have access to our growing library of meditations and exercises for sleep, stress, movement, and focus. One thing will never change our commitment to improving the health and happiness of the world. We'll still offer meditation and mindfulness content outside of the app on social media channels like YouTube, Snapchat, and Instagram, plus our podcast Radio Headspace and our series on Netflix. We'll also continue to partner with K-12 organizations to provide educators with access at no cost in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada. ", 'modified': '2022-01-26T14:20:21Z'}

review:
Long story, short. .
Seen the Headspace app a few year back, thought it was interesting; just never checked it out. Then I watched the Guide to Meditation series and the Guides to Sleep series on Netflix in 2020. I‚Äôm grateful for it because it was my introductory to Meditation. After going through both series several times, today is the first day I used the Headspace app since purchasing it and it immediately gave me a life changing + self realization moment in 5 minutes. Definitely seeing the gradual benefits of practicing meditation any chance you get rather than not at all, which was my case all the way up until 2020 an especially now.
Put simply. . Yes, I certainly recommend this app lol. üíØ‚úîÔ∏è
title: Headspace Experience

review: I had to cancel Calm because of cost and tried a free trial of Headspace, Headspace has decent content but the UI feels weird to navigate compared to Calm and I feel a lack of content as well. Customer service is also where there is a big difference, I could no longer afford Calm and was issued a full refund after my subscription ended and renewed automatic (1 year subscriber.) Headspace‚Äôs ‚ÄúCustomer Experience‚Äù denied a refund I requested after my trial period ended and renewed, I used the app maybe twice during my trial period and I knew it was not the right one for me, fortunately my insurance offers an app at no extra cost to me, but going back to Headspace of course I would forget to cancel the trial period since now all apps force you to add payment before hand to trap you into these situations. Anyways try at your own risk, please cancel their trial before you are charged as you will receive no help getting your money back afterwards.

review: I started my free trial and have decided not to renew for a subscription. It‚Äôs almost impossible to cancel your subscription after the free trial. I read the FAQs and did exactly what I was supposed to do. First it says to go to your apple subscriptions and cancel it from there, however, it doesn‚Äôt show up as a ‚Äúsubscription‚Äù during a free trial. So I tried the other option to go to an internet browser and select cancel auto renewal. When I clicked auto renewal, nothing happened, I refreshed the page and tried it again. It didn‚Äôt work again. So I emailed the company yesterday asking them to cancel because the website wasn‚Äôt functioning properly and still have not gotten a response. But today I get an email saying ‚Äúthank you for your payment.‚Äù So customer service doesn‚Äôt answer emails but can take your money right away?? Absolutely unacceptable and SKETCHY too! I want my refund ASAP.

review: This app is so well thought out. I hated the thought of meditating, but my mental health was suffering so I tried the app out for the free trial. Oh my god. What a difference it made! This app is truly for beginners and professionals. I only started meditating for three minutes a few days a week and now I‚Äôm meditating about 10 minutes each time. I don‚Äôt meditate daily, but I realize, just like a workout, if I get inconsistent it‚Äôs harder for me to focus and stay healthy. This app has helped my mental health, my eating patterns, my focus, my motivation, and my appreciation! If you‚Äôre thinking about getting it, I‚Äôm telling you, GET IT. It‚Äôs so so worth it. It will change your life. Thank you headspace for all the work you put into this app! You are truly helping people!
title: Worth every penny

review: I love the versatility of this app! There are so many different guided courses available, for many different items people want to work on. There are also collections specific to a certain group of people, plus information about world issues. I also like that you can put in specific goals and these things are tracked on the app. I‚Äôve found collections on this app good for management of anxiety disorders/panic disorders, depression, OCD, ADHD, eating disorders, and management of grief. This is only to list a few, but I truly think a lot of collections can change many people‚Äôs lives for the better. The collections contain science-based evidence and actual psychological evidence, so I enjoy how reliable it can be!
title: ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

review:
Headspace helped me start and continue a journey with meditation, and my wild mind feels better for it. Before trying Headspace, I was convinced meditation wasn‚Äôt for me. I‚Äôd try to sit and think nothing, but would end up fidgeting, restless, and just give up. The beginner series on Headspace held my hand through the learning curve with guided meditations, detailed tips & tricks in the form of fun animations, and calm reminders to let thoughts pass.

I love watching the Wake Up and trying out the daily meditation, and am especially stoked about the unexpected content like mindfulness and money, yoga & movement, and creativity.  My practice isn‚Äôt perfect, but it‚Äôs a lot easier to dive back in with the guidance & resources I find on Headspace.
title: A much needed friend for my wild mind

review: I think I might have been flagged for beta tests because I constantly have features that my friends do not have. It‚Äôs really annoying. More specifically, there are sleep music tracks that I want to play for the entire night but I can‚Äôt seem to change the timings when I play some of them. They are supposed to be able to play for 500 minutes, but mine get capped at 15 or 45, or the icon to change the time is greyed out. My boyfriend‚Äôs phone can play the whole thing. I also get strange navigation menus that look different from my friends. I really don‚Äôt want to be subjected to these beta features and bugs anymore; I just want Headspace to do the few things I need it to do. I am considering canceling my subscription even though I‚Äôve been using it for a few years now.
title: Generally good but buggy

review: I first tried this app for free a couple of years ago but then soon deleted it. I didn‚Äôt really try. It wasn‚Äôt until I saw Headspace Guide to Meditation on Netflix that I was able to fully grasp the concept. I‚Äôve learned so much and continue to dig deeper on how meditation helps me mentally, emotionally and physically. Being stuck at home during Covid can bring a lot of anxiety and depression. This app has helped extremely, it has done wonders and will continue to help me live to the fullest. I ask please, if you are suffering from any of these or stress or even pain, to please please do yourself a favor and try it. Please also watch the show on Netflix. I will forever be thankful for Headspace. It‚Äôs a life changer. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Life Changing

review: My SO told me about this app and recommended I start the free trial. The Free trial is definitely long enough to get you into the habit of using it, and I couldn‚Äôt be without it once it was over! Makes taking time to yourself not only enjoyable but easy as well. So much variety to fit every person as well. I personally use it to do yoga and meditation in the morning, the afternoon , and the night time! Changed my routine to fit more to what I like, and focus on what‚Äôs important. Also, if I‚Äôm having a specific issue , I can INCLUDE that in my routine by using one of the specific categories! If I‚Äôm feeling really anxious mid day? I include an anxiety meditation in the afternoon! It‚Äôs awesome. Everyone needs this app.
title: Worth Every Penny

review: I don‚Äôt write reviews for apps normally but this is such a great app that I want everyone to know about it!! My biggest problem was getting to sleep at night and now this app has fixed that! I just put on a sleepcast and I‚Äôm asleep before the story ends!! I never in a million years thought that it would help! I also have been using the app to help my daughter sleep too. I‚Äôve been using it for her since she was born and she is 2 years old now. When she was a baby she had colic and would cry for hours. When I put headspace on it would help calm her down and get her to stop crying!! This app is amazing! It works for everyone in the family!!! Everyone needs this app in their life!!
title: I love this app!

review:
There‚Äôs too many sections for very niche/specific groups/communities. I‚Äôve had Headspace for 3 years. It used to be meditations for all‚Äîlimited specificity in the practices. Anyone could do any of the meditations and they were generally applicable or instructive to most. It felt like a gift to all people, no matter their identity or beliefs. 

Over the past few years, it‚Äôs become more focused on politically correct inclusion, which really just means more exclusive. The meditation sections are now less about mental health for all, and focused instead on mental health for the Black community and racial injustice, LGBTQIA+ and gender fluid issues, Women and Herstory, etc.

It‚Äôs‚Ä¶ exhausting. And I fall into these categories. Yet I‚Äôm exhausted from having to choose which section most represents me that day. I just want meditations. Simple. Honest. Mental health for all. Not categorized and box checking pandering to the people. 

Because that‚Äôs what it is. Pandering. I‚Äôve switched to Calm. It has represented the issues that Headspace awkwardly tries to dabble in. And I feel like it‚Äôs more welcoming to all. 

Plus, the Calm meditations are more specific and instructive which I really enjoy. Calm is the same price‚Äîbut it‚Äôs honestly worth much more.
title: So much inclusion that it‚Äôs become exclusive

review:
I started headspace right at beginning of pandemic and it‚Äôs changed my life. It keeps getting better and better such as with the focus and move categories. I love the different types of meditation and advice like Andy‚Äôs on techniques and feelings, etc., group headspaces, animations, sleep stuff, and Kevin harts energy shots. My only complaint is that there isn‚Äôt more of Kevin‚Äôs stuff! His energy shots prevent me from wasting time at work!

Haha but seriously this app is amazing. It has gotten me through a lot of difficult feelings and events. I‚Äôm forever thankful I read this random users post on Reddit recommending it to people at start of pandemic. I am an annual member now. 

DOWNLOAD! You won‚Äôt regret it.
title: Download it! It will change you

review: I had tried to learn to meditate for years and never felt like I could do it right or get past the frustrating feeling of failure.  This app broke it down into such manageable pieces of information and small concepts to practice.  I can meditate without the app now but I still enjoy its many features.  My son has used the bedtime stories to get to sleep on difficult nights.I always thought of meditation as an art I wasn‚Äôt talented at.  This app has some great conceptual lessons and practical tools to overcome challenges, stop judging yourself about doing it wrong, and realize whatever you‚Äôre doing is normal and it gets easier with practice.  Incredibly helpful app.  And the sleep tools!  Oh my!  Check them out.
title: Teaches anyone the skill of meditation

review: I have had this app for a long time and I ‚Äúaccidentally‚Äù bought the year long subscription in the fall. $70 is a lot to pay but I mostly use it for the sleep casts and I think it is worth it just for that. The thing I would change is the main screen while the app is loading which currently it is the logo so it‚Äôs a big white screen and when I open the app with to find a sleep cast the bright screen is like unsettling and irritating even though my brightness is all the way down. I love the soft calming tones of the ‚Äúsleep‚Äù page in the app, but anything but the big white screen at the beginning would be amazing. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one that feels this way!
title: I love it! But would make a minor change

review: This app brought me back to meditation after years of neglect.  I learned meditation long ago, but my practice tended to die out.  I‚Äôd get bored or busy or forgetful.  But I watched the headspace series on Netflix and found myself captivated by the new technology.  With headspace, I have access to tons of meditations, guided, semi-guided, or unguided.  There are many specialized meditations as well.  I love that the scientific benefits of meditation are explained.  One thing that helps me maintain a daily practice is the recording of how many days in a row I have participated.  It sounds corny, but I‚Äôm not eager to ‚Äúbreak the chain‚Äù.  Plus there are also group meditations.  Sharing the experience with others makes me feel part of a community.
title: A wonderful meditation app

review:
So do a lot of people. It takes practice and consistency - you are learning a new skill! Just like taking a class, going to school, learning how to be mindful and how to meditate takes time and it is so worth it. You are worth it. 

I love Headspace and have had a subscription for over a year, possibly three years now. When I do it every day, every day I feel good. I create wonderful things for myself because I remember that I can choose to let thoughts go, or I can choose to actually allow the physical experience of emotions occur in my body without resisting them. Headspace, I‚Äôm so, so grateful for you. I want to do this every single day.
title: For everyone who says ‚ÄúI have a hard time meditating‚Äù

review: I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Headspace! I was never drawn to meditation before and did not like the more spiritual/mystical aspect of it. Headspace is so different, though. It has a very down-to-earth, accessible feel. I love how they have meditations to fit so many different situations and moods. The app is a valuable tool for me as someone who struggles with anxiety. It makes me feel calmer, happier, and more confident at dealing with my anxiety. It feels pretty essential to me just like taking vitamins, exercising, getting enough sleep, etc. It would be a great way for anyone to have a healthier lifestyle. Honestly, give it a try even if you‚Äôre not sure if meditation is for you. The yearly subscription is worth every penny to me. Thanks Headspace!
title: New to meditation and love this app!

review:
A few different taking points:

1 - this app has helped me so much in terms of better sleep quality (I love using the Sleepcasts) the visualizations and wind downs within the Sleepcasts and elsewhere in the sleep sections will send you right to sleep.

2 - All of the voices are so soothing (I personally love Eve and Yohannes) 

3 - So I use the sleep section (Sleepcasts, slee radio, soundscapes, wind downs, nighttime SOS which is a very handy little tool btw that I‚Äôve never seen in other apps) and I also use the regular meditation section both of which have helped me immensely in finding peace and grounding myself in times of need. I‚Äôm currently doing the 10 course kindness meditations and it‚Äôs honestly very helpful in finding time to show myself kindness (each session is about 10 minutes or so) 

4 - Get the premium account (its worth it!) At first I was hesitant to pay $75 for a meditation app but it is so worth it. You have access to so much more within the app and I use it way more often now. It is $75 for a whole year though but I would pay even more for this. 

5 - JUST BUY THIS APP ALREADY!!!
title: Download this app now!

review: I really enjoy this app in the sense that it teaches you mindfulness for day to day living. It‚Äôs really helped my anxiety and depression. There are couple things in the app that would be so cool to add. I love how you can favorite meditations but it would be cool if we could make our own playlists for different scenarios. I would also LOVE if there was a ending sound option we could put to know when the meditation is over. I know Andy will sometimes say open the eyes but some don‚Äôt have that and I‚Äôm laying there for a longer time and it would be nice to know the meditation is over so I can make the choice to either keep my eyes closed or start easing back into my day. With the addition of those 2 things would make the app 5 stars!
title: Almost Perfect

review: It‚Äôs crazy how many different components are in this app. Tons of meditations to sort through, many activities that promote good sleep, new movement pages where you can train your body with different skill levels, and a daily schedule that was recently added. I love the daily schedule as it recommends short meditations throughout the day that I wouldn‚Äôt have done otherwise. The wake up is my favorite thing to watch/listen to right when I wake up because it fulfills my need to go on my phone right away and I learn something new and informative every day! I love this app, and you can tell a lot of time and effort was/is put into it. Thank you!!
title: Hard work put into this app

review: This app is so engaging and I can‚Äôt help but want to do my meditations each day. Andy (or whoever you choose) talks you through each meditation in such a relaxing and yet uplifting way. I LOVE the daily sort of map out that shows up each day with the short breathing exercise, ‚ÄúThe Wake Up‚Äù which is a 3-5 minute inspirational food for though sort of video, and then recommended meditations through the morning, afternoon, and evening if you want to do them. I can‚Äôt get enough of this app! I have C-PTSD so needless to say my anxiety is significantly present and trying to use this app at least once a day is making all the difference for me couples with counseling. I‚Äôm so grateful!
title: This app has changed my life

review: When I have a regular medication practice, I‚Äôm always at my happiest and using an app to meditate in a modern world just makes a lot of practical sense. Of the meditation apps out there, I find this one to be the most satisfying. I really appreciate the way Headspace has courses set up as progressions intended to refine a simple skill over ten or thirty days, and you have flexibility to toggle the length of each session as time allows. I also like what they‚Äôve done to expand the original catalog and everything from the original packs can still be found. By repeating the same old guided meditations over and over, I find new levels of depth.
title: When I come back I‚Äôm always glad I did

review: I am learning in small chunks of time how to meditate, how to deepen my practice, how to find the blue sky in life‚Äôs frequent storms and pop-up showers . I am learning this practice is invaluable for my life‚Äôs journey very quickly. I enjoy the voices that guide me‚Ä¶ I can hear their genuine compassion and I feel at ease, safe, and motivated to continue this growth, and also to share this practice with others I know are struggling. The visuals are comforting, and the music is nice to explore too. The organization of the app is thoughtful and easy to navigate. It‚Äôs the first one I‚Äôve tried and I don‚Äôt feel a need to try another because there is so much content here. Thank you! üôèüèº
title: 10 Days In and I Know This Is Helping Me

review:
I like this app a lot. I mostly use it for sleep, and it has helped me find sleep during difficult times. 

The thing I don‚Äôt like about this app, is just that it seems a little limited. It takes me a long time to fall asleep, and it‚Äôs hard to stay asleep, so a lot of times I have to play the story twice. I also need sleep sounds that play all night, but you can‚Äôt currently set the sleep music to play after the story has ended (or a second story to play).

It would be a really beneficial feature if you could set up a play queue, so that you could have a wind down of your choice, a story, and then music play consecutively, so that I don‚Äôt need to keep messing with my phone while I‚Äôm trying to go to sleep.
title: Limited

review: Has helped me so much. I‚Äôve tried to practice meditation in the past but it never stuck, this application giving me a prearranged guided meditation session every morning has made it so much easier to stick to. There‚Äôs a ton of video and audio content, it feels like there‚Äôs no subject around emotions where they just don‚Äôt have a video or meditation. I was questioning whether it was worth the money at first but after roughly a month of doing it I can say that it definitely is even though I‚Äôm on a tight budget because it helps me to be massively more productive and better understand how I feel. Especially if you‚Äôre a freelancer at least hit up the free trial.
title: Changed my dang life

review:
I began my meditation journey (again) during the COVID-19 lockdown with Headspace and I‚Äôve noticed a huge difference in how I am able to pause and observe the world, others, and my emotions and thoughts. This ability to pause has been instrumental in helping me to be a calmer, more patient and compassionate person. This has helped me through this difficult time, and I am committed to my meditation practice as a result. 

I‚Äôve started many journeys into meditation with limited success - this is the first time I‚Äôve been able to fully adapt and integrate meditation into my day, no matter how hectic or dull - there is always 3-5 minutes that I can pause and perform some mental housekeeping - clearing my mind and focusing on my breathing. 

The teachers are so wonderful and helpful and each session has a meaningful take away that builds upon and strengthens the foundations of my practice. 

This has been life changing in the most wonderful way, while our lives and the world around us have all changed in ways we never imagined. This app has helped me find perspective and peace in the midst of chaos.
title: Life Changing!

review:
I‚Äôve had headspace for a very long time. Although there were a few features locked, there was still a good variety of free content I could use. Sleep soundscapes, a meditation course, tips and advice, it provided a lot for free. It helped me build a habit of not only meditating, but simply being conscious and accepting of myself. This app helped me find peace, and it was definitely a 5 star app without paying a single dime. 

This app is no longer free. There is nothing available for you to use without paying, and I‚Äôm still unsure why they made this change. That is why I uninstalled the app, after 5+ years of using it everyday. It is an amazing app if you‚Äôre thinking of subscribing, but I can not afford to subscribe to it. Thankful for all that it taught me, but a little sad that it had to end.
title: Did it‚Äôs job
