review: When I first heard of headspace I was on a path of personal growth and didn‚Äôt know it yet. I‚Äôve gone into growth spurts as a person and I do believe that meditation has allowed ease, access, and gentle understanding on my journey. I rejoined the app during quarantine and it really helped me and I even shared with my child. I don‚Äôt know if there are options for meditations in Spanish, this is my native tongue. I can say that accessing meditation in Spanish may allow to rewrite neural pathways related to my childhood. I would love to see these come into existence and if I may help the team at Headspace I would just to give back & expand access to this practice to a greater demographic of people around the globe.
title: Grateful for Headspace

review:
A therapist recommended headspace to meditate to help with my disassociation. At first I was nervous and it was difficult. I‚Äôm 4 months into my subscription and truth be told I‚Äôve only just finished the first 10 sessions. But the more I work through therapy and try and learn the better I feel. Meditation has made a difference and while there is a learning curve and a healthy dose of personal accountability involved in making it a habit; it is a worthwhile habit and headspace was my favorite (I also tried calm) place to start this journey. 

Ps Idk how true this was my subscription was a gift from my mom but my therapist said some insurance companies will help cover the cost of the yearly subscription!
title: Headspace is changing my life

review:
I have an intense fear when it comes to falling asleep. Sleep means a new day of stress and work. But with Headspace, I‚Äôve learned to accept these worries and workloads as opportunities rather than burdens. To take in my life one step at a time and observe my anxieties rather than try and control them. This gives me a better understanding of what is really happening. 

Not to mention, the sleepscapes help me fall asleep with stories to help keep my mind off of everything else. Wind down sessions to start off to help get you comfortable for bed, followed by soothing story telling that puts me asleep nearly instantly. I love the continuations of the sleep scapes too! The second part of the Rainday Antiques made me so happy <3
title: Best sleep ever

review:
If you struggle with depression, inability to concentrate or let go, and even physical pain, this is for you. I have fibromyalgia and have battled bouts of depression throughout my life. Due to all of this it‚Äôs hard for me to focus and even harder to remain present. I‚Äôve had years of therapy but can honestly say that Headspace is quickly helping me overcome my restless mind, and my physical pain. It is also helping me with my insomnia. I suspect that, in time, I may not need sleeping pills anymore; my intake of pain medication has also decreased.
I‚Äôve been meditating with Andy for only two weeks. I started on Netflix, then moved to the app and I can already see big improvements in my life. This is truly a lifesaver!
title: Best App

review:
I‚Äôve used Headspace for a few months now and used many of the features. The experience has been life-changing. 

A good deal of the anxiety I had been experiencing daily has gone away, without any change in external circumstance. Meditation has helped me slow down and learn to breathe and be calm. I feel more agency over my mood and internal well-being. My wife has commented many times on how present I seem (and how grateful she is for that!).

Headspace Move, the exercise program, focuses on a mindful approach to physical exercise, something I had never experienced before, and it has added a good deal of joy to my physical routine. The video production and design work are outstanding, as is the coaching. I do wish, however, that there was a bit more emphasis on form throughout the workouts ‚Äì if I did not have previous experience with some of the exercises, I might be a bit lost as to how to do them properly and without risk of injury. That said, the emphasis on being gentle and listening to the body each day has certainly helped.

Thank you, Headspace, for creating a product that brings good into the world.
title: Life-changing

review: If you are thinking or interested in perhaps getting headspace‚Ä¶ you should absolutely do so! It has changed my life in so many ways. It‚Äôs apart of my daily routine now. Even if it‚Äôs only 3-5 minutes. It‚Äôs easy to keep up with and a really great experience. My mom and I are buddies on there and we can send each other little positive messages at work, school, or right next to each other at home. Or when I‚Äôm texting friends I get cute little characters from the app. You don‚Äôt need to be stressed about paying for anything there are plenty of free options! Well, I‚Äôll stop my writing here and let you download the app :)
title: thinking about getting headspace?

review: I‚Äôm a 31 y.o female who has very bad anxiety at night particularly after taking accutane amd developing a ‚Äúreaction‚Äù (hyper- vitaminosis a) I know that‚Äôs specific but I want you all to understand the authenticity of this review. You can research how very real and terrible this anxiety can get and after just 5 minuets (2 exercises and one story) I literally feel 80-90% improvement in my anxiety my breathing is more steady my heat rate is steady, my mind is clear and weightless I feel relax (I did also drink one cup of chamomile tea), but truly it‚Äôs the app. NEVER UNDERESTIMATE THE POWER OF MEDITATION AND BREATHING EXERCISES!!! Thank you to the developer of this app and whomever is responsible for the contributing content you truly saved a life.
title: Oh my. This is my savior for nightly anxiety

review: The ‚ÄúToday‚Äù section used to be much better. I miss having the intro signature tune and animation to the Wake Up. ‚ÄúHave a happy, healthy day‚Äù used to be a nice sign-off to the segment - also gone now. It conveyed care and added a tone of hopefulness. The next day‚Äôs Wake Up theme used to be announced, and was usually something to look forward to.  The afternoon lift really was a lift, frequently nature-related, visually soothing but also informative. For late night, there was always a sleepcast. These days, the afternoon lift and the At night selection are frequently just another guided meditation. Just focus on your core - meditation and the training of the mind - , don‚Äôt try to expand into too many areas.
title: Still pretty good, but less so than a year ago

review:
The guided meditation/mindfulness with Andy is very helpful in sticking with the excercise and the advise given along the way at the right time is a golden nugget. Have come to also enjoy the before sleep exercises.

For a week all I got when signing in is a message saying oops,... Try again later. Would be fantastic with some details and an easy way to reach out to support to help clarify why. More information please on what the issue is and where to reach out ensuring someone got my message. I'm assuming you have telemetry around this and it would be great if you would link to a status page where I could see if something is going on Am I the only one with an issue).
title: Andy is Great. Better status and error messages pls.
developerResponse: {'id': 29968008, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the trouble. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.\r\n", 'modified': '2022-05-25T18:49:56Z'}

review: When I began using Headspace a few years ago, there was far less content, and it was far better. I am still only using the app for meditation, and though others may find the other sections helpful, I find it very difficult to navigate and find the meditations I‚Äôm looking for. I‚Äôm also revisiting the Basics course with a friend who is using Headspace for the first time, and discovered the animations are no longer built in to the course. Why? I found them so helpful! I still recommend Headspace to friends wanting to try meditation and still use it myself - but I miss the simplicity, and all the clutter is frankly chaotic to look at and use, which seems the opposite effect I‚Äôm looking for in a meditation app.
title: I miss the old Headspace

review: I am so glad I re-purchased a subscription again recently. I have used headspace on and off for many years and am always impressed with how many new and classic categories there are. The recommendations each morning is always a surprise, and so easy to choose from. I always look forward to the wake up video, especially the ones that are nature-based or showing people doing their crafts. The search bar always gives me results to find music or meditation for whatever theme I‚Äôm wanting to focus on. I can‚Äôt think of a more comprehensive app! I‚Äôm also a fan of Radio Headspace and Dear Headspace podcasts, now within the app!
title: Something for everyone

review: In my opinion Headspace is a useful tool for anxiety and all the physical symptoms that affect someone who suffers from it. This app does a good job providing the breathing techniques and mediations that help calm the storm in your mind that is anxiety. In my abnormal psychology class textbook there are physical symptoms of how anxiety affects the body. Headspace does a good job slowing your heart rate and controlling your breathing which I turn controls your mind trying to tell you that something is wrong when there isn‚Äôt. Anxiety also affects your sleep and headspace offers meditations that help the common worries that keep someone who suffers from anxiety awake. That is why I believe headspace is a useful app for people with anxiety.
title: Headspace review

review: I got headspace a couple years ago, and really enjoyed it. Its a great cooldown tool to calm down and practice mindfulness. No I didn‚Äôt get the paid subscription, but at the time there was enough free stuff to make me satisfied and enjoy the app. I downloaded the app a couple days ago expecting the same experience, but when I logged in there was not a single crumb of material that wasn‚Äôt locked (unless you got the subscription of course). I like the app, but I don‚Äôt like it enough to spend money on it. I‚Äôm in no mood for big mental help, but it‚Äôs such a useful app for centering yourself it‚Äôs sad to see it become pay-to-experience. Because of this I plan on simply uninstalling the app, and there might be other people like me who aren‚Äôt using the app for similar reasons.
title: It used to be better..
developerResponse: {'id': 27128324, 'body': 'We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. Once the trial ends, you can opt to continue your meditation and mindfulness journey with a Headspace subscription or you can cancel. Check out our FAQ for more info and/or alternatives :) https://help.headspace.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008192928-What-s-included-', 'modified': '2021-12-29T16:06:06Z'}

review: Their 1-year free trial during the 2020 pandemic mentally saved my *ss. I haven‚Äôt stopped meditating since. It‚Äôs now a daily habit, and I feel all the better about it. Not saying it will solely save you; it‚Äôs not a cure-all. I‚Äôve had other mental health services and methods to help as well. Still, their adorable animation, their daily morning Wake Up segments at the start of my days, and their Focus music when working on projects have immensely improved my daily mornings. Oh, and their Sleepcasts! I absolutely love them and have my go-to favorites at this point, and I‚Äôm barely getting started with their Sleep music and environmental sounds. All have solidified me as a regular user of Headspace.
title: Mental Lifesaver

review: Headspace is fantastic. I appreciate the way it puts mediation into a do-able, flexible format; and promotes mindful living habits. I miss the way the app was organized and the way the ‚Äúbrand‚Äù was a couple years ago when they used a softer-pallet color scheme for the thumbnails. Back when the Headspace logo was an all caps font. The bold colors (especially in the sleep sections) are too saturated for my taste and seem at a discord for a company promoting stillness in the mind. I also miss the layout/menu organization that the app had back then. But since those complaints have more to do with the recent packaging choices, and not with the actual ‚Äúpackage‚Äù I still give 5 stars because the content is excellent.
title: I love Headspace, but I miss the old app

review: I used to love this app and it helps me fall asleep in no time, even though I only had a few options. But I got the new update and it BOILS MY BLOOD because they made it so almost everything from sounds to meditations are only available for premium users. I understand the app needs to make money but COME ON! There was two options in the sleep meditations before but I only used one because the other wasn‚Äôt as good. Now that one I liked is gone and I‚Äôm left with the short not so good one that‚Äôs not even for the right purpose. Also, they have a whole section for the stories or ‚Äúsleepcasts‚Äù but only one is available for non premium it‚Äôs honestly so annoying. Make more stories and meditations available to normal people who can‚Äôt afford premium please!! I used to love this app but I‚Äôm trying to find new ones now
title: Ugh

review: I love the headspace app and it‚Äôs many different themes, I especially love Eve‚Äôs calming voice and the Appreciation meditation. It helps me to see all the things that surround me and be grateful for what I achieved for myself so far. In fact I do the 10 sessions over and over infinitely to nurture and ground this feeling of appreciation. Also love the Wake Up and the daily 5 min session that introduces you to so many different things. The app gets better and better and I love the cross referencing to see and explore all that the app has to offer. Love the sleep casts and the Star Wars theme. Especially love the Midnight Diner sleepstory and Beachcomber! I already meditated over 4000 min! To many more! Tuna
title: Grounding Yorself for the Day

review:
I‚Äôm a college student whose worked at Starbucks in the past and through Starbucks I used the free headspace that they offered for their employees. I found out that taking just a little bit of time for myself every day (or as often as I could) really helped me process my emotions better and just improved my general mood. 
Later once I no longer worked at Starbucks I found out that headspace has a student yearly membership for a great price and decided to bite the bullet. I‚Äôm so glad I did. You get WAY more than just meditation out of this app and it‚Äôs 100% worth the money that you pay for it. I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough to everyone.
title: So helpful

review:
I love meditation. Love. It. It‚Äôs my new favorite thing to do. The guides give just the right amount of prompts to lead and guide you through the process. And constantly remind you that it‚Äôs ok to get distracted as you go along. You don‚Äôt become a master overnight. 

I‚Äôve had this app on my phone for several months and finally just decided that my life needed a change. I felt stressed more often than not and overwhelmed by all the changes being forced on us in our lives. And I decided I didn‚Äôt want to live in that negative space anymore. 

After only a few weeks of using the Headspace app, I can feel a change. I feel lighter, happier, and overall find it easier to let go of the negative emotions I‚Äôm experiencing, rather than holding onto them, fixating on them and letting them run my life. 

Meditation is leading me down a path toward peace, patience and a better understanding of myself and by extension, the world around me. 

I cannot emphasize enough how much I love this app and deeply appreciate the people who created it. Thank you. This is exactly what I needed in my life.
title: Where has this app been all my life?

review: I am a preschool teacher and I have been using Headspace with myself and my classroom to introduce and cultivate mindfulness and a sense of calm into the day. I have found that both my classroom environment, children, and myself have all seen a significant difference in the short amount of time that we have been doing it. I incorporated meditation into our daily lesson plan in the mornings and whenever the classroom and myself were getting too chaotic. I‚Äôve also used it many times throughout the day with children and myself during meltdowns and extreme behaviors. I seen wonders! The brain is a muscle and we must exercise it, especially during these tumultuous times! Thank you, headspace! I totally recommend üåü
title: Life Changing

review:
Our brains were created with as much emphasis on fears and doubt and the anxiety that goes with that, as elation and positivity . Headspace teaches us how to rewire our brains so that we control those emotions / release that effect on our health in the negative. 

I am a 2 year subscriber and as a past Chairman of a Board  during Covid, and I feel as if  it saved my life during the most intense negotiations with the Board and members.  Now I have taken those skills that Headspace taught to grow professionally and accept a promotion that I would have never thought that I would be able to accomplish with my anxieties. Thank you. 

God bless all those involved in this project.üòÉ
title: Excellent-it has it all!

review: Me and my brother can not go to sleep so when we saw this add for a app we needed to try it I signed in and we followed all of the steps and we were asleep in minutes! We tried clam a day ago but is costed money so when we tried this and fell asleep that fast we were stand! And they let you choose from different things like being calm, getting more sleep, stoping anxiety, and a bit more. Get this app if you need help any of these! But make sure you have any so of Account like a google account to use to login in to make a account for app! Get and have no more sleep issues anxiety pressure stress and become calm!
title: Really works so well! You need this app!

review: Headspace is incredible! I recommend it to everyone, at less than what you pay for Netflix/Prime. You can afford to pay for something to support your emotional and mental well-being. Headspace helps ground you on both busy and happy days, helps you sleep (I can fall asleep to Andy‚Äôs voice anytime!), helps you process those gritty things life throws at you or that you haven‚Äôt been able to for years. It‚Äôs not magic, it‚Äôs mindfulness. The wonders centering yourself and just being can do, allowing the world to be what it is. Not gamified like some other similar apps, just trying to make a positive difference for individuals.
title: Has helped me heal & made me stronger!

review: My girlfriend recently broke up with me, and I dont need to go into why as obviously its personal. I‚Äôll just say this app and meditation in general are fantastic! I was and am still going through a lot of emotions but Headspace is helping me out a lot. I really like the british accent which you may laugh at, but I find it soothing as I have listened to meditation apps with others and its not as good in my opinion. If you are on the fence about meditation dont be try it for a week and youll be addicted which is not the worst thing to be addicted too! This app literally saved my life as I was going to end it. Thank you to everyone at Headspace God bless you all.
title: This app has LITERALLY saved my life

review: I purchased this app last year. It was incredibly helpful for my mental health, and I even played the music in my high school classroom. Students commented how they could focus without falling asleep (high praise from a teenager!). I enjoyed the mindful meditation sessions as well. Ultimately, I couldn‚Äôt afford to keep the app and justify the added expense. I‚Äôve been thinking about purchasing it again recently to help with falling asleep at night and some depression I‚Äôve been dealing with recently, and I was completely shocked to find that headspace offers this service for FREE to teachers. I can‚Äôt even begin to explain how amazing this is. I actually cried. Thank you so much.
title: Thank You!

review:
Whether you‚Äôre new to meditation or have been practicing for decades, Headspace is a must have. It has been an amazing source of comfort and clarity in my life, and many people close to me. But boy have they sold out.

Started slow. They started by adding meditations that were actually just implicit commentaries on social/political events. Distracting, but whatever. Now they‚Äôre aggressively promoting options such as ‚ÄúTame Your Inner Wookie‚Ñ¢Ô∏è‚Äù and ‚ÄúBreathe With R2-D2‚Ñ¢Ô∏è‚Äù. Maybe the idea is that kids like it and we want kids to be more mindful, but I would like to see them drill down more on the fundamentals of mediation/mindfulness, and spend less of their energies cashing in on every opportunity they get to make a buck.
title: Incredible. But Yikes With The Star Wars Thing

review: When I first started meditating, it was my first time managing a team at work, I had a new child at home, and was trying to start my own business on the side. I was stressed. I was overwhelmed. And I had heard of meditation and how powerful it was but never prioritized it. When I decided to start meditating, I needed something quick and easy to follow and this app is just that. After 2-3 years of using it almost daily, I feel more relaxed, I‚Äôm more aware of the thoughts I have in my head, and I can honestly say this app has played a major role in it. Thank you to the headspace team for the amazing app, meditations and support!
title: This app made me a better person !

review: You do the same thing for every course it seems. I have completed 4 courses. They all teach the exact same thing. Get it tune with your breathing, if thoughts or feelings arise, note them, scan body from head to toe, let mind wander freely, bring attention back to breathing. End.   You don‚Äôt really get any other tips. Possibly the only thing is that each day you notice more times you are having the certain thoughts you are trying to get rid of, say anxiety. So day 1 notice 1 time you got anxious, day two notice 3 times. The thing is the exercises don‚Äôt change. It‚Äôs the exact same thing. So to save money just do the mindfulness exercises above for anything that bothers you and that‚Äôs it. No other special tips needed, according to headspace. Simple mindfulness breathing exercises, the same one helps for everything, period, the end
title: The same for every course

review: I started using headspace when I was in the middle of an emotional breakdown. I was dealing with a lot of anxiety and depression, something I never thought I would deal with in my my life. I felt guilt for feeling this way because to anyone observing my life, they would think I had everything I could ever ask for. It just didn‚Äôt make sense why I was feeling so so so low. This app taught me that it is okay feel that way. It has taught me to accept whatever emotion or situation that may come my way. Headspace helped me out of the deep hole I was in and I continue to use this app because it truly makes each day brighter.
title: The only app that can really change your life

review: I have been practicing meditation through Headspace for about three  years now. Started during the pandemic and have carried it through. I begin my day with the meditation thought for the day and I have liked these so much that I have started writing these down to come back to for reflection. The voice guidance has worked well for me and now I am able to do the unguided sessions  with little help. Not only that, the technique has helped me through out the day to bring me back to the moment and live through life moment through moment. It has helped me keep my anxieties at bay and stay calm through many of life‚Äôs untoward turns .
title: Oasis

review: Hi! I recently have had sleep issues to the point where I was getting about 5 hours of sleep every night. I am in high school and all the homework and countless hours of dance is a lot so those hours of sleep just don‚Äôt work for me. I tried searching for the perfect meditation app with no success. Until I found Headspace. It does cost money‚Ä¶. BUT ITS WORTH IT. If you have anger issues, stress issues, sleep issues, or any issues try Headspace! They have meditations (duh!) work outs, energy shots with Kevin Heart, music, sleepcasts, sleep sounds, meditations for kids, animal videos, and more! If you need a good meditation app try headspace!
title: Helped Me with Sleep Issues Would Recommend!

review: There is such a wonderful assortment of gentle stories that help me go to sleep. I highly recommend these sleepcasts. I really like that the stories all get varied so they don‚Äôt get repetitious. The volume during the sleepcasts sometimes seems to vary, so I find it‚Äôs best to keep them on low volume so that if there is an increase, it is not as disturbing. I have a preference for the sleep casts where the speaker is speaking in a low voice and slowly but that‚Äôs just my preference, other people may enjoy the sleep casts that are a little bit faster and higher pitched. In this very tough past year I don‚Äôt know what I would‚Äôve done without Headspace‚Äôs sleep casts.
title: Sleepcasts are the best

review:
Took some time for me to commit to using this, because it seems like the problems I have need an immediate and urgent fix, and so whenever I used to start headspace, I would get impatient and stop because there is no immediate change, result, or answer. 
This application is helping me see that an ‚Äòanswer‚Äô is not an actual solution for the problems or pressing issues of the mind. Though you may try to desperately seek it to settle the mind. Space is what you need - from your emotions, thoughts, feelings. Head space.... solutions are made with problems. It‚Äôs the in between from problem to solution where the mind/human experience gets involved.
title: Nice

review: I‚Äôve heard about meditation before but was skeptical about how helpful it can be. I started using the app based on a recommendation and also my own research on how to manage overwhelming situations/life events. The number one thing that kept coming up was meditation and now I know why! It has helped me manage the most overwhelming situations. I recommend to give it a try and start with short meditation times at first then work your way up if you can‚Äôt sit still for too long. The lessons and greater headspace I have gotten from meditating with this app are priceless.
title: Crazy how helpful this is! Started using this year, have used to everyday since

review: Do you know how much this app means to me?? It‚Äôs like my own meditation adventure Andy puddicombe (tell me if that‚Äôs the right way to spell it) is a life saver I recently broke up with my husband after 15 years together and it has been depressing and sad without him at least I have my 2 beautiful loving kids but it still has been so hard they still cry in their rooms the minute I leave and turn out the light so it has been hard to be strong for my kids but headspace has helped so much I take the meditations on sadness and it helps me. A lot and my kids took the meditation of Sesame Street this app is so beautiful and the animations are calming and spot on it is great thank you Andy and headspace team!!
title: I love this app

review: Prior to the Covid 19 pandemic I had limited personal experience with Meditation. In my counseling practice, I often refer clients to try meditation or mindfulness strategies to support mental health needs. My only personal experience with meditation was through yoga. I struggled with clearing my thoughts when meditating. Since a colleague shared this resource with me I have grown to love meditation. The Headspace app has provided me with insights, tips and support as I grow in my meditation practice. I‚Äôm grateful to have this tool to support me as I‚Äôm supporting others struggling with mental health needs. Mindfulness is a therapy I use in practice with clients. I absolutely love using it for myself with Headspace.
title: I wasn‚Äôt a believer but now I am

review: I've struggled with mental illness since I was a teen and have been to many therapists. So I've learned by now what I need to do for myself to be happy, but i need something to help me with the particularly hard days. This app does exactly that. Although the subscription may not seem cheap to some, it is far cheaper than paying for therapy for a year. In comparison headspace seams very cheap. I continue to learn about myself and grow with the seemingly endless classes they offer, led by the most wonderful people you could ever hope to meet, who speak to you the way every child hopes to be spoken to. And on my darkest days, that's exactly what I need.
title: Your new therapist

review:
I‚Äôve been doing a lot of reading and practicing of meditation and this app really opens up some concepts for me In a clear and concise manor and it has been really helpful for reaching mindfulness in my day-to-day life.    I also really like the teachers and find their different guidance and perspectives very insightful.    

A HUGE PLUS is the Dreamcast night time guided meditations for sleep as well as the bed time stories.    I never make it more than 5 minutes into any of them and I‚Äôm out. Lol.    

All-in-all, I feel like my life has definitely been improved through practicing mindfulness and as such, also through using this app.
title: I‚Äôm so glad I found this.

review: I think headspace is a great way for beginners like myself to start meditating. It Also includes a neat feature to remind you to meditate. I believe meditation should be part of everyone‚Äôs day and routine no matter how hectic your life is, even if it is difficult sometimes. This app helps start meditations and give you the tools to start doing it alone, when you don‚Äôt have any assistance. I‚Äôd recommend it. I mean this honestly, there‚Äôs not a lot of things I‚Äôd genuinely recommend and do so enthusiastically. I won‚Äôt barge it into conversations or anything, but if it comes up, I‚Äôll definitely advise at least checking it out, or trying the free trial.
title: Great for beginners

review: i‚Äôve had this app downloaded several times throughout the pay couple years because there were times when i strayed away from meditation for a while and every time i come back the prices are just pushed up more and more :( i was very disappointed to see this time downloading it then it‚Äôs now only a paid app, at first most of the options used to be free and then for a long time you could atleast access the beginner levels for free but now you can do anything without paying for it, it‚Äôs completely no use without a subscription, very sad too see that even an app like this that was created for mental health purposes stooped to eliminating all free services :/ while it may not seem like a lot, not all of us have the money to spend on subscriptions for things like this
title: Raising Prices :(

review: I first subscribed to the Headspace app years ago and have been using it daily for the last year. I feel so much better now and so much of that is through the mindfulness and meditation practice Headspace has inspired. I usually do the daily meditation and am also doing the 365 course. I‚Äôve explored many of the courses and they are all worthwhile. The meditation teachers are so kind and knowledgeable and helpful. I‚Äôve learned so much from all of them. I also enjoy the wake-up videos and the dear headspace podcast. I am so grateful for all that‚Äôs included with my subscription. It‚Äôs provided me with just what I‚Äôve needed as I‚Äôve needed it.
title: Helps so much

review: I‚Äôve tried other meditation apps, but found them a collection of things without any idea how to use them. Headspace is different. It provides the guidance to help you learn how to develop a meditation practice while still having the freedom to choose different topics. I especially like that there are different instructors available to guide you through each course. The instructors are all excellent, but one thing I‚Äôve found is using different instructors for different topics helps me. I‚Äôm very pleased to have found such a simple tool for less than the cost of a latte once a month.
title: Perfect for getting started & developing a practice

review: I never meditated prior to 2020 at the beginning of the new year a friend shared meditation with me and I have been hooked ever since. This app helps you work through thoughts and emotions in a different way than you would expect and doesn‚Äôt make you feel like you need to be a Buddhist monk to meditate. Meditation comes in all different forms and that has been a real learning experience for me. This app teachers you the life cycle of meditation process and ideology to help you learn more about your self and others. I know meditate at least once a day for five minutes and have meditated certain days up to four times, I love it.
title: Helps so much!!!

review:
I mostly use the app for sleeping but love the meditations too. Overall it‚Äôs a great app. However, I really wish they‚Äôd add a playlist feature so I can listen to a sleepcast and have a soundscape play afterwards. I enjoy the sleep casts especially on nights where my mind is racing and I can‚Äôt shut it off. They help me fall asleep but since they are so short I don‚Äôt always stay asleep. I would love a feature where I can choose to have either the background noise continue to play through the night after the story is done or make a playlist where I can choose what comes next. 
Anyway just a feature I think a lot of people could benefit from.
title: Mostly Love the app but could improve

If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.\r\n", 'modified': '2023-03-13T19:27:07Z'}

review: I‚Äôve been using Headspace for almost two years. I was struggling with anxiety caused by PTSD and my therapist recommended trying this app with the free features. I almost immediately started seeing changes in my day to day life. My anxiety and PTSD symptoms are more manageable then I ever could have imagined. I signed up for a subscription after trying the free trial and never looked back. There is a $10 annual student subscription option, which is awesome. The sleepcasts are great and help when I‚Äôm having a restless night or spending the night away from home. I could not recommend this app enough the premium is worth every single penny.
title: Changed my life!!

review: An insanely reasonable price for changing your life. It makes meditation and mindfulness accessible to all, excuses impossible, incentivizes consistency and meets you wherever you are at. I love that you can change the length of nearly every meditation starting at just 3 minutes. The check-ins feature is great. I‚Äôve done their workouts, talks and music playlists too. I started with this app when it first came out, learned meditation on my own and then fell off the wagon for so long the thought of meditation terrified me. No shame in a little help from technology‚Ä¶. This app got me right back in and I plan on keeping my subscription indefinitely.
title: Worth it ++++

review: I have gotten this app before, but I never put the time into my schedule to actually use it and meditate with it. But recently I have the urge to mediate more and focus on my mind. It is so calming, relaxing, and peaceful. When I am stressed or just in a bad mood in general, it‚Äôs nice to take a few minutes on headspace. Sometimes after school is nice, or before studying. As a student this is a very helpful app. It‚Äôs also great to get moving! Or fall asleep to! Or even focus too! I recommend this app for everyone, all ages, and especially students in high school, middle school, and college! It‚Äôs free, unless you want the premum version. I have the free account, and it‚Äôs just as good! Highly recommended app!
title: Sensational App!

review: This app is a great idea and I fully support it, that‚Äôs why I downloaded the app after all. When it comes to things like this I usually think there will be at least some free courses even if there isn‚Äôt many. If you don‚Äôt buy the subscription then there‚Äôs nothing to do on the app. I personally believe more people should be exposed to meditation and mindfulness and should not be limited because they can‚Äôt afford it. I do agree that the prices are reasonable but I personally cannot afford this even though I would like to. I just think that headspace should offer a few choices for those who can‚Äôt subscribe. Please try to understand that i‚Äôm only reaching out for the sake of others, and not to protest against this app.
title: Nothing included for free

review:
Headspace has a special place in my heart because it‚Äôs what got me started doing meditation. It also made me realize just how important meditation is for the mind. 

The app is beautifully designed in a simple, navigable interface with different guided meditations you can do throughout the day. However, one of the absolute best parts of Headspace isn‚Äôt even really a meditation at all, it‚Äôs the sleep scapes. These are guided sleep stories/hypnosis/meditation with ambience that did more to help my insomnia than anything else. I kept my Headspace subscription literally just for them. 

I no longer use Headspace or do mindfulness because I prefer more advanced practices, but it‚Äôs nice to come back to every now and again. The graduation from Headspace is realizing that meditation is so much more than the westernized version of it. And if you tried mindfulness and it‚Äôs not for you, there are thousands of other practices you could try instead. 

Best of luck, and I would highly recommend downloading this app if you‚Äôre new to meditation
title: The beginning

review: I feel so much calmer now then ever! (Especially cause I have ADHD, anxiety, and a little of depression) It really helps me walk through the steps and realize there is so much you can do with just a little meditation and time. You can learn to relax, accomplish goals, sleep better and so much more in just 15 (or less) minuets a day!! Edit: For more than 120 days i used soundscapes to help me sleep! Plus once you have a day streak for an amount of days they give you free membership for some time to send to a friend! (Or you I never tried) üòç IT REALLY DOES HELP ME!!! üòç I work better now with sleeping better, and I love having a good meditation on car trips!!üòå
title: IT REALLY DOES HELP ME!!üôÉ

review: I‚Äôve been using Headspace since 2018. Recent changes have made the iPhone app less useful for me. First, one can no longer see the record of brief messages from each day‚Äôs daily meditation. Second, I‚Äôm no longer able to access today‚Äôs meditation on the app for iPhone. The app keeps asking me to choose a teacher but will not play the meditation after I‚Äôve done so. The second flaw can be easily addressed. The first one reflects a change in the app that is unfortunate and makes me wonder about increased efforts at data mining. Headspace has changed my life but I would cancel my subscription if I felt sure that changes in the app were motivated by a plan to get more data from me.
title: Recent changes have made the app less useful

review: Before I got this app, I simply could not sleep deeply. I never woke up feeling rested. It went on for over a year and nothing would work, including melatonin. But introduce Headspace sleepcasts, and I sleep a thousand times better!! Every single night I fall asleep listening to one, and I never make it to the end of the recording. It‚Äôs incredible! Absolutely worth the subscription simply for that. I also have been using the meditation section recently, which is quite nice as well. The only ‚Äúcomplaint‚Äù I have would be that I wish you could put out new sleepcasts more often! :) THANK YOU Headspace, for my newfound consistent sleep.
title: A sleep miracle!!

review: As a total beginner to meditation, I had no idea what I was getting into or if this would actually help me. This past year with the pandemic and other things recently occurring in my life has send me down a path of feeling very stressed and anxious, letting fear and worry take over my mind. Since beginning my journey of meditation a few weeks ago, I feel much calmer and grounded throughout the day. I feel more hopeful again for the future and feel like I can get past my struggles finally. Thank you at the team from headspace so much! You guys have no idea how much of an impact you are making on the lives of strangers.
title: Thank you Headspace!

review: I have always been such a negative thinker and full of much stress and the anxiety. This has changed my life. I was having heart PVCs so bad. And they have completely stopped! I do everything on this app. Every single morning as soon as I wake up. And on my lunch and before I go to bed , Then I do the exercises. And then I watch the earth videos. I turn off the news and focus on everything else on this app which is turned my life and my mind completely around. I am more positive I feel calmer and complete! Thank you Andy you have saved my life. Over the years I have tryed everything to calm my self and I am 56 years old and this Headspace is the place to be everyday!
title: From Deborah

review:
I‚Äôve used Headspace for more than 2 years, everyday. Love it. But WHY with the latest update can I not see who I am selecting as the instructor and why can you not remember how many minutes a previous meditation was set for? All my regular favorite meditations are reverting back to the shortest amount of time every time I use them.  And instead of selecting an instructor and then setting a time I have 2 lists of identical time settings with no names. This makes no sense. 

Update:  I just updated the version and the interface has changed. I didn‚Äôt think I could pick the instructor at all but finally played around with the different icons in the corners and found it. Now let‚Äôs see if the selections stick.
title: Love the app; hate the latest changes!
developerResponse: {'id': 32232731, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the difficulties with the meditation settings management. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.", 'modified': '2022-09-26T11:30:23Z'}

review:
HeadSpace is amazing don't get me wrong, but i remember headspace being completely free with little bits of payment, now the whole app is just one big pay phone, nothings free on there anymore just the same old basics, and i've listened to the same basics for the past 3 years now, i have every word memorized.
And I know paying $5.99 month isn't much but for a 16 year old who doesn't have a job and can't pay for these things, it's hard coming back to headspace cause it's just the same things all over again. I honestly I just wish the "basic" courses were all free, or at least free for everyone for a week or two, but still though this app is actually amazing.
title: The DownFall

review: Been having a fine time using headspace while trying to work through some stressful times in my life. Sadly headspace has only added to the stress after today when I signed up for the 2 week trial and it charged my account and started an annual subscription with no way of getting a refund. I did not want this and I kind of needed that $76 that was stolen from me. There isn‚Äôt necessarily anything wrong with what the app is supposed to do it works well at calming me down but any company that will do something like this is one that I will not support. If you do decide to use this app I would absolutely not use the free trial and only get a paid subscription if it‚Äôs actually something that you know you‚Äôll want. You will very likely not be able to get a refund especially if your purchase was made through iOS.
title: I‚Äôd give 0 stars if I could
developerResponse: {'id': 27809599, 'body': "We appreciate that we are able to be there when you need it the most, we are here to help. We understand what happened, a simple mistake but please don't worry, we are still able to assist you. similar to all purchases through iTunes, we don't have access to your billing but if your annual purchase is within the first 30 days, your refund can be processed. :) For more info, please send us an email at help@headspace.com\r\n\r\n", 'modified': '2022-02-02T15:53:44Z'}

review:
Like many people I lost my position at a school during the pandemic.  Again, like many who suffer with depression, found it was only exasperated by the pandemic.  So we had pre pandemic depression, during the pandemic and post depression (even though we are still fighting the variant). 
 I was helping my kindergartner and 1st grader with online learning while trying to keep my 3 yo daughter occupied (she did a lot of body and wall art with markers).  I needed a release for my mental health and Headspace was there and still is.  Headspace at the time, due to the pandemic offered free services and I was snd am forever grateful.  Thank you.
title: Depression and Anxiety exasperated during the pandemic

review: This app has singlehandedly allowed me to get better sleep, become more confident, and relax when I‚Äôm in a stressful situation. However, this is not a ‚Äúmagic‚Äù app. This app teaches you the skills necessary to meditate on your own. It is a ‚Äúteach a man to fish‚Äù par excelance type of app. Through it, I can go to sleep in 2 minutes or less at night, be rejuvenated during my day with a 5-minute meditation, and even call a company for my first ever job interview with a meditation for confidence or anxiety. This app is not able to be encapsulated in one review, but the 5-stars may as well be a given!
title: Entirely worth it, this is the best app I have on my phone to date

review: Headspace does a lot of advertising, I have had depression and anxiety most of my 50 years.  I decided to give it a try.  I thought some of the meditation were very simplistic, and not espcially useful.  The annual supbsription of almost $80 is very high for the quality of the media.  You would be better off looking for professional CD or even podcasts.  Headspace claims to have clinical proof for it's program.  Having a background in healthcare sales I would like to see a professional overview of thier claims.  Just a simple meta-data review by a third party would be useful.  Save your money and look around, for the price of the subscription you can pay less and get much better content.  I think this program was devised for type A people who want to feel like they are doing something for thier mental health.  Serenity Now!
title: Slick but lite weight with a heavy pricetage

review: I began using Headspace to meditate but it wasn‚Äôt consistent so I didn‚Äôt see the value in it but in the past few months I‚Äôve been using it pretty consistently and there wasn‚Äôt a single moment where I realized it but I‚Äôve just noticed small things like I don‚Äôt get upset on the road anymore or I give myself time in stressful situations instead of giving knee-jerk reactions. These small changes have made all the difference. Is meditating super easy for me now? No. But it‚Äôs gotten easier and the way Andy talks you through it is very soothing. I could not recommend this more!
title: This app has single-handedly changed me as a person

review:
Easy to get started for a novice. I might say there is room for improvement in helping beginners move into additional content they may enjoy. 

 For criticism, I feel the app requests access to push notifications way too often. I declined, my mind is not changing, stop asking please. 

One bug I encounter often is that the daily meditation exercise on the Today tab fails to load on first attempt. Closing the exercise and loading again resolves it. It seems to be some of fetched data is missing when attempting to load the exercise. The error states: ‚ÄúSomething went wrong. Visit the Discovery tab to try a new meditation or single.‚Äù
title: Well-designed product

review: okay this is like the first review i‚Äôve ever taken the time to write about an app on my phone. headspace hit different for REAL. i started using it in 2018, about three years ago, and it‚Äôs changed my life. like if you dedicate yourself to a daily practice, even of small increments and become aware of some of the changes that begin to take place, you‚Äôll see so many shifts in your own consciousness as well as those around you. it‚Äôs not a miracle fix to every problem, but it soothes out some of the wrinkles of the mind which can really be a nuisance in today‚Äôs world that moves at a breakneck pace.
title: on everything get this app

review:
I have never meditated even though I‚Äôve always thought it would be very good for me. I just didn‚Äôt know how to start. My daughter inspired me to try Headspace and I‚Äôm really loving it. I‚Äôm only on day 5 but by day 2 I was already seeing the benefits and most importantly it seems to be helping me with my sleep. 

The only trouble is is that sometimes I find it hard to navigate. To find the things I had previously used and enjoyed. I wasn‚Äôt really sure where I was supposed to start so I just tried searching through and finding stuff. I do wish there were step by step instructions and maybe there are but I do t know where to look for them.
title: Enjoying this

review:
Now since this has helped me a lot with insomnia injury stress and getting back to gym and not stressing in math it helps and has good meditation though I have two things I would change. First, I wish they had  a video about coping mechanisms especially since mine is popping parts of my body mainly fingers which most people know isn‚Äôt good for joints. I do symmetrical things with my fingers everyday and it worry‚Äôs  my mom which I wish had a way to change. Second no more premium because I can barely unlock things without it and now the few things unlocked I need PREMIUM to do it. This just raises levels
of stress and is to much money. This just gives me no reason to meditate because I can‚Äôt meditate on what I need to medatate.
title: No more premium

review: First, if you are considering this app, do yourself a favor and download it.  Whether you were interested in meditation, experiencing depression, need a little nudge in your life, or you‚Äôre in a deep dark place, headspace is an amazing app that anyone can benefit from. I was in a dark depressive place in my life and tried therapy, medication, AA, yoga, church, and everything in between. Some of those things were affective and some weren‚Äôt, but by far and away headspace was the best thing to happen to me. I can‚Äôt recommend it enough, and it is truly amazing what can happen when you truly learn to live in the present. Thank you headspace.
title: Thank you

review: This review is for the poor customer service. I got several notices asking me to update my payment info, that it was unable to be processed. The credit card was valid and fully functional, yet their system claimed there was an error with my payment. Emails to customer service went unanswered and their Instagram account happily posted content daily, an inconsistency between their communication via email. I reached out to them via Instagram and I was assured I‚Äôd be assisted. Unfortunately, the ball was dropped there too and I have deleted the app from my phone with zero interest in continuing business with them. I‚Äôve been using Headspace for years and this is the service I receive. Seems like they‚Äôre only interested in acquiring new customers instead of servicing and maintaining their existing ones.
title: Headspace only focused on their bottom line.
developerResponse: {'id': 34382312, 'body': "We're so sorry for the trouble you are having with your renewal and apologize for the delay in getting back to you! Our support team is experiencing higher than usual email volume, and are working hard to respond to each inquiry as it comes in.  Please know that your request is important to us, and someone will be getting back to you soon to resolve the issue you are having.  We appreciate your patience! ", 'modified': '2023-01-19T14:11:25Z'}

review: I used to love Headspace! I‚Äôve been using it for years. However, the Netflix deal seemed to correspond with a major shift in priorities at Headspace. The content has gone from educational and engaging to a poorly executed attempt to incorporate all that is woke and politically catchy. For example, the Wake Up used to have really enjoyable videos and information about animals and the world around us. Now half the videos are about inclusion and spirit fingers (just stupid dance videos). Even the content of the meditations themselves has shifted to mirror the priorities of the political left (i.e. recognizing privilege). Andy and Eve, the founders, must have been too mainstream because they have seemingly been sidelined to include a slew of new, more diverse teachers. I‚Äôve already cancelled my subscription but don‚Äôt have an alternative yet.
title: I blame Netflix

review: About a month ago I made the big decision to quit smoking which I had used as a form of self medication to calm anxiety. Well once I stopped my anxiety sky rocketed and that was when i made the choice to try meditation. I had heard the benefits but was still skeptical. Since I‚Äôve started I‚Äôve experienced such a grand reduction in my anxiety and have quit smoking altogether. I feel like headspace gives you the perfect toolkit to take on anxiety and stress and find moments of calm that become habits. The breathing exercises I‚Äôve learned have been beyond beneficial. I would recommend this app to everyone!
title: headspace has helped so much with my anxiety

review: I have a few mental disabilities and illnesses, and a few months ago I was really struggling with night anxiety. I would lie awake until 3 or 4 am every night, so I asked my therapist what I should do and she said I needed to try meditation. I started using this app and after the trial period I signed up for the full year subscription! It‚Äôs amazing, I rarely get night anxiety and I can deal with anxiety in the day much better. I listen to the sleep casts sometimes, too, I just wish they had more narrated by Simon. He‚Äôs the only one I fall asleep to for some reason so I just re-listen to the bookstore ones. And the SOSs really work for me!!
title: Oooh yea

review: I honestly put off getting headspace for a while because I didn‚Äôt think I needed it. But over the past couple months my anxiety has increased and I knew I needed something to help. I was addicted to scrolling on TikTok, staying up late, sleeping in and not working out, and more. Once I started using headspace though, I have felt so much better! I meditate with the app everyday and I do deep breathing exercises, I read my book before going to bed, I sleep better at night and fall asleep to the night time stories on the app. I workout more and overall feel motivated. I‚Äôm very grateful I started using headspace.
title: Changing my life

review: I have been using headspace for a couple of years now and it has been such a helpful tool for me. I haven‚Äôt tried a lot of the newer resources, but the daily meditations and meditation packs are so good! I love Andy Puddicome‚Äôs soothing voice and down-to-earth commentary, and how using guided meditation helps me stay on track and integrate meditation as a habit into my daily life. The focus playlists have also been a lifesaver. Kindness‚Äôs playlist is pretty fire. The yearly subscription is expensive but was worth it for me this year in a very stressful job. It‚Äôs the best meditation app of any I‚Äôve tried by a long shot. Highly recommend!
title: Such a helpful tool

review: This is one of the best investments of 2021. As a beginner, I find the instructions very helpful in training the mind to be calm and happy. Even 5-10 minutes of daily practice makes a lot of difference throughout the day.  Of course it takes time to see lasting changes in ones behavior, but I could feel noticeable changes from the first day itself. It is positively impacting my work and personal life. There have been times when I didn‚Äôt trained many days in a row, but then going back to the basics course makes it ever so easier to get back on track. Love the app. Thanks Headspace.
title: Super helpful; extremely happy!

review:
This app is the best purchase of my life it‚Äôs helped me so much!!!! I love this app so much it might actually be my favorite app the way it explains meditation so slickly it almost makes it sound easy and it is after  you practice practice and practice I‚Äôm only 11 i‚Äôve been meditating since I was 10 and it has changed my life so thank you producers of headspace this has changed my life for the better! So thank you so much for listening and dedicating a little bit of your time to hear a positive review about your amazing app and just know if I could I would give it 100 stars 
                                       -Lilly
title: The best!

review: Hello! I‚Äôm a 13 year old with diagnosed adhd and anxiety. It‚Äôs something I‚Äôve struggled with a lot recently. Headspace came into my life when my dad got a year free with his new job. It helped me immensely with falling asleep. I was close minded about meditation at first but once I opened up to the idea of it, I loved it. Eves voice always soothes me and put me to sleep. Then I started using it in the mornings and watching the wake up, and it helped me relax throughout the day! Now I'm looking to deepen my practice. My favorite thing to do is wake up from a nice nights sleep to then meditate for about 45 minutes and then do yoga. Thanks headspace!!!!
title: ADHD and GAD (generalized anxiety disorder)

review: I‚Äôve been a member for about two years or so now and I love the app. My only ask is that you fix the issue I‚Äôve had with not using the app for awhile and not being able to access my membership when I return to it (I pay yearly) BUT they have always been able to get it fixed for me very quickly! I‚Äôm not a review writer but I wanted to be fair to them and give them a review because this app has done so much for me personally. I‚Äôll be sharing my 30days free friend passes today at work with my employees if they want to try meditation out. Again I highly suggest this app. Thank you Headspace
title: Great app

review: I have ADHD, so my brain is all over the place all the time, and I thought it would never be possible for me to develop a meditation practice, even though I wanted to. My doctor recommended this app to me, and it has truly changed my life. They let you know that it‚Äôs okay to have extraneous thoughts, and teach you how to quiet them over time. Beyond that, they have meditations to help you through all kinds of life struggles- anxiety, illness, job loss, heartbreak, etc. The paid version of the app is worth every penny. Cannot recommend this app highly enough!
title: If you think you can‚Äôt meditate, get this app.

review:
Headspace is great. I love it and use it a lot to wind down for sleep. I use the nighttime programs, especially the nighttime sos programs. 

There is one problem though. Unlike day programs, you can choose how long they run, so they don‚Äôt stop and I wake up with them still counting meditation minutes and I have to press finish. Half of my battery life on my phone is gone also.  I wish they would fix this because the purpose of these programs is to put you to sleep, which they do, but to fix this I‚Äôd have to wake up again to shut the countdown down. Really poor planning for use of the nighttime programs!
title: Nighttime programs will run down your battery

review: If you struggle with grief, whether it‚Äôs for yourself, a loved one, or just the state of the world at present, I highly recommend meditation. I know I need to meditate to make give my mind a break from the constant burden of grief, but just sitting still for 10-30 minutes doesn‚Äôt work for my ADHD brain. Having guided meditations takes the some of the pressure off, and I find Andy‚Äôs voice really soothing. Recently I‚Äôve been going on guided runs and I find that it‚Äôs changed my mentality while running, which I also use as a coping mechanism for grief. If you‚Äôre like me, struggling with sadness and anxiety, wanting a break but not knowing how, this is a really great tool.
title: Good for grief

review: I used to LOVE this app, it was perfect for a beginner and really helped me to start my meditation journey. However, i have noticed we have to have a membership just to access the basics??? NEVER has it been like this and the membership is extremely expensive. I would think if you wanted people to try the app and get a feel for meditation, you would at least leave the basics free as it always has been. It is so sad that during a time where people need meditation most and are struggling financially, headspace now charges you. That is a shame. I can vouch that it used to be basics free and other things you would have to pay to unlock, but now everything you have to pay for. So sad that this app is just like everything else in this world trying to get money out of us. Will never recommend this app again.
title: Disappointed
developerResponse: {'id': 27130446, 'body': 'We truly do appreciate you and we apologize for any negative experience. We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. During the trial, you will have access to all of our content, so you can explore and discover what works for you. Once the trial ends, you can opt to continue your meditation and mindfulness journey with a Headspace subscription or you can cancel. Check out our FAQ for more info and/or alternatives :) https://help.headspace.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008192928-What-s-included-for-free-', 'modified': '2021-12-29T19:13:43Z'}

review: You know how you get on a kick with a healthy diet, exercise and sleep routine. Every day, giving it your all and feeling better each day.  Then one day you wake up and just stop. No more early mornings, no more healthy shopping, no more feeling good just because you feel good. That‚Äôs where I was with my mental health and meditation when I started using this app. I used to be in a great place with my meditation practice, but years ago I just quit for no apparent reason. Headspace has helped me get back into that groove of mindfulness and meditation and I‚Äôm sincerely grateful. Thank you for helping us find our way back. Much love!
title: Just what I needed to get back to my best life

review:
As someone who has struggled with anxiety most of my life, Headspace came along at a time when I needed it the most. Coupled with a trusted counselor, Andy and team have taught me how to ‚Äúnot borrow trouble‚Äù and be grounded at the world you see in front of you - always holding onto the blue sky analogy they frequently come back to. It serves as a reminder that the highs and lows are transient and do not define who we are or our worth.

Teaches me to be grounded in the moment and there is an extensive library of topics and even SOS media that ions that can be used to slow things down a bit when it seems unmanageable.

Highest recommendation of any app I have ever used!
title: This App Literally Saved My Life

review: Let me start off by saying overall this app is decent for guided meditation, which is kind of the point and I get that. That being said it‚Äôs really disappointing that at this price point I‚Äôm unable to share my subscription with my wife. It‚Äôs just another reminder that they are far less interested in actually helping people than they are in maximizing profit, which is sadly the standard for the industry. Slick cute marketing designed to make you think you matter as a person but in reality you only matters in terms of revenue.
title: Disappointed subscriptions don‚Äôt share across family
developerResponse: {'id': 20382414, 'body': 'Sorry about any confusion with our Family Plan. If you looking to upgrade to a Family Plan, we recommend starting here: https://help.headspace.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011895334', 'modified': '2021-01-13T18:28:17Z'}

review:
one word; Surprising. out of all the meditation apps i have downloaded this so far has ben the very best! Absolutely love it.... and it‚Äôs netflix show ‚ùóÔ∏è It helps me fall asleep easier at night and gives me a better sleep üí§This app makes me in a mood like refreshed and ready to have a good day of kindness. Just that feeling after meditating is so peaceful and relaxing. Another thing is it‚Äôs so so helpful when you at first don‚Äôt really know how they say ‚ÄúBeing distracted is normal so don‚Äôt worry‚Äù I am myself a app reviewer and i review apps. One thing though there is so many things that cost money in this app but there is a handful off things that don‚Äôt so i will deduct a star for in app purchases. This was my app critic review
 
Jocelyn
title: One word

review:
I am a cancer survivor and the years following cancer treatment were really hard for me. A saw a therapist and she recommended Headspace. It took me about a year to really get the hang of meditation and now I can work it into many of my daily activities.

This app has gotten better and better through the years. There is so much on it yet it is easy to navigate and use. I recommend the app to anybody currently going through poor health or other life struggles. And when you have the app they give you buddy passes from time to time for friends to try. 

Give it a try. It is worth the money.
title: Worth it

review: I have struggled to focus on mental health for a good while I been meditating off and on for maybe 2 years or so? And I finally am getting myself on a rhythm to keep up daily meditation so I can remember to keep my feet planted and take time for myself. I also got really involved with it‚Äôs sleep help to from wind downs to helping falling back asleep or getting yourself to sleep as someone who has troubles getting into the wind down process I find myself most commonly not sleeping very well regularly this app helps a lot with it. It‚Äôs been an absolute great experience and thankful for its resources to help me in my day to day life
title: Great app

review:
I don‚Äôt leave reviews unless I am 100% HAPPY with the app/product. This app has changed my life. It provides a fantastic way to calm your mind and to focus. I also never buy an app until, again, I am SURE of it. Family recommended HeadSpace to me and I was instantly hooked. I had watched/followed along with the Headspace meditation videos on Netflix and was in love with the way it helped me clear my mind. 
If you‚Äôre even considering this, or looking for a way to clear and expand your mind and relationship with yourself, download and consider buying the full experience on headspace. Such an amazing app!
title: Incredible.

review: Overall this is an amazing app. I give it 4 stars only because I am a person that heavily struggles with falling asleep and not being able to create a playlist or at least add on a certain amount of hours of just background music/noise after the story ends just adds to the struggle. Having to get back up while almost being sleep to exit out and turn something else on just wakes me up again. So I would suggest doing something like that to improve the app for people who struggle like me. Again this app is awesome and totally worth the money. I‚Äôd never get rid of it but making that one improvement would be so helpful!
title: Suggestion

review: I started out with the Headspace episodes on Netflix and it inspired me to download the app, and it‚Äôs worth every penny! I realized I struggled a lot with insecurities and anxiety but after a few weeks of meditating daily I realized that there were deeper feelings causing those issues. It really helped me discover, cope with, and emotionally evolve to deepen my self love and my relationships with others. I am a more balanced, happier person and a lot of my frequent mood swings and frustrations have lessened dramatically, I am able to let things so easily and be at peace. I most certainly will be a life long meditator thanks to this app!
title: This app is life changing!

review: This app will not only help you learn how to meditate, but also provides many easy ways to add meditation and mindfulness to your life. They offer many, many short course which we can all allow time for in our busy lives (as a single mother of two I feel qualified to make that statement), but also many nighttime programs to help you sleep, and many courses to deepen your meditation practice. I wish the free app had more to offer, but I dived in and bought the annual subscription and I am glad I did so as an investment in me. Like a gym membership - but better!
title: Many options for finding peace

review: I‚Äôve been using Headspace for almost 3 years now and it has helped me become a more balanced, more self-aware and less reactive person. The courses are great but each session of those is usual 10-ish minutes. For when you‚Äôre short one time there are guided meditations for three and five minute times too. I was able to use it for about a year for free during the pandemic since they were offering it for free to healthcare providers but have continued to pay for it the last two years. It‚Äôs worth the money and time to help yourself become a better version of you.
title: Worthwhile

review: You need headspace and especially its subscription. So worth it. I‚Äôve had a lot less ‚Äúlow‚Äù mental states with headspace. Ive had great sleep with headspace sleepcasts and stories that distract your mind with nice little stories that usually take 45 mins and are always so wholesome and calming. I also love the mini teaching videos they have that explain mental health ponderings. There are so many more great features that you should check out to see for yourself how fabulous headspace is. And again, Please please please also get headspace subscription to access all these things, trust me it is so worth it ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: I‚Äôd Recommend to anyone

review:
I recognize not everyone can pay for this and the free medications are very limited, but this app may be my favorite on my phone. Very grounding, I notice differences in my day to day life from improved focus to overall sense of calm. I'm 18 and I've been trying to meditate every day, although it doesn't always happen I recommend this app for all ages. 

So many different courses and practices I have yet to explore. Even though they have around 3 different guides for each meditation, I have to say Andy has the most calming voice I have ever heard. Definitely worth the annual subscription.
title: necessary for everyone

review: Doing mediation everyday has really helped me so much.. I‚Äôm no longer restricted with my negative thoughts and anxiety, but I am now able to free myself from those thoughts and be more at a calm set of mind because of this app. It has helped me realize so many things in my life, that I either had to change or get rid of to make it better and I‚Äôm honestly so happy now and at peace. I‚Äôm only in session 9 of the basics still, but that just shows how much it has helped, there‚Äôs not a feeling out there more peaceful then after meditating, having that clear, calm, and soft state of mind.
title: Healing of meditation

review: So I downloaded the app, took a couple of breaths.  Gave them my email...then asked towing up for a membership.  Skipped past.  It made me take more deep breaths.  At this point I realized this is a breathing app.  I‚Äôm pretty sure I already know how to do that, since I‚Äôve been alive for 40 years now.  Next step, mystery plant identification.  Now this sounded fun.  Spent 5 minutes watching someone tell me, in order to identify a plant, look for a sticker or tag on it that says what it is. You can also type in google what features that plant has and maybe google can tell you.  üòÇüòÇüòÇ.  It was at this point I realized that this app is for morons.  Oh in case you don‚Äôt want to pay for this, I can give you some tips.  To prevent chocking while eating.  First try chewing the food with your teeth.  Second, take smaller bites of food at a time.  Lastly, drink water to help wash it down.
title: Deleted after mystery plant

review:
I have been on a search for the best meditation app. I started with headspace for a year. But then I tried Balance for a year. And then Calm. I found that I prefer a longer guided meditation with occasional reminders guiding me back when I may lose focus. Calm is focused on very short meditation with lots of content, it‚Äôs good, but not for me. 

Headspace and Balance are close, but I prefer Headspace. I enjoy the different courses and I found I missed Andy‚Äôs voice guiding me through the meditations after I switched. Coming back to Headspace made me feel instantly more comfortable and I am so glad to be back on it.
title: Top of the line

review:
This app is simply amazing. I‚Äôve been meditating for a few years and this app is the best tool I‚Äôve used. I got a free account through my work, but if that account ever ends I will defiantly continue using it.

In my personal life my girlfriend and I suffer from anxiety and depression. The guided meditations provided through this app has been incredibly helpful for managing that anxiety.

I work in a fast pace environment that can become overstimulating pretty quickly. Often times after a big rush me and my employees will sit in the office for a few minutes to meditate and collect ourselves.
title: The best meditation app I‚Äôve ever used

review: This app exceeded my already high expectations. I tried out premium and I would definitely recommend. The options are limitless and there is a a topic that fits every situation you may be in. There are short and long options for whether or not you are under a time crunch. There are also just calming nature videos for when u don‚Äôt necessarily want to meditate, but you need some calm and focus. There are workout and yoga for when you want more body awareness. There is still more that I am still yet to discover! It has helpers and is helping through times of stress and anxiety.
title: 100% Worth It

review:
I‚Äôm 10 and I suffer with with emetaphobia (fear of vomiting )  my parent found out about this app so they started using it to try it out and they absolutely loved it my dad says the first 2 min he listens to the rain radio he falls asleep immediately so then my parents suggested that I should try it and before I used it I would wake up exhausted because I could not fall asleep but now I fall asleep write away and I feel so much better  especially in the morning. I think it‚Äôs really worth it

Ps:one of the best sleep casts in my opinion is rainday  antiques or rain radio (that‚Äôs the longer version).
title: It‚Äôs amazing

review:
I sleep so much better listening to the wide array of sleep casts available. I love how there is a different soundscape for every one, holiday chalet is is a cozy crackling fire, and sleigh bells, and you can dial between the ambient sound and the voice. I love the mini meditations before going into the guide describing whatever the title subject matter entails. 
Rain day antiques is another fav of mine:)
Then you have the wide array of meditations to choose from. And they‚Äôre always expanding the content. And really leveling you up in a gentle way to progress further for sustainable growth. I‚Äôm so happy I found this app.
title: Love the meditation and sleep casts

review: Why in the world does a meditation app with a *paid* option have to collect any data about me at all. It‚Äôs just a disgraceful attempt to further monetize their users. I‚Äôm all for making money, but give me the option to pay and then *DON‚ÄôT* collect my data. Developers: don‚Äôt bother pretending that you are keeping our data safe. Your policies give you plenty of wiggle room to change your mind and if your company gets sold out goes bankrupt then anyone can buy my personal, sensitive data about my well-being. What if my health insurance company eventually gets it? My employer? Not worth it, deleted and cancelled subscription. There are other meditation apps that actually care about their customers‚Äô well-being, by not making them worry about their personal data being hijacked.
title: Disgraceful data collection

Headspace may share the information you provide to us with third parties to perform certain product functions - for instance, web payments (if you have a paid subscription) or authentication of your account.\r Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.\n\n", 'modified': '2022-05-21T19:46:51Z'}

review: I have found using this app consistently has greatly improved my anxiety, patients, and over all self awareness. Just taking the time each day just for myself and allowing my mind to rest has been life changing and a blessing. I also use the sleep aids this app provides and my quality has improved. I have a hard time with my mind racing when I laid down and it took forever to fall asleep then I would wake up through out the night unable to go back to sleep, but not since using the techniques and tools provided. Thank you Headspace ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Life Changing ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: I used to use this frequently when I had panic attacks or my racing thoughts kept me from sleeping. But since they made every aspect require a paid subscription, I‚Äôve lost my main source of relief or break from these feelings. It‚Äôs really disappointing. I understand the need for profit but having just 1 of each isn‚Äôt taking away the benefit for the customers who want variety that were already going to pay. Instead it hinders the users who can‚Äôt afford it and still have to find some alternative to relieve stress. As well as the company, they are losing so many downloads and recommendations from the unpaid accounts it simply cannot be good for business.
title: Paying to stop a panic attack.
