review: I love Headspace. It was so generous to receive a complimentary year-long membership at the beginning of the pandemic as a result of my unemployment. I love all of the meditations. My only feedback is I would love more meditations for falling asleep - I use those a lot. And most importantly, I‚Äôve fallen in love with Jordi and her gorgeous visualizations. Her voice is soothing and embracing, and her nature-inspired imagery helps me feel grounded, energized, soothed, and balanced. I‚Äôve listened to all four currently available a bunch of times and would love if Headspace brought her back for more. Thanks!
title: Love Headspace! More Jordi Please!

review: I use Headspace all the time and I love both the app and the interface; however in order to improve the user experience I think it would be in the best interest of users if the app could add capability for Airplay so that workouts could be streamed on Apple TV or music could be streamed on HomePod. Additionally adding a dedicated Headspace app for Apple TV would be amazing for the times when I‚Äôm looking for mindfulness without the distractions. Lastly if there were a way to view an archive of the daily wake ups, that would improve the user experience even more. Thanks for the great app headspace!
title: improving user experience

review: Just got home from 5 days of great live saving Hospital care, where my pain went to near Zero, then coming home and relaxing, in a beautiful, loving environment, Headspace helped me find the now, focus and good quiet breathing, enjoying the smells and slight sounds of my beautiful home  rooms, and now I am less stressed, happier, and am achieving overall well being! Looking forward to enjoying more of HeadSpaces mediation videos. Rainbow one pretty, and self reflection ones divine! Thank you!!!! NYC Recovering and Earth, Health, Peace and Nature lover.
title: All Professional, Kind, Restorative! This HeadSpace App works!!!

review: I was introduced to this app while in a recovery program for substance abuse and depression. I have used it almost every single day since that program in the last 2-3 years. One of the daily meditations from Andy talks about how meditation is something that really can‚Äôt be described, but has to be experienced. This app will help guide you to your own experience with meditation. On top of that, it has helpful sleep casts and yoga routines. It might seem odd, but I am truly very grateful for this little app and what it has helped me experience.
title: Life Changing

review: I love almost everything about HeadSpace! Customer service is very responsive online. Very reasonable price for all that you get. We used to pay more for an annual subscription to magazines. They provide a welcoming, inclusive environment without forcing any agenda. The graphics are super cute and cheerful. It makes learning to meditate easy for anybody. My ONE major issue‚Ä¶the sleep casts are so incredible at putting you to sleep but they are not downloadable. Try as you might you can not stay awake long enough to power down your phone or put it into airplane mode. This exposes you to extra radiation all night long. It‚Äôs easy to make disappearing downloads for sleep casts and protect us!! Figure it out and this becomes a 5 star review.
title: Must read review for a must have app!!!
developerResponse: {'id': 33880315, 'body': "Thank you so much for your feedback regarding the option to download the Sleepcasts!  Feedback from our community is very important to us, so we'll make sure your suggestion is passed on and heard by the right ears.", 'modified': '2022-12-22T14:24:57Z'}

review: Headspace has helped me more than words can say. As someone who has depression, anxiety, bipolar II, and some OCD, it has been absolutely the biggest help in calming me down, and helping me to appreciate the moment I‚Äôm in- right now, for what it is. I was almost always (essentially) dissociating to get away from my feelings, but Headspace‚Äôs mindfulness meditation has helped me to sit with them, accept them for what they are, and therefore be able to deal with them in a more healthy (and efficient!) way. Thank you, Headspace. What a wonderful help you are!!!!
title: SO helpful

review:
Headspace is my fav app for picking up motivation and i also like the exercise videos. But my absolute fav part of the Headspace is the Sleepcasts. I sometimes i struggle with insomnia so they help me sleep.
I would love however, if a fast forward button or something was implemented because I like to browse the sleepcasts and wish I could just skip the breathing exercises and get to the stories. Also, because there is no way for me to rewind the story alittle, there is only an option to completely restart the entire thing:(
title: Absolutely love except this!

review: Amazing tools to teach mindfulness, meditation and tools to help throughout the day, like the focus music are awesome! Then when you want to go to sleep at night there are tools for that as well! Get into a bad place and need quick help to calm down, there‚Äôs tools for that as well! Headspace has really benefited me in great ways and continues to in ways I didn‚Äôt know it could or that I needed.  It is also awesome that you can share it with your family and it is so adorable! Some the best money I spend all year! Glad to have Headspace.
title: Love being able to share this with the ones I love!

review:
I have been using headspace for over two years. I love headspace more than other mindfulness apps because of the compelling mini courses, constant innovation (new features such as The Wakeup), and helpful animations. I am also a huge fan of Andy‚Äôs work and background as a monk - I have read his book on meditation (also highly recommend as a booster to using this app).

The app is very user-friendly, and even fun! Meditation through Headspace has changed my life as a young professional to stay mindful of my emotions during work and progressing in my career to clarify moments of stress.
title: Small habits add up

review:
I don‚Äôt know how I lived without this app. As a type-A, never slow down, type: having a reminder each day to slow down and check in with my body is great. Perhaps even more useful is the ‚Äúemergency‚Äù meditation options. When I‚Äôm angry, or sad, or frustrated, there are quick options for bringing myself back to calm so I can handle the issues at hand. 
The sleep casts are beautifully done. I have no idea what happens at the end of any of them! Even works if it‚Äôs the sudden wake-up-at-2am-in-a-panic.
title: Just take my money

review: I have struggled with insomnia for as long as I can remember as well as panic attack disorder that is mostly prevalent at night. This app has helped me so much with the range of meditations, soundscapes and so much more. I am now falling asleep faster than ever, sleeping through out the night. It truly has helped me to quiet the chatter going on in my daily life to allow me to sleep more soundly. I have recommended this to so many friends and family‚Äîwill continue to do so!  Thank you Headspace for helping me clear my headspace so I can sleep and practice mindfulness with meditations! ‚ô•Ô∏è
title: 12/10 recommend

review: Aside from the fact that this app is exteremely "zen" and helps me with meditation, relaxation, and most importantly SLEEP! I am somneone that suffers from 2 hours of sleep a night but after utilizing the app i've seen tremendous changes. In addition a coworker bought be a subscription and I had an issue setting it up (logged in with multiple accounts). With that being said customer support helped me resolve the issue immediately. Phenemonal customer service. Keep up the great work!
title: Great app and even better service

review: Overall I love this app. I've had it for several years! Meditation occasionally gets put on the back burner for me. Fortunately, there are sessions on here that even help me ease back into my practice. I only wish the search bar yielded better results. For example,  I‚Äôll know they have a session for ‚Äúanxiety and‚Ä¶‚Äù - Yet I'll search for it with no results. I also would love it if you could filter the search results. Oftentimes I just want a meditation and will see a title that grabs me, only to be disappointed when it is a workout or something else.
title: Better Search Option

review: I think Headspace sleep casts are amazing and they have helped me sleep but two huge limitations that sleep cast users need to be aware of- AirPlay does not work which is bad when I need an external speaker to overpower some of the ambient noises of the neighborhood that a tiny iPhone speaker with poor sound quality can‚Äôt (sleeping with headphones is uncomfortable).  Inability to download sleep casts for times out of reception like traveling bc or flying.  I really like some of the sleep casts but will switch to another app that has these two critical functions when my subscription expires.  Like right now it‚Äôs 1am and I‚Äôm anxious and not sleeping bc I am trying to find something that can play on my external speaker and drown out noises.
title: If you use this for sleep casts: major problems
developerResponse: {'id': 36011062, 'body': "Thank you for sharing your comments about the sleepcasts; we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.\r\n", 'modified': '2023-04-17T18:29:21Z'}

review: The meditations are great.  It‚Äôs the way the app mis-tracks what day it is or how many days in a row I‚Äôve been using it, and sometimes won‚Äôt give me a meditation in the course I‚Äôm enrolled in.  Instead it tries to stick me with some other unrelated video that I don‚Äôt want. This is extremely frustrating when you‚Äôre trying to relax. Again, the meditations are great, please just make the rest of the app simpler to use, less buggy and maybe provide a feedback interface within the app as well for when things don‚Äôt seem to be working well.  Thank you.
title: Frustrating

review: What makes headspace so different are the daily meditations that it sets up for you. Other meditation apps are great, but this one provides you with short clips of videos between the breath work and meditation sessions. Some of the videos are about nature, others are about finding your purpose, but they're all such a nice way to bring you back into life and out of your head. Like any meditation...loving the app took some practice. But I have to say I use this app everyday to unwind in the morning.
title: A daily reminder to breath and love life

review: I really like this app because it allows me to focus on my process of everyday life. I tend to do too much research on meditation and then I noticed that I never do anything because of the time wasted looking for the best experience. Headspace has everything organized in a way it‚Äôs simple and easy to follow. I love the animations (they make me smile) as well as the ‚Äúwake up‚Äù. I also I like that the app has the exercise courses as ‚Äúday 1-28‚Äù that keep me moving. It would be cool if Headspace could also add yoga videos/courses as well :) but in any case it‚Äôs a great lifestyle companion app!
title: Great lifestyle companion app!

review:
This app helped me to easily build a meditation routine. There are live group meditations, lots of topics, even short meditations that tell you
What ages are appropriate. Thank you Andy and headspace. You are doing a great service to the world. Happy to pay for my membership.

-one month update... after meditating for several years here and there nothing has been able to make me stick to meditating like
This app. There are specific courses for what you need personally. It‚Äôs helped me quit smoking, get better sleep, and I like it so much that I do it 2-3 times per day. Always in the morning after I get up and walk my dog.
And most evenings too. There are even quick ones I can do at work on short breaks to re-center. Blown away by the app and I literally feel calm now in nearly any situation after a few deep breathes. Can‚Äôt say enough about this app!
title: Meditated for years and this is still so helpful

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for 2+ years now and can honestly say that meditation has altered my brain chemistry. As someone who struggles with consistency, I was really motivated by the counter that told me how many days in a row I had meditated. When I started this practice, I was recovering from a surgery and feeling scared to be in my body. Nowadays meditation helps me breathe into my body and find a natural sense of peace and calm. I‚Äôve enjoyed this journey so much I convinced my two best friends to start using Headspace and we all consistently meditate now!
title: So good for my mental health

review: Headspace is one of the greatest things it‚Äôs ever happened for me to me as me, it is truly changing my life. Trees I couldn‚Äôt climb, Roads I couldn‚Äôt  cross, Cakes I couldn‚Äôt bake. I‚Äôll be active with Headspace for quite some time to come. Even though I‚Äôve got just about 7000 minutes meditated I appreciate the direction the instructions. Alfred and headspace forever LOL but it‚Äôs no joke. Thank you Andy and all of the other headspace instructors peace and blessings. I hope to meet all of my instructors in person one day so I can embrace them and thank them for helping me focus.
title: Wow!!¬°!

review: Best app for mediation. This app is about the practice. It sets up each meditation for you to easily practice the meditation. I like that they don‚Äôt say too much, allow just the right amount of time between prompts for you to do the practice, and have lots of options for different kinds of meditations. The ‚ÄúPain Management ‚Äú app has helped me more than anything else for my chronic pain. Thank you Headspace! I just wish there was an option to purchase a lifetime subscription (please?)
title: Best meditation app- especially for pain management

review: This is an amazing app for people with anxiety, depression, etc. I love the variety and relaxing it is. I like how you can change the amount off background noise there is in some things. The only thing I‚Äôve noticed is, that there is no way to change where you are time wise in the thing your listening to. The only problem with this is, if I fall asleep before the end of a sleep story or meditation, I cannot start back where I remember last being. Otherwise this is an amazing app!!
title: I love this app!

review: Let me start by saying the app itself is great, support is almost useless. One month after buying the one year subscription, my 15 year old daughter asked if she could start using headspace. I‚Äôve emailed twice, which both took a week to get a response. The third email never even got a response. And their only advise for upgrading to the family plan is to cancel my membership and wait for it to expire and then signing up for the family plan. Waiting 11 months before my girl can use it is a bit ridiculous.
title: Good luck with support
developerResponse: {'id': 21781269, 'body': 'Apologies for any trouble! For assistance managing your iTunes subscription, we ask that you reach out directly to Apple. To learn more about upgrading, you can check out this article: https://help.headspace.com/hc/en-us/articles/360011895334.', 'modified': '2021-03-21T19:18:38Z'}

review: I've been trying for a few days and keep feeling the app features gets in the way of what is want. Specially, I wish there were a way to just quickly get to the guided meditations and maybe be able to filter by my favorite narrators, length, etc. Also when I do things out side of meditations, I really wish the videos continued playing audio when the phone is turned off. It took me several minutes to realize this was an intentional limitation.
title: I like but a little clunky

review: I love the recent redesign; that was desperately needed to reduce how cluttered and difficult to navigate the app has become.  When I first started using Headspace years ago the simpler interface with a timeline was easy to use. The new design is closer to that, but still a little cluttered. The issues with the app crashing has been fixed by the developers in this update. Thanks to them for being responsive and replying to my comment about it in a previous review!
title: Constant crashing with the latest update
developerResponse: {'id': 30576400, 'body': "Thank for your review. We're really sorry for the trouble, our internal engineering team already working on the fix that should be uploaded in the nearest days! If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-06-27T10:59:12Z'}

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for years now, and I love it! There are many different meditation options, so I‚Äôm certain there‚Äôs a meditation pack to fit anyone. My personal favorite are the sleepcasts, I put one on every night. You can choose from many different voices on the meditations, which is really convenient. I also had to use their support due to my own error, and they were responsive and very helpful! Plus, it‚Äôs inexpensive. Can‚Äôt say enough about headspace, I‚Äôll be using it for years to come :)
title: Excellent app

review: Headspace was a Plattform I depended on for my anxiety and mental health issues. My therapist had recommended it and I had gotten a free trial where I depended on the meditation and breath work features daily. Headspace used to have free accommodations such as basics and other meditations, however now everything in the app must be payed for. I feel that for an app that preaches self help and the importance of mental health it should do better in not being a greedy corporation solely created for profiting it‚Äôs users. I‚Äôm not complaining about the prices or having to pay for the trial, however I‚Äôm disappointed in the corporation for putting money before the well-being of its users and the message they are trying to spread. I hope that they make the basics free for all.
title: Disappointed
developerResponse: {'id': 28263755, 'body': 'Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any frustration around this. We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. If you would like to discuss some pricing options that may work best for you, please send us a note at help@headspace.com.\r', 'modified': '2022-02-26T00:44:42Z'}

review:
This is a great app for if you are really just feeling like you have enouph time to listen to one recording and being in a comphy space. I really like it because you can choose the person who talks to you and you just get that ‚Äú im free‚Äù sensation....its great!

One thing that makes me mad is that it always asks me for the pro version and i am not allowed to pay money for apps so it is really anoying my parents when i am with them and it asks me if i want to pay...but overall great app and all my friends lobe it too
title: Great app...1 flaw

review:
You will see a time range for many meditations, they can go from 5 min to 20 min for example.  It‚Äôs basically the same words with 15 minutes added silence in between the words!  If I could do so many minutes in silence without my brain drifting, I would not need a guided meditation.  This is pathetic. It would be far better if they gave you the option to repeat the meditation for a number of times. Some of us can‚Äôt do it in 5 min, frankly I don‚Äôt know who does and how much they get out of it.

Also, it‚Äôs impossible to find what you want. I just want a 20 min full meditation to either sleep or relax. You should be able to simply search for what you want rather than having to scroll through lists.  In fact, I would like some 40 min meditations, or even hour. I‚Äôd also like to be able to stick with one voice, so that would be a selection.

Finally I just opened today a meditation that said it was session 3, but no link was available for the others.  

A meditation app would not add to the stress. Going back to my old classics, some of them more than an hour.
title: ‚ÄúLong‚Äù meditations are a scam
developerResponse: {'id': 25799131, 'body': "We'd be more than glad to follow up regarding your feedback. Please send us an email at help@headspace.com ", 'modified': '2021-10-20T20:02:23Z'}

review:
This app is truly wonderful for beginners and for more experienced meditators, too. There are many ways you can use the app‚Äîfor sleep, for meditation, for exercise, etc.‚Äîbut it still feels refreshingly and reassuringly simple if you only want to use it for one of those things. As a Buddhist, I feel that the meditations do a good job of embracing the very simple foundations of Buddhist meditation and mindfulness, yet without naming it as Buddhist or of any other tradition, and yet without contorting the practices into something they‚Äôre not. 

Good, all around.
title: Fantastic

review:
I love this app and everything they‚Äôve done for healthcare workers during the pandemic. It‚Äôs been a lifesaver to listen, breathe, and process everything that is happening!

My only wish is that you could put things in a ‚Äúqueue‚Äù because often times I‚Äôm drifting to sleep or not sleeping soundly yet when a sleep story ends and the abrupt stopping of sound wakes me again. It would be perfect if you could queue up some sleep music or a sound scape after a sleep story ends!

Overall, I highly recommend this app!
title: So amazing!

review: Have been using this app for more than 7 years. I regret not buying a lifetime membership when it was available!! The app isn‚Äôt always intuitive to navigate, but once you know how to get around, there‚Äôs so much to explore and benefit from. They‚Äôve kept adding new content, which I dip into occasionally, but I love their foundational stuff and keep going back to it. There‚Äôs something for everybody ‚Äî on every topic from grief to anxiety to happiness to focus and more. Download it! You won‚Äôt regret it :)
title: Reliable App

review:
My family and I use Headspace for sleepcasts. The problem is, what puts us to sleep are the nonsense story sleepcasts. But after 45 minutes, the sound cuts out, and we wake up. This is a problem for me and my kids. 

Headspace also provides 6-hr music. The problems here are 1) six hours isn‚Äôt a complete sleep cycle (same problem of waking up when the sound ends), and 2) this music isn‚Äôt as good at putting us to sleep as the sleepcasts. 

Headspace must know that sleepcasts are effective precisely because they are comprised of these nonsense stories that the brain can‚Äôt hold on to because the details aren‚Äôt a complete narrative. 

I‚Äôve sent in this feedback before, and based on comments I see online about people with sleep disturbance who really need a full-night soundtrack, I really would have hoped Headspace would have created at least a few sleepcasts that last 8 hours. It would take about 10 minutes for their techs to do!

That change would make me a lifetime user of this app.
title: No sleep casts that last through night ‚Äîdespite suggestion

review: Having been a long time meditator, I wasn‚Äôt sure initially if Headspace had something to offer me, but I have been pleasantly surprised.  The charm of the visuals, the constant gentle reminder of breathing, the soothing voices, the true value of daily programs are such that I now absolutely look forward every day to Headspace input.  And if I was a new-to-meditation person (but, really, who isn‚Äôt new to life experience every moment ), I highly recommend Headspace as a way to begin.  I think Headspace really contributes to a more peaceful life!
title: Very Helpful

review: I typically don‚Äôt subscribe to apps, but this is the ONE app I will always make an exception for. In a day and age where INVESTING is so prominent, we need to collectively remember to invest in our MINDS as well. A healthy, happy life starts in the mind and this app truly allows me to stay focused and motivated to do my meditations daily. It has done such a lovely job of keeping my grounded, present, stress-free and very successfully helps ease my anxiety before bed. This app is truly one of the BEST things I‚Äôve ever come across, I will never cancel this subscription!!
title: Best investment for your mind!

review: I‚Äôve had a lot change in my life from just January to July. My Mother passed away, finished working through a COVID school year, newly married, and now expecting our first child. With these ‚Äúvalleys and peaks‚Äù I‚Äôve been hopping from self help audio book to self help audio book trying to refocus my thoughts and mindset, to say the least. I‚Äôm very thankful for a meditation app like Headspace which pays special detail to the various mental states one may be in and uses audio to transition the mind to a place of peace and calmness or motivation and focus.
title: Thankful

review: I always SWORE by this app. Helped me through so many sleepless nights and anxious days. Now I can‚Äôt even log in.. and I‚Äôm still paying for it. A hefty amount, even, for something I can‚Äôt even get access to. Got a new phone with a newer version and went to login, went to the *existing* member login, and it still gives me the message that an email (..mine..) is already associated with my OWN account. And no - I am not in the ‚Äòcreate and account‚Äô prompt page. It‚Äôs in the existing user login. I‚Äôve deleted and re-downloaded the app three times. Gives me the same prompt and I still can‚Äôt login. Holding out hope but about to cancel my subscription for good. SO disappointed
title: was great until I couldn‚Äôt access anything I‚Äôve been paying for
developerResponse: {'id': 29097535, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the trouble. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.", 'modified': '2022-04-11T10:30:40Z'}

review: I‚Äôve been using headspace for maybe a little over a year- off and on, here and there. Whether I‚Äôm having a hard day at work, feeling anxiety wrapping around me, or unable to sleep headspace has helped me learn to take little moments of mindfulness. It has also helped me learn to notice mindful moments throughout my day where I wouldn‚Äôt have previously noticed them. I recommend the app to all my friends, whether they‚Äôve never meditated or have been doing it for a long time it‚Äôs an super approachable and helpful tool.
title: Approachable & Realistic way to learn meditation

review:
My company paid for a one year subscription (COVID). I really enjoy the mindful workouts included in this app. It makes working out more about health and well-being rather than aesthetics. In my opinion it‚Äôs better than having your workouts on You Tube with all your other distracting videos. I‚Äôve explored new lofi-beats in this app and very much enjoy them. I‚Äôm still enjoying exploring all the features and figuring out ways to include them in my everyday.

In the future, I can see myself paying for this app myself.
title: Great App for All Your Well-Being Needs

review:
I‚Äôve tried multiple attempts at meditating in the past and the feeling that I should immediately be better at it, or more intuitively sink into it, made me quit before I barely got started. Sure, that was all in my head, but isn‚Äôt that the point? 
Headspace lays out your concerns and reminds you they are normal all throughout their courses. The concepts, practices, and reasons behind them are laid out in clear and concise ways, without ever feeling talked down to. I‚Äôve extremely grateful to have this app.
title: An accessible way to start meditating without feeling bad at it

review: Great app. The content is excellent, the illustrations, visual design, and overall production is top quality. As a UX Research & Strategy professional I'd love to point product designers to Headspace as an example of great design, but it needs to address some important usability issues such as discoverability of courses and expert guidance clips. In general, the content needs a better organization strategy based on user research. The counter of hours meditated is too abstract to consider it meaningful for the user. A visual of the stats of individual progress overtime may be more valuable. I hope they bring more UX Research expertise to the core team!
title: I LOVE this app. Some usability/UX issues

review: I‚Äôm a college student in my first year and I have a history with mental health. This semester got so stressful I redownloaded this app after 2 years and I love it, it‚Äôs great for those that want to get back in tune with their mind and body especially for people who need to tap back into mental health skills. The student discount is amazing (whoever set the price, THANK YOU) and I think every college student should use Headspace. It seems like they actually care about the user experience and have really improved the app consistently!
title: Saving my sanity

review: There‚Äôs so much good stuff in here but it‚Äôs so hard to find, meditations start playing before you get the chance to select your settings, I‚Äôve saved the ones I know are good but it‚Äôs not obvious how to find them again.  Please, create a different home page system that leads you to what you need and omits all the irrelevant content that increases my frustration when I see it.  I‚Äôm just trying to find a simple breathing exercise while my partner‚Äôs having a panic attack, don‚Äôt make me scroll past Star Wars and Black Excellence meditations just to get to the basic essential stuff.
title: Great content, anxiety inducing interface

review:
The App seems like it would be really helpful, if I could really use it. You can literally do nothing unless you pay a lot of money. For some people it might be worth it, but I think they need lower prices and more things that are unlocked if you just have an account. They should create a meditation app with the only thing you need is an account. 
And yes, they probably need some of the money for the app and it‚Äôs improvement, but they should still offer some meditation for free. 
They might as well make you pay to download it, because all you get for free is a 2 minute how to use the app video. 
Great potential, too pricey.
title: The App seems really good but you need to pay
developerResponse: {'id': 36940050, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback. If you would like to discuss some pricing options that may work best for you, please send us a note at help@headspace.com. In the meantime, we offer free content outside of the app on social media channels like YouTube, Snapchat, and Instagram, plus our podcast Radio Headspace and our series on Netflix.', 'modified': '2023-06-05T18:18:58Z'}

review:
I have been a user since 2014 so I guess that‚Äôs good, however I find the app very frustrating to navigate.  I use the courses and whenever a 10 or 30 day course ends it is a surprisingly stressful process to find the next one.
Also, I use the app to listen to Andy guide me, it should be easier to find his courses. 
Overall it is OK, I have a lifetime membership that they no longer sell,   So I guess I‚Äôm here for a while.  I just don‚Äôt love it, wish it was much much simpler with less teachers and bells and whistles that I don‚Äôt use‚Ä¶

My fav part is the run streak counter‚Ä¶ keeps me coming back daily!
title: Difficult to navigate
developerResponse: {'id': 29176191, 'body': "Thank you for your review; we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-04-14T15:45:33Z'}

review: Many years ago, I was tasked by my therapist to use mindfulness to ease my anxiety. I believe I originally used the app called Mindful? Since then, I had stopped taking the time to check in with myself and be calm. Finding Headspace has given me the opportunity to check in with my mind and body and allowed me to seek that calm again. With a simple and bright design, the app is also easy to navigate and very fun to use. Thank you to everyone involved in the creation of Headspace for the ease of mind I can find once more.
title: Mindfulness

review: I‚Äôve used headspace on and off since spring of 2020. At the time, Headspace was a type of company I needed and helped me develop a relationship with the only person I saw for weeks at a time - myself. Even though the world is going back to normal, the peace of mind I earned with Headspace in 2020 created rituals for my mornings, which in turn, created long lasting effects. I feel that now I have stronger interpersonal relationships, a healthier daily balance and mental place where I can find peace of mind when I need it.
title: Wonderful experience

review:
I love headspace. This program has helped me with sleep, anxiety, grief for lost loved ones and stress at work and in general.
I would have given a 5 rating in early November, but now am generously giving a 2 rating. I say generously because after taking my yearly renewal fee, I cannot log on unless I click onto a link for a free week which obligates you to join a new subscription or decline a new subscription but does nothing to get me onto my already paid subscription. I‚Äôve emailed and received a response saying they would get to me ASAP, but in the meanwhile, I‚Äôm losing weeks of access to a program I have paid for. This is not acceptable.
title: 2 instead of 5 because I can‚Äôt log on
developerResponse: {'id': 33617026, 'body': 'Hello, we are sorry for any trouble while trying to access your subscription. Can you please contact us at help@headspace.com and we will gladly help you in resolving the issue.', 'modified': '2022-12-08T20:28:17Z'}

review: I absolutely love this app! It has completely changed my life and the way I view it. I recommend this to anyone that‚Äôs curious about meditation. You don‚Äôt have to know anything to get started. This app will teach you and it goes in baby steps so you can completely understand how to do it. This is the best meditation app out there. I‚Äôve been using it for over 2 years and no matter what comes up in life, there is a meditation exercise for it here. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this app!
title: Life changing

review: This app has helped me be a better person during one of the most challenging times in my life. The coaches are incredibly relatable.  The variety keeps me coming back to meditation every day - capturing my interest in areas such as sleep (despite having two very young children), helping my children sleep, staying present with my children even when I‚Äôm tired in the afternoon and focusing at work. Best of all, Headspace has giving me a way to recharge when I have only a minute, or 6 or 10.
title: Relatable coaches

review: I was introduced by my membership with WW. I was having so much trouble with getting and staying asleep. Headspace has totally transformed that. The night stories are amazingly calming and I never get past the first five minutes without falling into a deep slumber. I am even now able to go right back to sleep if I should need to get up to use the bathroom during the night. I so much look forward to it until my body starts relaxing the minute I pick up my phone to listen. I am so happy. Thanks so much.
title: Amazing

review:
Before my spiritual awakening and discovering my God, I thought meditation was for eastern religions, Buddhism, Hinduism, but I was wrong. I am a Christian, although it‚Äôs not preached on I have had a lot of affirmation in the Bible for it. I believe that any belief system can change a life. But Jesus is alright with me.  Mindfulness meditation allows me to open up to prayers and how to let go of control and give up to win. be more aware of others feelings but overall just how to stop take a breath and take life one step at a time. 

Blessings
title: Everyone should meditate

review: This app, in all honesty, is quite beautiful. Eves voice is very soothing and actually did help me fall asleep. The only thing that is hindering me from giving it five stars is that most of the activities have to be bought. I think with stresses and worry we deal with in our day to day can take a very big toll on us and this help could really help with that but not everyone can pay for a subscription. If someone truly does need help sleeping, I think helping them should come at no cost. But that‚Äôs also just my opinion. Great app over all though
title: Helped but paid

review: Don‚Äôt let the cost of this deter you. (I have literally no affiliation with headspace professionally or incentive to market for them). If you pay for a gym membership or bought your self a set of select-tech weights for your home gym then you have paid significantly more money then what Headspace is asking for. This app is a tool that can help you strengthen your mind and find peace. $13/mo. Or $80/year is a killer deal. You are funding the ability for the people at headspace to continue making this tool better for YOU! Make your money worth something more!
title: Cost

review: I love using headspace to go to sleep because I have a hard time doing so, I like to use a wind down meditation and also brown noise, but as soon as I go on my phone to switch to brown noise all of the relaxing meditation to get me sleepy had just been undone. Maybe you could make a feature where you can make a playlist so that when the meditation is finished it immediately switches the brown noise and you don‚Äôt have to open your eyes or look at your phone.
title: Love this app but just one suggestion!

review:
This is a very profound experience even for a beginner.  Each time I tried to meditate in the past, it always felt like a confusing struggle.

This time, right away it feels like there is a deep, meaningful goal in each session.  Even as a beginner that helps me feel engaged and makes it easier to imagine and define for myself what I‚Äôm hoping to do through this practice.

And that‚Äôs amazing to have that to hold onto even when I am new and haven‚Äôt developed the skills and mental muscles yet.
title: Glad I found headspace

review: I am enjoying headspace so far, I‚Äôm just beginning to explore a lot of the content.  My one gripe is that I wish there was more Shine content.  There is really a small amount available compared to what they had on the Shine app and I LOVED the Shine app.  I miss the people who did the meditations (Jamila was my favorite) and there was SO much great content that there‚Äôs just not access to anymore.  I‚Äôm hoping since their relationship is still relatively new that they will bring back some more of the archives from Shine because I have so many favorites I had bookmarked and I miss!
title: Joined for Shine

review: I like headspace, but it was much better in the beginning. Then all the meditations were by Andy P. In the past couple of years he stopped recording new meditations and instead he was replaced by many different people with voices that aren‚Äôt nearly as enjoyable to listen to. And they also added a lot of black centric content which has nothing to do with traditional mindfulness and is not applicable to most people using the app. I like my meditation app to focus on meditation, not racial differences and politics.
title: Good app but went woke
developerResponse: {'id': 29176234, 'body': "Thank you for your review; we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-04-14T15:48:35Z'}

review:
I‚Äôve subscribed to Headspace for several years. I‚Äôm ‚Äúnot good‚Äù about meditating; I‚Äôll go months without it even though I know it‚Äôs helpful when I do meditate.  Even so, the messages and mindfulness are enduring. 

One of the features I really appreciate are the encouraging notes that come through every day. They‚Äôre so low pressure; there‚Äôs nothing about the notes that make me feel guilty - rather, they‚Äôre just an additional benefit. I do find value in the messages. 

Another helpful feature are the sleep sounds. The 8 hour ones are especially helpful to me overnight. I‚Äôd love it if they‚Äôd develop more 8 hour ones.

Today, I had a date to meditate with my friend. This year we‚Äôre an ocean away from each other. We both feel the loss and we‚Äôre both having some trying times. Our shared meditation was a really positive expression of our connection. 

I absolutely recommend Headspace.
title: Encouraging

review:
For the first couple weeks I used this app, I could tap the gear icon while playing a session and choose between times. But now, when I tap on one of the time options, nothing happens. Sometimes I get haptic feedback (like it knows I tapped it) but it does not choose a new time setting. 

I wish there were more fall asleep sessions with different words. 

I like this app for the most part and would say it‚Äôs worth the $42 I paid for the year, but the timer issue is making it less usable.
title: Overall good, but a bit repetitive and buggy

review: Meditation is an ancient practice that has served humanity regardless of time passed or fluxes in society. It‚Äôs no wonder, then, that by updating the method for transmitting the lessons, more and more people are able to benefit. In a world where we can desperately use more kindness, it behooves us to begin finding kindness for ourselves. This is where Headspace begins. I have no doubt that Andy and the entire Headspace team have already changed the world through the individuals this app has impacted. Thank you Andy. Thank you Headspace.
title: A New Old Way To Come Back To Myself

review:
Update
I was away for a while using another service but I missed Headspace and I‚Äôve come back. I appreciate all the things they offer. Very well done. 

I love Headspace. The daily practice of meditation has made me more calm and better able to deal with whatever comes along. There is so much good content and something new every day. It is presented in a Iight hearted way that really works for me. I highly recommend the service and the app. It is making a big difference in my life.
title: Very helpful to me

review: One of the meditations included information on racism - I could see if someone was scared then maybe normalizing the situation into a guided mediation of acceptance could help. However, something like a topic of such sort isn‚Äôt what I want in my guided meditations. I just want practical meditations and information about meditation and psychology that helps me‚Ä¶ I love everyone on the team and they‚Äôre doing great, but please Headspace: can you not put this in recommended daily meditations, but instead offer the meditations in a section of topics please. Thank you and True Love to all!
title: Narratives vs psychology

review:
I‚Äôve had a lot of problems over the years with substance abuse, anger issues, mental disorders and anxiety.  Since starting with headspace over 2 years ago I have learned many skills in meditation that have help me balance my life.  Being able to see thoughts instead of living in them has given me peace at times of high anxiety.  Being able to recall these skills in the real world has really calmed me down and helped with the way I choose to deal with life on life‚Äôs terms and I am grateful.

Chris McIntyre
title: Grateful

review:
For longtime users - this is, unfortunately, not the same app as before. I‚Äôve loved and had a subscription to Headspace for years but will be canceling at my next renewal date. I‚Äôve also previously recommended this app to many people. Headspace was bought out by a corporate overlord. 

This new owner has made the decision to no longer support play on either Nest or Alexa in favor of creating their own stand alone device to use it sometime in the future. This also explains why we were getting all sorts of horrible celebrity tie-ins for the last year. That John Legend sleepcast is a thing of nightmares‚Ä¶.
title: Not the same app as before
developerResponse: {'id': 31966800, 'body': "Thank you for your review! We're so sorry to hear that you're not satisfied with our updates, we'll be sure your feedback is heard. If you have any questions, please email our Support Team at help@headspace.com.", 'modified': '2022-09-12T11:12:11Z'}

review: Headspace is great and I absolutely love the wide range of exercises, meditations, animations, and short films. However, I think this app would be 10/10 if users had the opportunity to connect with others with a community tab or feature. A space on the app where we can provide and share our feedback or comments to things like The Wake Up or certain meditations. For me, headspace exists as a form of self care and contributes to my well being, but I would love to share and experience this journey with others.
title: Community tab or feature!

review: I have been using Headspace for about five years. It‚Äôs always helped (insomnia and episodes of intense anxiety a few years back) but over the past few months I‚Äôve seen an actual change in the way that I react to certain situations. I‚Äôm a lot more mindful, in a very practical and tangible way‚Ä¶for example, my other less healthy habits: it‚Äôs easier to work through what I want (examining how I feel instead of just eating my feelings, for example). The shift was subtle‚Ä¶ but profound.
title: Life changing

review: I‚Äôve been using head space for about a year. It was recommended by my stress management coach and it has been such an incredible tool. I have never been one to meditate for long periods of time but the guidance and various options on the app have helped on my journey to bring my best self. Last year (2020) was very heavy for us as a globe, and individually I was struggling. It‚Äôs like big ol‚Äô glass of cold pressed green juice with everything you need and the stuff you‚Äôve been wanting. ITS WORTH THE INVESTMENT. Thank you, Headspace!
title: A Gift to My Mind and Spirit

review: I love headspace so much it has helped me to fall asleep calm and clear my mind. If you are someone who needs help winding down or meditating or sleeping etc. you should definitely get this app. My favorite thing to listen to to help me fall asleep are the sleepcasts, they‚Äôre so peaceful and calming.. but however I don‚Äôt like that you have to pay for all of them except one, so so far without paying I can only listen to rainday antiques, and i like this one a lot but I would like to explore the sleepcasts more. ‡∏Ö^‚Ä¢Ôªå‚Ä¢^‡∏Ö
title: I LOVE this app but..

review: This app lets you take so many different approaches to meditation. There‚Äôs no right or wrong way to meditate. I never write reviews, I always look at that. But I wanted to take the time to write a review, because when I do use this app for meditation, it helps my brain feel so much calmer and clear. It‚Äôs relaxing and rejuvenating at the same time. If this is your first time trying meditation, try the free version. If you‚Äôre looking to progress your meditation magical super human powers, I recommend getting the premium version, I think it‚Äôs worth it.
title: Open minded

review: I use the free meditations as I can‚Äôt afford a subscription atm. I‚Äôve used the sleep meditation for months and it‚Äôs become a bit of a necessity. They‚Äôve now taken it off the free options. I just think it‚Äôs a bummer to become so heavily dependent on something as a tool for my insomnia to have it held hostage. I‚Äôve always loved this app and it‚Äôs helped me so much for my mental health but it seems so corporate and cold to cut someone off from something so important so their treatment. Especially when some (myself included) already pay an arm and a leg to treat their mental illnesses through the American healthcare system. I‚Äôd say use what‚Äôs free while you still can.
title: Bring back sleep meditation!

review: I‚Äôve subscribed to Headspace for 1 year, 3 months and love it. The sleep stories are the best and never fail to knock me out. My anxiety levels had lessened and I‚Äôm more patient. But. For a week now, I can‚Äôt access the subscriber features. I have done all the suggestions in the help section and have contacted the Help team. So far all I‚Äôve got back are form emails telling me to try the FAQ section and they‚Äôll get back to me as soon as they can. I‚Äôm really frustrated. A human contacting me would be awesome.
title: Great app, till it‚Äôs not

review: I feel like a lot of people never give themselves the time to be self aware and are therefore unaware of a lot of things going on inside themselves. Literally just 10 minutes a day has changed a lot for me and brought to my attention how anxious I really was. And I just learned a lot about topics like confidence and high self esteem that really helped to give me those qualities. I recommend this app or Calm, but personally I prefer this app. 10/10 would recommend.
title: I‚Äôm convinced everybody needs to meditate

review: I enjoy the meditations and think that they are valuable. I do wish some were a bit longer.  My biggest issue is that when I wake up in the morning I will see a personal mediation plan laid out for me. I plan for that and look forward to that. As the day goes on however, it seems to change. Very frustrating and unsettling at a time when I desperately need stability. Last night I didn‚Äôt have a night meditation on my personal tab. So I went to the night tab and it seemed to be more workshoppy stuff than meditation. I tried to sleep without the meditation in the end.
title: The good and the bad

review:
Main bug I see often is on home page of the app where it shows you timeline of suggested meditation for eachday. From those suggestions, when I tap on suggested daily meditation (so like 3rd in that list), the app tries to load the meditation and fails by showing there was some internet error. My device‚Äôs internet is fine. When I close that meditation page and tap on the same daily meditation snippet.. the second time it works. 

I‚Äôve been seeing this for a few months now.
title: Some bugs but otherwise it is a nice app
developerResponse: {'id': 30084437, 'body': "Thank you for reaching out. We are sorry for the trouble playing the sessions in the app. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further.\r", 'modified': '2022-05-31T19:53:46Z'}

review:
After the this app has really helped me to learn about meditation and myself. I enjoy using this app every day in the morning to start my day. Definitely give this one a try if you‚Äôre looking for a guided meditation. daily stressors of life have taken a toll, Headspace has allowed me to regain a sense of self. The app is easy to use and explains meditation in a user friendly way. The short cartoon sketches, show what we can expect from meditation and our minds. 
I would recommend this to anyone who wants to begin meditation.
title: Great way to learn about meditation.

review: I have had this app for a year if not longer and I have been listening to the same ‚Äúdoze‚Äù sleep music. So much so that I have over 500 hours of just this music logged on the app. However, when I opened the app a few weeks ago I noticed that the music had been locked along with quite literally every single other course from every category. The app has no use as the free version and is completely useless unless you have a subscription. I understand the app must have revenue to be able to continue to run, but it‚Äôs just very disappointing that none of the courses are free anymore. There‚Äôs no point in having the app unless you plan on paying for it.
title: Everything is locked
developerResponse: {'id': 27263661, 'body': 'We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. review: I was trying to get the membership but could t for some reason until K emailed them and, though they got back to me a few days later, they still fixed the problem and even gave me a discount. Meditation has also been transformative and very relaxing. I discovered this through Netflix and sure glad I did. The layout of the app and especially the website is a bit confusing but the meditation is great.
title: Had trouble with Membership but they fixed it

review: I love that I can start and end my day with Headspace. They make it really easy for someone who doesn‚Äôt have experience with meditating. They recommend various things throughout the day and after 6 months of using it consistently I‚Äôve noticed a major positive impact in my mood and my ability to focus. At first I found it difficult to fit into my day, but you can choose practices as short as three minutes. I will keep using this app!
title: Great app with lots of features

review:
*update* Although Sleepcasts are still good, I‚Äôve grown a bit frustrated by the inability to reset progress on a course or edit the items that I need to check off daily on the home screen. Would like to see an update!
‚Äî-
I use this app almost exclusively for the Sleepcasts. Thanks to them I can FINALLY sleep at night, and I truly have tried everything. These sleep stories are just done in a particular style that works and they change a little bit every time you listen (genius). Would like to see one done in an all-night cafe :). Keep producing these Sleepcasts - I love them!!!
title: Sleepcasts are brilliant

review:
I got this app today and the only good thing about this was the beginning when we did 3 deep breaths. For me i could not do anything else without buying the subscription. I think it would be a good app if you could actually use it with out buys stuff.

Other people have been saying "this app is life changing!" "best app ever!" "100% amazing!"  And yes i do think this app would be good if i could actually use it, so maybe add stuff that people can use and not have to pay. Like me I can't alway pay for stuff and i thought this app could help my stress and anxiety but all it did was make me calm for 1 minute then got me mad because i couldn't do anything else. That's it for now but please consider changing it.

				- nat****
title: Not a fan üò§

review: Headspace has been an invaluable resource for my mental health and well-being. It has guided me through loss, anger, stress and anxiety. In a wonderfully ever changing world Headspace helped me to adapt and let go of the thoughts that do not serve me. The teachers and the meditations have helped me to repot myself and to grow beautifully even in the darkest of moments. I embrace myself. I love who I am and I‚Äôm able to love the world better because of the gift of mental well-being that Headspace has journeyed with me. Thank you. With all my heart.
title: Healing Headspace

review: This app is great. I‚Äôve used my free trial and definitely benefited from all the exercises and meditations. I definitely see value in what they provide. However I‚Äôm unemployed and don‚Äôt have the means to pay for a sub. So it‚Äôs wildly disappointing that no free option is given for those who might not have access to a subscription. Even one daily meditation would be helpful. It would give access to those who need it while helping them build a daily habit, encourage them to invest in a subscription if and when they can, and really show that Headspace cares about providing mental health tools for ALL and not just those with the financial means.
title: Disappointed there‚Äôs no access to those who can‚Äôt afford a subscription
developerResponse: {'id': 37659623, 'body': 'We appreciate your feedback! We recently updated the Headspace app to allow all new members to unlock the entire Headspace library through our free trial. We still offer free content outside of the app on social media channels and still offer K-12 organizations free memberships in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada.', 'modified': '2023-07-13T14:53:28Z'}

review:
The design of this app is really something else. For an app that is constantly changing its content blocks, it maintains an easy to navigate structure which is really cool. The choices are also really calming. 

If there was something I‚Äôd update, it would be making the ‚Äòbasics‚Äô section in today tab easier to understand. I just hit play the first few times which kept repeating session 1, so it was kind of confusing. 

I‚Äôd also love to see updates to the web version so it has a similar IA. Right now the tabs at the bottom are different than the app which makes it hard to switch over to when i‚Äôm working (I like using the web version while at work). They‚Äôre also small so I didn‚Äôt even recognize that they were there for a week. 

Overall this is an awesome app, just needs some tweaks to make it more intuitive like all UX does as apps develop!
title: Great design choices here!

review: I recently changed phones and my subscription wouldn‚Äôt transfer. Emailed customer service and they literally didn‚Äôt do anything, telling me to log out and then log back in. Of course I had already done that with no success. I tried to cancel my subscription and then literally start a new one‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..the system kept telling me I already had an active subscription but the content was still locked. Like I said great content horrible app
title: Great content horrible app
developerResponse: {'id': 25798903, 'body': "We're truly sorry to hear about your issue and your experience with your subscription and assistance. Please send us one last email at help@headspace.com and we'd be more than glad to come to a solution. ", 'modified': '2021-10-20T19:33:37Z'}

review: So I love headspace I generally do the daily start your day meditations and I remember that you could look and see what the mantra (or saying whatever you call it)was for each pass meditation. my coworker and I were talking and we use Headspace through Starbucks we love it but we found it odd that you can‚Äôt look at past meditations and like that little saying on what it was about I really miss that feature if you brought it back I would honestly give this app five stars because it‚Äôs amazing.
title: What happened to viewing past mediation

review: You all need to make sure that you post up photos, videos as well as any other forms of media that you ever could in general that would actually be able to explain as specifically as possible about the reasons for why it is always so important to never ever set any sorts of limits to all that could ever be shown on an app like this when it comes to posting up any sorts of new features on it and so on and so forth. All of the forms of media mentioned way earlier in the beginning should always be translated into as many different worldwide foreign languages as possible.
title: Calm Meditation App Review

review: I have always made it a goal to meditate more and told myself to do it more regularly. It‚Äôs been something difficult to achieve! With headspace, it reminds me daily to meditate, gives me mindful moments and has many options to choose from for medication whether it‚Äôs a daily practice, before bed, or in the morning. It‚Äôs becoming more of a habit (still in process but much improved). I enjoy the meditations and feel the difference. 5 stars!
title: Makes regular meditation more attainable

review: I‚Äôve been using headspace for 2.5 years and it has changed my life. When my new therapist recently recommended I practice mindfulness meditation I knew exactly what to do. I plugged in more to Headspace, checking in 3 times a day now instead of just in the morning. But even starting with just once a day changed my life. This app makes it easy and has guided me to a better life in ways I never anticipated. I highly recommend it to everyone I know.
title: Better than therapy alone

review: I've tried a lot of meditation apps. This one is the best. On most apps I spend five minutes trying to find an appropriate focus for the day. With Headspace, I open it and immediately we're in the session. Also the amount of sessions is impressive. There are 30 day long packs focused on one topic where each day is a new perspective on that topic. Now, that doesn't mean there aren't drawbacks. The price may scare you away but no other meditation app offers this level of expert guidance.
title: Best Guided Meditation App

review: I felt at a loss after completing the Basics course. There are so many options and no guidance in selecting a path to gradually learn more about meditation. Additionally, as I‚Äôm left jumping haphazardly from one course to the next, it would be really great to have an in-app (but exportable) journal of the insights and lessons imparted during the course. Perhaps I have a worse memory than most, but I‚Äôm sure everyone would benefit from having a clear idea of the specific techniques to try beyond the app. Or perhaps the goal is to keep us tethered to Headspace forever?
title: More guidance needed, as well as help in retaining the recommendations shared

review: I‚Äôve been using the head space app for about six months now. It has definitely helped me to find emotional strength and mental clarity after reaching burn out. I‚Äôve been able to confront some very challenging family situations, with control and compassion. The instructors are very good. I‚Äôve received quick feedback. I‚Äôve been inspired by some of the guest spotlights. I would suggest that it would be helpful to have some more mature instructors - to relate to us middle agers.
title: Very useful for addressing burn out

review: I‚Äôve been going through some heavy anxiety and depression this past year. Mediation and tapping (EFT) have saved me. This app is wonderfully diverse, and I love the home page with suggestions for morning, midday, and evening mindfulness. There are also plenty of options for specific needs, and I use the kids meditations frequently with my children. I am so grateful that Andi Puddicombe had an idea for Headspace and ran with it. It has grown into such a great resource that is literally changing lives.
title: Saving My Life Over Here

review: I am a healthcare worker and it has been a rough year. I cannot thank Headspace enough for helping me through these challenging times. There are shorter meditations when one doesn‚Äôt have much time but needs a moment of sanity to clear their head. In addition there are longer ones with helpful tools and advice and the ap is easy to navigate to cater to different feelings. The sleep casts and sleep music have been a lifeline to enable me to get some much needed rest. Thank you so much.
title: Wonderful

review: I found out about headspace through the show on Netflix, guide to mediation (highly recommend) and after trying a few other apps for sleep, meditation, etc, I figured I would give headspace a go. Seriously the best app I‚Äôve EVER used, wish I found it sooner but I guess the universal clock is always on time right? Andy and headspace literally changed my life and I am so thankful to have this experience . Will ABSOLUTELY be recommending this app to friends and family. Spread the wealth ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Headspace changed my life

review:
I‚Äôve been using headspace for about five years or almost 25,000 minutes. Headspace meditation practice has helped me develop a third eye where I‚Äôm able to look at myself objectively and question certain behaviors that are compulsive. This allows me more consciousness of those behaviors and a an opportunity to make better choices which allows for a more tranquil and peaceful existence. Currently, I‚Äôm trying to practice having a beginners mind so I‚Äôm not so distressed by the news and advertising cacophony on mass media. Thank you to all the folks at Headspace.
Joe
title: Peace

review: This app is made very well. The quality of the app is great, no glitches not too sure but no ads. I really like the thought they put into the app. I have rated it a three because you have to pay six dollars a month to get anything on the app. I have downloaded this app a very long time ago and everything was free and it worked amazing. I am just a young student who wants a good night of sleep. I can‚Äôt pay six dollars a month. If the things on the app were free, it would be five stars without a doubt. If you can pay the six dollars a month, you go for it, it really does help.
title: Great app but...

Here's what's included in the free trial: https://help.headspace.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008192928-What-s-included-for-free-", 'modified': '2021-04-18T19:21:41Z'}

review: I‚Äôm a university student and my courses are intensive and fast. Needed an App to feel calm and relaxed to go to bed. They have so much variety in voice actors, relaxing music that can make you feel focused and calm at the same time. They have amazing quality nature sounds. Theres stories or narrative meditative walkthroughs. Theres still much to explore. So far its help for all my needs for focus and to calm my anxieties and to relax to sleep. If you are a student they have a sweet discount for the whole year. Its worth it.
title: Great Selections

review: Before I started headspace I swear I could not sleep at all and when I wake up I would barely have any energy to get ready to start the day until I got headspace everything flipped upside down and It‚Äôs really cool good for all ages It has some Sesame Street characters there for the kids and a podcast for everything such as dealing with money,craving,yoga,sleep meditation and even music the sleep to and even If you need to focus of something NO JOKE best meditation app you will ever find!!!üëçüèæ
title: Headspace is awesome

review: I‚Äôm obsessed with this app. I was worried at first that it would be a waste of money but absolutely not. It is worth every penny. They have guided meditations for every single situation, whether anxious, sleepy, needing a boost of energy, happiness, & anything you wish you feel more or less of! It‚Äôs so so relaxing, I love using this app for my anxiety. I get daily anxiety/panic attacks as I am consumed by my overthinking, but when I partake in these mediations, it‚Äôs more helpful than anything I have ever done before!!
title: How is an app so helpful?!

review:
Back away unless you want to experience zen hijacked by woke sf tech bubble office identity politics. 5 example of cringe. 

1) The people doing the voices of the lessons and individuals themselves Sarah, Dora or something. I don‚Äôt find their experiences or what they bring to the table unique. Kasonga for instance is equally as cringe and out of touch. Their voices are irritating and prideful. 

2) No contributors with DEGREES in CBT or Monks  

3) The sort of SF tech bubble vibe the current contributors have is for a modern term cringe.

4) The feature topics seem to be centered around race a lot. This is some of that social justice or work programming that while it might be popular in office politics that ideology is counterproductive to self-awareness as it relies on the outside world to justify the inner person. There are many categories within the applicator to this sort of dogma.

5) As a Lesbian myself indulging in those identity politics is ego. And I‚Äôve noticed that it only gets in the way of mindfulness practice. And quite frankly in the app. zen awareness practice knows no identity
title: Warning: App Gone Woke

review:
Like I said, as a beginner, this app really helped me understand and practice. But as I move through the pro series courses, I find a few things increasingly frustrating.

First, the ‚Äútoday‚Äôs meditation‚Äù has no scaling on the number of mid-session prompts based on your level. I‚Äôm becoming increasingly comfortable with more prolonged silence in pro level 2. Then I do a today‚Äôs meditation. I like the beginning of these sessions and the different ideas they offer, but I wish I could turn off all mid-session prompts, just receiving the quick intro and then the transition out of the session. At this point, a few minutes of silence followed by Andy saying ‚Äúno real effort required‚Äù is more of a hindrance than a help.

Second, I like that the profile page lets you hide your streak. Why does this not also silence the streak update after my first session per day?

As I grow more comfortable with my practice, I may need to look more into timer apps than this guided experience.
title: Great beginner experience but needs some tweaks
