Anxiety and depression come in different levels and different ways. Headspace has helped me identify my anxiety and work through it. 10/10 would recommend as a DAILY routine.
title: Finding Peace in a Busy World

review: I can tell the difference when I make the time to meditate or breathe versus when I don‚Äôt make the time. I am so thankful it is free for educators and I plan to use it in my classroom weekly this upcoming year!

title: Great app

review: Truly a life changing app for people that want to practice getting out of their own head. I‚Äôve only been using it a short while, and I already notice reduced anxious thinking. title: More free ones.

review: This app has helped me so much through my life. Because if this app I have learned how to mediate, think and process my emotions instead of being controlled by them, and (arguably the most important part) it‚Äôs helping me be more mindful not just for myself, but for others too. I highly recommend this app.
title: Amazing app!

review: I genuinely can‚Äôt praise this app enough.  From guidance for beginners to daily meditations (that somehow always seem to touch on the exact area I need to work on that day) this app has it all. title: Meditation for all!

title: Incredible- you will love it

The fifth star is for the delicious fact that the sound of Andy‚Äôs voice puts my daughter to sleep like a shot.
title: Unearthed By Headspace

review: I have been using headspace for 5+ years now. Meditation every day leverages the power of compound interest. Done consistently over time will have life changing effects. It will not only benefit you but your loved ones. The one piece of my self care I never skip on is my daily headspace.
title: The exercise app your mind needs

review: Simplicity of design, teachings, and overall positive modeling has really helped me make some positive shifts in thought patterns/habits in ways that have significantly improved my life. I‚Äôve used the meditations a ton and enjoyed the wake-up. It‚Äôs been extremely helpful. I hope it helps you too!
title: This has changed me!

review:
Do not download this app or sign up for the free trial unless you‚Äôre ready to pay the full fee. I tried it, didn‚Äôt find it helpful for myself, and tried cancelling. The cancellation was not processing so I reached out to customer service. They did not get back to me and CHARGED ME for the full amount. I reached out again and they refuse to give a refund. Currently disputing with my bank and may see y‚Äôall in small claims court!!!

Update: I have reached out to headspace via email several times and received the same response that they will not provide a refund

Our mission at Headspace is to improve the health and happiness of the world, and if we don't have a healthy business, there is no way for us to fulfill this mission. review: I am enjoying the meditations, and like that it keeps track of your total time meditating. But it will not save the reminders that I set for some reason. I‚Äôve tried everything. Maybe it‚Äôs on my end, maybe my iPad settings or some thing but it will not save when I toggle set reminders.
title: Enjoy the meditations, but it will not set reminders

review: Discrimination against older people is dominant in our culture and headspace is no exception. It is particularly disgusting the way that this app, which tries to sell itself as all inclusive, constantly intentionally excludes all people that may be perceived as old. In absolutely all their interviews, they exclude people who may look old and thus may make this hypocritical app look ‚Äúbad.‚Äù speaking of LGBT pride, headspace interviewed a series of queer people and absolutely no one was ‚Äúold.‚Äù Old people must be invisible, must be excluded because it‚Äôs not good business for Headspace. This makes me sick.
title: AGEISM AND HEADSPACE

review:
Andy and his team have put together courses and videos which cut across some many areas of life.

The content is constantly updated and they even have mediation for kids.

The sleep stories/casts are great when you need to wind down or are having trouble sleeping.
title: Wonderful Meditation App

review: I am someone that is new to meditation and this app and it‚Äôs unique features are something that I never new I needed. I almost didn‚Äôt get the yearly subscription thinking it was too much for an app that helped you relax using your own mind but it has been worth every penny!
title: Thanks Headspace!

review: I‚Äôve had this app for over a year now and I absolutely love it. Meditation has been a savior in my life and the headspace community makes me feel so loved and connected. I believe everyone should give meditating a try, with or without this app. But this app certainly is a great place to start!
title: Life changing

review: I love the content in this app, but the way it‚Äôs organized is absolutely bonkers! My head spins every time I open it, on the home page it‚Äôs offering me 30 mediations ‚Äújust for me‚Äù, when it‚Äôs obvious i‚Äôm going to just continue on the set i‚Äôve already started. This app needs a redesign asap, too many ideas all at once.
title: great mediations, stressful UX

review: Headspace has always been a little weird to me. I‚Äôve never been one to sit quietly but over the course of the pandemic I found myself looking for a way to control my mind and body. Headspace is an easy and fun way to slow down and actually assess how I am feeling. Love this app.
title: Easy way to meditate

review: I have practiced meditation in the past, but having a convenient ‚Äúpocket teacher‚Äù for meditation is great this has helped me with my personal anxiety at work and is quite honestly the only app that I‚Äôve ever reviewed willingly. I would recommend this to anyone beginner, intermediate, or expert they have courses for all; truly amazing.
title: Amazing

review:
Headspace has helped me practice skills that are transforming my life. The content and app design are amazing.

My biggest request for the app now is to be able to play/pause the focus music and not lose my place if I need to switch between apps.
title: Didn‚Äôt realize how toxic my always-on mind was

review: I‚Äôm so grateful for Headspace. My husband died in February 2020. Shortly after his death everything was shut down due to Covid-19. I was grieving and the loneliness was unbearable. I did the grieving course. It helped me so much, Andy‚Äôs voice was like listening to a friend. I‚Äôm still lonely and grieving but I‚Äôm looking forward to the future. Thank you Headspace.
title: Grateful for Headspace

review: I have never been more thankful for this app into my life. It‚Äôs more important than any other icon within my phone. It allows me to slow down, restore myself, and calm down. I struggle with feeling nervous, anxious, or downright angry. This helps put out the fires that I can‚Äôt sometimes control.
title: App For Life

review: I started using Headspace when I was researching apps to help my clients with stress and anxiety. I ended up also using it for myself. It‚Äôs great for people of all ages, young and old, and it‚Äôs easy to use. Whenever I feel like life is chaotic, this helps bring me grounded and calm. I would recommend to a friend.
title: Easy and Relaxing

review: I love the meditations.  However there is one thing that I would change.  I wish you could make a sleep playlist that would allow you to go directly from a nighttime meditation to sleep music to morning wake up.
title: Sleep playlist

review: I got this app months ago, and I appreciated the free things it had on it. It was just enough to keep me using it. I like the breathing exercises and the new little daily things it gave. It helped me start my morning. Now everything is LOCKED and you can‚Äôt use it at all unless if you buy the app. So disappointing. Deleting it now just because I clearly have no use for it. I already have a subscription of the Calm app, and I like that one a whole lot better. More variety anyways.
title: So disappointed In this app now.

review:
Head Space has made incorporating meditation into my daily routine fun and easy. It truly a is an app that masterful captures the essence of meditation in simple and accessible courses, quotes and more.

I‚Äôm grateful to have given my self the ‚Äúpresent‚Äù of Head Space. It helps me be more present for my family, friends and loved ones.
title: HeadSpace‚Äôs Positive Impact

review: I love this app. I struggle with insomnia, anxiety and depressive tendencies, and as a almost 13 year old girl, it‚Äôs really hard. My insomnia gets worse and so does my tendencies, and since getting this app, I feel like I‚Äôm getting better ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π And that thought just really comforts me. Thank you, Headspace, for making this app a reality. üëèüèº
title: Awesome! üëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèº

review:
Be with myself is the best gift I can learn in my life journey. I am grateful that along the road I am finding compassion and self compassion in spaces like this. Feeling grateful for my life and for the free resources available for those who are struggling to find a way out. Thank you all who dedicates your knowledge and love through HeadSpace to the world. 
By Juliane K.
title: Drops of love

review: Anytime I feel anxious or overwhelmed this is my go-to to ensure I start my day off on the right foot. I am trying to make it a daily habit because I definitely notice a change for the better when I mediate even for 5 minutes. And his voice is soooo relaxing. Also love the focus playlist as background music!

review: Thankyou to Andy and all the other voices for helping me. I‚Äôve been having a lot of trouble with work and friends and it felt so amazing to clear my head for the first time in several weeks. I recommend this app to anyone feeling stressed or upset. It really does help. Thankyou once again for helping me and many other people.
title: Thankyou

review:
I was an insomniac for years. Didn‚Äôt like how Rx sleeping pills made me feel. I fall asleep faster to Andy and Eves voices, and if I wake up at 4 am, they help me get right back to sleep. 

My daughter actually found and recommended headspace- some of the life lessons about impermanence have helped deal with her anxiety.
title: Best sleep aid, good coach for 12 year old

review: As an owner of a software as a service product, I always go out of my way to offer refunds if someone accidentally renewed their product. It‚Äôs the ethical business approach and says a lot about the what a company values. Headspace will not offer refunds and additionally sets up subscriptions outside of the Apple Store so that it is harder to notice and cancel your subscription. While they aren‚Äôt doing anything illegal, they intentionally choose billing strategies to make money by tricking users.
title: If you don‚Äôt cancel in time Headspace will not refund you

review: It‚Äôs good but it feels everyone is just reading off the same script. Makes no sense when they‚Äôre talking about liquid light, solar plexus, diaphragm, etc. A few times I had to leave the app to lookup what these are. And when they say ‚Äúquality‚Äù what they‚Äôre rally saying is ‚Äúfeeling.‚Äù They need to redo their meditations and just keep it simple with the words. No need to try to sound smart.
title: Could be better

review: I like headspace and find the packs to be easy and sleep sounds nice to have but I really wish they tracked your progress differently instead of just counting how many days in a row you meditated. No one‚Äôs perfect so if you miss 1 day it sets back to 0, and it‚Äôs not an accurate representation of your progress.
title: I wish the progress tracker were different

review: It's a must app for someone who wants to accept emotions of life verses fighting / running away from them. Super helpful. Love calm voice of Andy.... I would highly recommend prenatal pack as it helps to get use to changes that are happening in female body while carry another human being within us!
title: Must app

review: This app has been my go to meditation and mindfulness app for 6+ years. I‚Äôve sprinkled in other apps over the years for variety, but I keep falling back to this app. In a crazy life where living, world, work, and relationships change, Headspace is home. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more.
title: Fantastic

review: This is my 2nd year to subscribe paying the yearly fee and it is worth every penny!!!!  I use this every morning to start my day off right and throughout the day sometimes as well. I enjoy the ‚ÄúWake up‚Äù and I appreciate all the people on here who take the time to make this the best meditation app.
title: Love it!

review:
I‚Äôve seen the ads on headspace to be

review: Whether it sounds clich√© or not, I can say that Headspace changed my life. I have been practicing for six years now. I have tried other apps, taken mindfulness classes, am currently working on becoming a mindfulness teacher, and I still use Headspace as part of my practice.
title: Change my life

review: From the morning wake-up video clips to the interruption free focus music plus the huge library of guided meditation packs, there is something for everyone. Even a list of things for the day on home page so you don‚Äôt have to spend time and energy choosing.
title: Great

review: I‚Äôve been using Headspace for years now and consider it an essential part of my daily life. The many variations of meditations and now all the extra features are so much more than I‚Äôd found with any other meditation app. My kids are getting into it too now. So grateful!
title: Indispensable

review: Headspace has helped me in so many ways. It‚Äôs been tremendous as far as understanding myself and allowing my self to see life and emotions from a higher perspective. I absolutely love the teachings. Ancient wisdom. The app has helped me through some difficult times when I had no where to turn.
title: I love headspace

review: I never thought meditation would work for me. But this app proved me wrong. I love being guided through sessions by Andy and his team and feel like I‚Äôve gained a lot of calm through this process. I am a physician and many times this app helps me wind down before bed and to let go of my day.
title: Such a useful app

review:
Absolutely love this app and the meditations as well as the variety. 

One thing I hope you add later is a feature to customize what displays on the widget. I'd prefer the meditations show up in the morning vs the wake up thing (I don't often use), and afternoon breaks show up in the afternoon vs the meditation.
title: Love

review:
I never write app reviews, but I had to for Headspace.  It was an app my therapist suggested to me when I had no idea where to start.  It makes meditation simple, calm, and easy for someone like me who stresses out about doing even meditation correctly.

I love how many options there are of different states if mind that they can help talk you through rebalancing yourself.

I have recommended this app to every friend who mentions how they want to get started in meditating.  I would have given up if I didn‚Äôt have such a simple and colorful guide like this.

Even the design of the app is so calming.  I love it.
title: Kept me Alive

review:
I absolutely love this app and try to use it everyday. Meditation through Headspace has helped me a lot with my own mental health and I have found a new appreciation for life. 

Their support team is always top notch. I had an issue with my account and couldn‚Äôt remember the email address I used. Two of their members went above and beyond for me.
title: Love it

review: I appreciate all of the meditations that I can get to even though I don‚Äôt have a membership, but I thought that membership was free for teacher? title: Truly life changing.

review: This app has had bugs for 2 months now that haven‚Äôt been fixed despite several emails to them. It seems like at this point they won‚Äôt get fixed. review: I use headspace on the nights that I just can‚Äôt fall asleep. It‚Äôs great and easy to use. Other than that, headspace is great and I highly recommend it for meditation!
title: I love Headspace but

review:
‚Äú I feel the best I felt all day‚Äù said my Uncle. ‚ÄúThis is amazing!‚Äù Said my Aunt. I did this for a year and introduced it to my family. They had so much stress and I wanted to help. I introduced Headspace and they loved it. My recommendation/rate is this app helps you with stress, problems with sleeping, etc. Please use this app.

title: Amazing app I feel so relaxed

review: Meditation came into my life during a trying time, and while I struggle with being consistent about my practice. I do find a lot of benefit from it and hope that everyone gives it a chance to find that clarity and peace we are all looking for in life.

review: Headspace has been a part of my life for three years now. I use not only the meditations and sleep casts nearly every day, but my children also love the sleep casts, they really help them to wind down from the day. It is a resource that seems to grow all the time and I love it.
title: I use it everyday

review: Headspace is helping me create my meditation routine and stick to it. There are so many different meditations to choose from and new ones everyday. I am in a completely different space after a year of near daily use. So easy to us and customizable to any routine
title: Just wonderful

review: I really love the recent changes including the Today design/experience and dark background! There may be a couple bugs in setting up the meditation and bedtime reminders from the dark mode switch. But the design journey is delightfully comforting overall.
title: Fabulous design

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few months now. Let‚Äôs put some perspective here. I don‚Äôt write reviews. But this app is good I advocate for it whenever I can. My anxiety and depression levels have dramatically changed for the better. Thanks headspace. Your team has made my life one I love living.
title: What an app

review: This app has helped me get into a better sleep schedule and help me fall asleep much much faster no matter what is going on in my life. Very helpful. Even if you only use the sleep casts I‚Äôd still argue it to be worth the money. I even survived using the free sleep casts for awhile so try it out.
title: This app is great

review: I did the two week trial for this app. They automatically set you up for a one year subscription auto renewal. When I reached out to them to ask for a refund they gave me a generic answer and would not refund the $70 they charged me for this app. Instead of making me feel relaxed, this company is making my blood boil. There are a lot of meditation apps out there, find a different one.
title: They will automatically charge you for one year after your two week trial. Horrible customer service

review:
I used headspace for a year or so and it wasn‚Äôt right for me. 

I‚Äôve been trying to cancel my account since then, and they will not let me. There is some sort of block on my account where I cannot edit my billing settings, and they told me to reach out to customer support. 

I‚Äôve reached out to customer support THREE separate times to cancel my account entirely. On the third time around they‚Äôve decided to just completely ignore me. 

I‚Äôm now having to dispute the charges with my bank, and get an entirely new debit card to keep these money-hungry capitalists from continuing to charge me. 

For an app that claims to care about mental health and overall well being, it‚Äôs sick to see them steal from me when all I did was use their app to try and help my mental health.
title: Continues to charge me and won‚Äôt let me cancel my account

review: I‚Äôm a very distracted person, prone to anxiety. I‚Äôve been using the meditation guidance to help me relax and be more present. The teachers are great and it feels so good to schedule time to just be. I couldn't do it on my own, I need the guidance, and the variety of meditation topics are helpful. Highly recommend.
title: Helping me be more focused.

review: That meditation could be made do-able?  Finding a better way could be achievable? It is remarkable that someone a bit ‚Äúup tight‚Äù could find more peace, less stress in a few minutes of mindful work daily. It‚Äôs possible. Give it a try!
title: Who knew?

You choose the teacher and then nothing happens (i.e., the session doesn‚Äôt play). This issue has existed through at least 2 app updates including the one I just received today.  Thanks.

review: This is a wonderful app, when it works.  Since the last update (Today is 23 Jun ‚Äò22) the app crashes every time I try to listen to a guided meditation. This can be very frustrating.  Good thing there‚Äôs a meditation for dealing with frustration‚Ä¶..oh wait.
title: Major flaw

review: Thank you so much Andy and team for creating Headspace. It has absolutely changed my entire life and there is no other meditation app and community like this around. I am so grateful for it. I‚Äôve tried other apps before and none of them compare to headspace. So creative and amazing
title: The Greatest Meditation App Ever

review: there are so many options in this app! it‚Äôs very user friendly and does a very good job to help encourage you to keep up your practice but also reminds you to give yourself grace. the run streak and ‚Äúminutes meditated‚Äù pop ups at the end of each session are encouraging and make me want to continue. the only thing i wish the app had was more music options such as music specifically for relaxation but the focus music is great too!  there are so many options in the focus music section and i listen to them even if i‚Äôm just relaxing in my room
title: i love this app

review: This app has a huge variety of material. The approach to meditation here is perfect for me.  As a skeptical scientist I resist overly mystical or credulous approaches. Also those that make thinking seem like a bad thing. This program is very grounded and practical without underselling the benefits of spending time in the present moment.

review: I had some rough time keeping my thoughts together and managing my panic attacks when the pandemic started until I started to get help and started meditation using Headspace. title: Life Changer!!

review: My job is very stressful and I‚Äôm always getting pulled in 15 different directions. This app has helped me learn to understand stress and I hope everyone who has the stress with work and home life as I do, finds this app. It will greatly improve your life.

review: I‚Äôve used head space before and have truly missed it. I‚Äôm back and have the intention to make this a solid part of my daily practice. I know the power of meditation and want to reap all its benefits. Headspace is just a great way to learn and be part of a powerful community üíï
title: Care for myself

review: BEWARE.  This is normally a five star app. However it‚Äôs barely worth one star if you don‚Äôt get what you paid for.I switched over to a new iPhone 13 and logged in and verified that I paid for an annual subscription in March through my phone; now I‚Äôm being prompted to pay and support says they have no record of my subscription.I sent them a screenshot from my iPhone subscription page. I still have not heard back and I‚Äôm very disappointed.

review:
From the variety of meditation experiences and courses to the focus music and daily offerings to the sleepcasts.- this is the whole package! The best thing is the beautiful energy that comes through in every aspect. You know this group, the creators if this app and content truly care. 
.
title: I Love Everything About This App

review: The thing about this app that I really can't handle is the voices they use for the meditations and sleep casts. They are not at all soothing and many of them have this weird gargle-y scratchy tone in their voice that makes me want to scream and cry at the same time. Working for the horrible corporation of Starbucks gives me this app for free though, so I'll use it until I can't handle working for one of corporate America's demons any longer.
title: Good concept, horrible voices

review: Whenever I downloaded Headspace, I thought it would be free and I honestly think it should be free. I know you guys want to make money off of it, but it‚Äôs a app for meditation. I know it probably isn‚Äôt ideal, but I would rather do one payment of $5-$15 than 70 dollars a year or 13 dollars every month. Sure there might be a 7-day free trial, but I don‚Äôt think it really matters. Thinking about this problem makes me have even more frustration and it is now hard for me to meditate thinking about how I can‚Äôt finish.
title: Don‚Äôt wanna pay

review: This is a perfect introduction to meditation in an easy to follow format. The experience using it is clear and simple. I‚Äôm finding my own headspace again and doing some much needed ‚Äúhousekeeping‚Äù! Thank you Andy snd team for your generosity in sharing your life experience with all of us who need the gift of meditation! üíó
title: Headspace

review: Changed my life. No, not the sole arbiter of life change. But definitely a critical ingredient. I have been consistently using Headspace for several years, logging over 15,200 minutes in over 1,000 sessions. Do something long enough and it changes you; I recommend letting Headspace into your life. So awesome!
title: 15,000 Meditation Minutes Later...

review: This app has a ton of potential to help with everything from sleeplessness to relationships to anxiety. Like most things worth doing it requires patience and persistence, but even if you‚Äôre thinking meditation isn‚Äôt for you, stick with this because it can be life-changing. Andy and his team are wonderful. And the sleepcasts are the best!
title: Wonderful

review: A lot of people don‚Äôt know that there are now workouts on headspace - they‚Äôre mellow but effective and help to do before sitting to meditate if I‚Äôm having trouble settling down. I also love the focus music on headphones for doing homework in my small apt when other people are doing noisy things. It‚Äôs like being in another room!
title: Movement and focus!

review: As an adult, I have some very distinct memories of important decisions I have made in my life. Deciding to add meditation to my daily routine is one of them. This app provides a very structured approach to teaching meditation and effectively helping to keep it a part of your life. Do yourself a favor and make a memorize of your own.
title: One of the best decisions

review: This app has literally changed my life. I‚Äôve been using it for over a year now. Mindful mediation has helped me with my anxiety and depression. Helps you stay in the present. Went from having panic attacks to having a good relationship with my anxiety. I recommend using Andy.
title: Life changing!!

review: I only remember to use this app when I‚Äôm crazy stressed and need a minute to relax. Unfortunately most of these times I do not have cell service. And it seems every update deletes all my offline material. Major flaw in my opinion. My gf uses it sometimes but it‚Äôs a waste to me because the offline features are hidden and just not user friendly.
title: Decent app minus offline features
developerResponse: {'id': 37517661, 'body': "We're sorry to hear you are having trouble playing your sessions offline.  Please send our team an email at: Help@Headspace.com and they will be happy to get you back on track!", 'modified': '2023-07-06T15:37:40Z'}

review: Headspace was once a great app. Now the content is mostly social justice based and propaganda. Most of us turn to meditation for calm, peace and mindfulness. We desire a break from the endless media messaging we experience 24/7. The true masters and teachers of meditation do not offend, they simply offer a neutral, warm and inviting space to practice mindfulness. My request is to return to simplicity, step away from the desperate need to be ‚Äúrelevant‚Äù - it is not a good look.
title: No longer great

review: I used to love Headspace meditations, playlists, and workouts, and still do the latter, but for the past several months my front page has stopped loading. I‚Äôve tried uninstalling and reinstalling the app to no avail, and it‚Äôs frustrating to the point that I don‚Äôt feel like paying for a subscription anymore (why pay for a broken app?). Hopefully this gets fixed soon‚Ä¶
title: Front page stopped loading

review: Headspace is something I am very grateful for because it has had such a positive impact on me. After using the app for two years, I feel more mindful and confident in myself. I would highly recommend this app to anyone who wants to learn how to meditate and become more mindful.
title: Nothing But Amazing

review: I really like this app.. I had a 14 day trial going but was getting 25% off emails everyday from them. I asked if they can apply the 25% discount to my membership once my trial ends and emailed them over and over to no response. Here I am and the trial is up and no response. I am not expecting them to say 100% but a simple reply would be nice. Great example of no matter how great your product is that if your customer service is lacking it can ruin the whole experience‚Ä¶

review: Headspace has given me much more value than what it cost. I even bought a membership for my daughter because I think that the app does that much good. Would love to be able to set the default meditation time but still a 5 star app.

review: I used to love Headspace, but‚Ä¶the app has become less friendly and no longer has those delightful motion touches it used to have. The interface has become cluttered and I now have a harder time finding what I‚Äôm looking for. I miss the old look and feel. I‚Äôm turned off by how new content is being promoted, and I feel overwhelmed by the amount of content I have to see on the way to the content I‚Äôm looking for.

review: I started using this app about two weeks ago to manage my depression, anxiety, and monkey mind. I cannot say that this app cured things, but I can say that this app is tremendously contributing to a more peaceful life. I use it every single day and plan to for as long as possible.

It is a total scam and it is DEFINITELY not worth wasting your money on. This app is getting deleted off of my phone and is apparently getting deleped off of many others' phones as well for the same reason. They don't care about your mental health. review: I honestly never write reviews out of sheer laziness and disinterest but I feel like someone may need this. I got this on a free trail and I‚Äôve been using it daily. The content is interesting and informative. My days start better my routine has improved and I‚Äôm overall more mindful of myself.
title: Great app

review: I use the app just for the sleepcasts. They‚Äôve helped me get to sleep so many times, especially when I have bad anxiety or intrusive thoughts keeping me up. I like that you can toggle the sound between more voice or more ambient noise. Hope they add more new sleepcasts soon.

Every session is a few sentences followed by the same meditation process. I was really hoping for something with more variety, something new from time to time. Maybe I am still in the introductory stages. I‚Äôll give it another week or two, but so far I just don‚Äôt see the appeal of this app.
title: Repetitive!

review: I have tried a couple of meditation apps, but headspace of by far my favorite. Simple, clear, fun and engaging it‚Äôs such an important tool. I have all my clients get headspace, because it‚Äôs such an important part of their practice. Change your thinking and you can change your life.
title: Best meditation app

review: Headspace has definitely helped me. From helping me to fall asleep at night and helping me to keep my calm to waking up. Headspace reminded me it‚Äôs okay for your mind to wander off, but in the end it will always come back, and mind, body, and speech, are one again. Headspace is a lifesaver, and I‚Äôd be lost without having headspace.
title: Headspace

Then I can either sleep better, enjoy time with my family, or work more efficiently, depending on the situation and time of day. Highly recommended.

review: My wife and I have been practicing meditation for over 365 continuous days using the app. Andy does a wonderful job of explaining and guiding. Headspace is the best subscription ap I‚Äôve ever paid for!

title: Love this app!

review:
My first few meditation sessions went well... except for intrusive thoughts of ‚Äúthis isn‚Äôt my idea of being productive!‚Äù
And ironically I begin to understand *that‚Äôs* the point: remove yourself from the ‚Äòproductive‚Äô world; move yourself mentally and physically inward, away from involvement with the outside world. Say ‚Äòhello‚Äô to yourself, ‚Äúhow are ya‚Äô doing in there?‚Äù
And listen for the answer.
title: A beginner meditates..

Until Headspace I was never able to successfully meditate or get the benefits. With so many helpful techniques and approaches to mindfulness, I learn something new every day and feel better. I am so grateful for the creators and their generosity. 

Thank you Headspace for helping so many of us weather this storm we are in together.

review:
I recently had to go to the ER because I was in hypertensive crisis. I‚Äôd let poor health choices, stress, and anxiety reign in my life and these things sent me to the hospital. The experience was a teacher. 
  I decided to make a change - one of the changes being that I was going to meditate. Headspace is provided to us by my work so it was a easy choice to make. I‚Äôm glad I got into it. I still feel anxiety and stress, but now with Headspace I have a way to realign and reestablish balance. It‚Äôs been a great practice for me. I hope it becomes one for you as well.   

All the best, 

Mark
title: Making changes

review: I love this app but I wish you could stack / make a playlist. For example, I like to listen to a 5 or 10 minute wind down before listening to a sleep cast. It would be nice to have a playlist to just hit play and be guided off to sleep.

review:
I immediately cancelled my subscription in the app after downloading it for the free month promo. The app asked me to sleep on it (cute) and said it was sorry to see me go. I found out however, if you don‚Äôt go into your apple subscriptions and cancel it also, you will still be charged monthly.
Just found out I‚Äôve been paying for this for months without knowing it. Seems like a sneaky thing to do for an app that‚Äôs all about mental health.
title: Nothing calms the mind like getting robbed.

review: Whether I was deciding to quit my job, starting a career change, dealing with being unemployed during the pandemic, or transitioning into my new position I have now, headspace has always been the go-to app for helping me keep it together‚Äîie reframing my anxiety so I can keep going. title: Absolutely Life Altering

So thankful for this and for the year free because this has been the most difficult year for us financially and business wise with these shutdowns in California affecting our business.
title: Life changing

review:
Was really disappointed to see last night when I went to bed that there is no longer ANY free content available. In the midst of one of the most stressful times of year, and when many are struggling with seasonal depression. Apparently they only care about your mental health if you have money.

I‚Äôve used the app for a long time, when it was considerably less popular. It‚Äôs sad to see that they chose green when they‚Äôre probably making more money than ever.

review: Signed up for headspace during the pandemic and it is the best! Their sleep meditation really helps my husband to sleep. I have used some of their meditation courses and those have helped too. Lastly they‚Äôve got some white noise (like Ocean time) that helps our baby sleep as well. Win win for all of us :)

review: Love the way it streamlines the process of meditation and makes it accessible to anyone. review: This is a very good, well-produced product. The meditations are excellent and genuinely beneficial. review: This app makes daily meditation possible for me. Sometimes, finding the smooth path in my life involves tricking my clever and devious brain. This app is a great life hack
title: Great life hack

review: Loved using Headspace for meditation as well as a sleep aid for months. I have noticed marked improvement in my stress and anxiety levels partially due to the resources on this app. That said, it‚Äôs clear that Andy and Headspace are choosing to sell themselves out to companies that have nothing to do with meditation. Music and workouts in a meditation app? What? Stay true to yourself. Eh, I guess it‚Äôs just business.
title: Great But...

review: I have primary insomnia and midnight laundertte is a godsend. One suggestion, can you create a ‚Äúloop‚Äù/‚Äúrepeat‚Äù function? I wake up frequently and this puts me right back to sleep but I have to open my phone each time to restart the app.
title: Absolutely excellent for insomnia

review: I bought this app on a whim and it‚Äôs worth the investment. It helps me take 5-10 min out of my day to reframe and refocus as someone who is always busy. I really like the courses. Those keep me on track and they have multiple teachers which is nice.
title: Anxious student

review:
I genuinely love this app so much. Sure it costs money but it was completely worth it. 
I love using headspace every day. 
They have so many activities that aren‚Äôt just meditating. 
My son listens to going to bed with Elmo section every night. 
I cannot say enough good things about this app.
title: Best App Ever!

review: I am so happy I found this app. It is amazing and helps me with my anxiety and my depression. Also, I have chronic pain. Teaches you how to relax. I just wish they had longer sessions for some of the categories especially sleep. Otherwise, fantastic app. I would recommend it to anyone.
title: Has changed how to channel my emotions

review:
Headspace is a great service and I recommend it, assuming it works. 

They offer a subscription with a 14 day trial period. However, when I went to try that the other day, I was immediately charged the price for a full year, without warning. I was then given some error messages, and I didn't even get the subscription. The app still shows all the courses as locked, and it still prompts me up to try a free trial and subscribe.

I reached out to their support email and they told me there was nothing they could do. They didn't refund the charge, but also didn't give me the access I had unwillingly paid for.  

Headspace is an excellent service but this is incredibly frustrating, and now I'm wary to sign up because I can't trust them to honor a subscription.
title: Stole my money
developerResponse: {'id': 30266071, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out. We appreciate your feedback. We're very sorry for any trouble the recent charge might have caused and for the trouble accessing your Plus membership. Please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we'd be happy to assist further. ", 'modified': '2022-06-09T15:13:01Z'}

Where have you been all my life ü•∞, loving this app sooooo much! They should have this in schools.  It should come over the loud speakers twice a day ‚Äú headspace time‚Äù, take them through the five breaths and then a quick 3-5 minute re-focus (just imagine ü§îthe daily outcome

title: Headspace

review: Slowing the mind in our frenetic world takes both discipline and practice. Andy has opened this ancient discipline in an incredibly accessible way. The step-by-step guided approach makes meditation easier, more fun and you will notice the transformation quickly.

review: I finished the course on the free plan and I loved it. You get 10 days of 10 different meditations with 3 instructors plus other fun videos. I‚Äôm still working on building the habit so I‚Äôm taking the course again but with a different instructor this time.

title: Life Changing

one and lastly before I sleep. I probably use this app more then most apps on my phone. If you are reading this before downloading to look at the reviews I recommend to download it. Thank you for creating this wonderful app!

review:

review:
The visuals are beautiful and different. I like that there are special programs (I.e. mindful eating) but it would be nice if it showed your progress in each program and put it on your dashboard u til you finish. 

I would also like to see different breathing exercises for the morning routine, and my last ask is for improved meditations - ones where they talk about the subject/topic/theme throughout the meditation, not just the beginning. 

Overall a wonderful app and the widget for iPhone Home Screen is wonderful! Plus, the wake up has taught me new things and brought joy to my life. 

Thanks so much!
title: Great design

review: Really enjoying this app. I like the reminder feature because who doesn‚Äôt need reminders when your day is full of activities. I also like being able to choose the instructor.

review:
I enjoyed this app immensely in the past - haven‚Äôt logged in for awhile - just did and I got a pop up ad for a headspace podcast.  You know something I‚Äôm not interested in? Podcasts. You know where I want to see pop up ads?  Not in an app where I pay for the subscription. 

Please stop.  Let the meditation app be a meditation app.  Don‚Äôt show me ads.  Please.

allowing users to create a ‚Äúplaylist‚Äù or ‚Äúqueue‚Äù because I‚Äôd love to use a wind down before I use Sleep Music. The Wind Downs play at the beginning of every Sleepcast, but sometimes the storytelling after the wind down doesn‚Äôt help me sleep while music would.

review:
i don‚Äôt normally leave reviews, but i feel like other people may be able to use this.

i have really bad anxiety, and my mom has it too. she meditates with this app daily and told me it really impacted her mental health positively. i expressed my struggles with panic and anxiety attacks with her so she got me this app. 

headspace has changed a lot for me. i can discreetly use it in public if i‚Äôm feeling stressed or need a moment to myself, i can use it in the mornings to prepare for the day, and i can use it and live using it to fall asleep.

overall, if you‚Äôre struggling with anxiety, as someone who has it severely i recommend this app. not everything works for everyone but i seriously would consider it.

just know you‚Äôre not alone and you‚Äôve got this. don‚Äôt be nervous to ask for a helping hand, even if it‚Äôs an app that can be beneficial.

have a great day & thanks for reading! :)

I‚Äôm grateful for the positive, helpful direction that headspace is helping me achieve.  I may not be a perfect participant but I feel the effects are helping me in my daily life.  Along with therapy, yoga, and headspace I feel the best I have in a long time.  Thank you.

title: Useless

review:
For me, the whole app falls flat. I was hoping to find mediation sessions that involved no spoken lessons. I found a single one minute breathe-along type class I enjoyed but I couldn't find anything else. 

If you want a therapist in your ear, this might work for you. 

I was looking for a self-guided introspection and mental rest, but to me it felt like each meditation is a class I should take notes in.
title: Right idea, wrong execution

review:
I‚Äôm only three days into the beginner course. I‚Äôd like it a lot more if the teacher (Eva) paused between sentences, but instead you have no time to process what she said before she‚Äôs onto the next instruction. 

Example: ‚ÄúNow let your mind do whatever it wants to do now take a deep breath now feel your body in your chair now congratulations you‚Äôre done.‚Äù It‚Äôs actually stressful! PAUSE BETWEEN INSTRUCTIONS. Give me a minute or even 30 seconds to try what you just asked me to do.

I‚Äôd change teachers, but the other woman has a lisp and I don‚Äôt like the English guy‚Äôs voice. I‚Äôm being overly picky, I know. 

I guess it‚Äôs just not the meditation app for me.
title: Meh - like listening to one long run-on sentence

review: I can definitely feel the difference when I am not able to mediate.  The soundscape recordings to help with sleep and the daily course meditation selections are spot on with specific challenges I‚Äôve been working through.
title: Calm in the middle of my storm!

review:
Overall a great app.

Positives: Great meditations, soothing speakers, great visuals. I like that they keep a tracker of how you feel over the course of a month. Additional articles to read.

Negatives: A lot of content is locked behind a subscription. I get it but, they give you just a little in terms of free. I‚Äôm talking one session, two tops.

Others of Note: I‚Äôm stuck listening to Kevin Hart when I run. I don‚Äôt personally like the man for a racist birthday party he held for his son (I‚Äôm indigenous). I wish I could have options to listen to other speakers like in guided meditation in their application. When I think ‚Äúmindful runs‚Äù I don‚Äôt go straight to Kevin Hart of all people. Makes me want to stay in.
title: Not bad

title: Best app ever

review:
App has really expanded over the years but I have 3 points of strong frustration.  

#1 The inability to clear your history and restart a meditation series. 

#2 Navigating the app is confusing and I constantly feel like there are many more meditation‚Äôs available but just cannot easily find them.

#3 I meditate for 10 minutes, finding a meditation session that is 10 minutes long not easy.

One big improvement over the years are the addition of new people/voices as I found that Andy‚Äôs voice is often not clear and it sounds like he is mumbling at times.
title: Great App, But Improvements Needed

review: I have been using headspace for 4 years now and every time I come back to it I find it to be really healing. Andy‚Äôs voice is my preferred and I tend to stick to the meditation series, as it keeps me committed having a 2 or 3 week series.
title: Healing

review:
I‚Äôve used mindspace since it‚Äôs founding almost ten years ago. I loved the app and it‚Äôs content. 

As it‚Äôs grown to a business it‚Äôs lost it‚Äôs simplicity. The app is now trying to cater to all and everything with headlines screaming at your for every possible issue. It‚Äôs like the front page of a tabloid trying to see you on weight loss, financial freedom and snake oil. 

I can no longer find the simple meditation sessions that this app was built on. 

Please simplify and move the new content behind a menu and save my last played so that there is a way to use this app in a way that doesn‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre watching CNN or Fox news.
title: A cluttered experience full of chatter

developerResponse:
{'id': 39507509, 'body': "Thank you so much for your feedback!  Our mission at Headspace is to improve the health and happiness of the world, and if we don't have a healthy business, there is no way for us to fulfill this mission.  

We believe that our products provide value to the world and that is why we must charge a fee: to run a sustainable business and provide a healthy work environment for our hard-working team.  We employ animators, illustrators, project managers, finance controllers, customer experience representatives, as well as a full internal engineering team and marketing/community managers to make sure our message is being spread. Not to mention all the scientists that we work with to help us prove the validity of our products. 

We do still offer free content outside of the app on social media channels and still offer K-12 organizations free memberships in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada.

If you have any suggestions or additional feedback for us, please reach out to our support team at:  Help@Headspace.com.", 'modified': '2023-10-14T07:04:03Z'}

Gillian Shepherd

This decision was made to ensure that our team can focus on further improvements of our mobile and desktop products. In the meantime, we urge you to use and utilize Headspace on your mobile or desktop device. We assure you that the content is the same so you are not missing out on anything. If you prefer to listen to your Headspace meditation via a speaker system please note that you are still able to pair your mobile or desktop device with a bluetooth speaker for a more broad sounding meditation experience. If you have any further questions or comments please feel free to reach back out to us as all feedback from our community is important to us. \n\nAbout the trouble with your app and the adjusting the time length, please send us a note to help@headspace.com and we will be happy to further assist you, don't forget to attach screenshots or a screen recording of the issue.", 'modified': '2022-11-08T15:24:44Z'}

title: Limited access

review:
A cannonical issue with any "brand" is they always feel to add more.

Marketing and MBAs clearly have their clutches in this app now.   We have tons of new "features" that have nothing to do with the basics of meditation.

The basics of headspace, which are fundamental to mindfulness are now hidden.   They are there but now you have one hundred things obscuring accessibility including annoying pop-ups for celebrity content.   

Hopefully the Headspace team will find a way to come to their senses and eliminate all these chaotic bells and whistles that have nothing to do with cultivating mindfulness, serenity.
title: Suffering from featuritis and personalities over principles

review: Having a variety of resources is important to me personally.  Not only learning the basics of meditation, but also tools to promote sleep have been very useful in my circumstance.  I also use focus music on a regular basis to reset my day.

Just look at all the permissions this app has and how much of your data they track on you. This is packaged up and sold to Facebook, Snap, Pinterest and other large data mining companies.

review:
Several sleep casts only feature BIPOC voices when they‚Äôre tied to stereotypical roles.

For example, Carlos (spanish accent) only featured in El Mercado. Brian (Asian accent) only featured in Temple Rain. Kim (African American woman) only featured in Salon Nights.

Including diverse voice actors across all the sleep casts could undermine the typical tropes western cultures have historically imposed on ‚Äúother‚Äù identities. 

There‚Äôs an opportunity to challenge the historically prejudiced stereotypes that maintain that certain identities can  only exist  if fitting into well-worn mischaracterizations. 

Please reconsider how to cast voice actors.
title: Diverse voices

review:
I‚Äôm not sure what headspace is about.

Stress relief?
 Sure.
 The breathing exercise is excellent. 
Meditation?
 Okay.
 I‚Äôm a Zen Buddhist; this program is like Zen, minus the Buddhism. 
Sleep facilitation?
 Here‚Äôs where it gets tricky.

I don‚Äôt see a way to set up a get-to-sleep regimen.
 Having to fool with a computer (iPhone) seems antithetical to getting to sleep.
 Why can‚Äôt I set up up a ‚Äúplay stuff like XYZ,‚Äù and have done with it?

That‚Äôs all for now...

review: This app is versatile, fresh and wellness focused with a clean, approachable and attractive aesthetic. I love it! I have been using it for a long time and it pleasantly gets better and better with time. It really helps with anxiety, sleep trouble, anger and now so many other areas of challenge in life. I think there‚Äôs something for everyone‚Äîregardless of background‚Äîto benefit from in the app. My partner and I enjoy doing meditations and Move exercises together. They seem to always be adding more and improving in ways that I previously had silently wished they would. As for possible improvements, I‚Äôd really like to be able to ‚Äúshuffle‚Äù or choose a random sleepcast, specifically. Also, it would be nice if I could rewind the sleepcast, as sometimes I miss the beginning or certain parts while I‚Äôm settling in, or still have stuff on my mind from the day and don‚Äôt want to go through the whole wind down exercise again. Another suggestion‚Äîand this may just be an issue with my older Apple TV‚Äîif I could airplay the video along with the audio (Move exercises, The Wake Up) that would be fantastic as right now only audio plays on the tv while I have to watch the fitness instructor from the phone. One last thing, how about Apple Watch compatibility? That would be delightful and I would use it even more often. Any small flaws or teensy inconveniences aside, it‚Äôs still well worth the small fee to support the people who make this great service available to us.
title: Wholesome & Effective Wellness Hub!

review: This is an incredible app. It provides everything you would ever need to do literally anything. Just for sleep alone, there are meditations, soundscapes, music, radio and so much more (my personal favorite are the sleepcasts). There are entire sections devoted to just about everything. The only problem is that it can get a bit overwhelming. A lot of the existing sections don‚Äôt have much to do with mindfulness. Now that being said, most of the ones that don‚Äôt are still great. Since I intend to be an author one day, the sleepcasts provide a soothing way to ease myself into sleep while also telling great stories in imaginative settings. This app really deserves more like 4 and a 1/2 stars, but, as that is not an option, it will be getting 5 stars instead (4.5 rounds to 5). I would have a much harder time sleeping without this app and I don‚Äôt necessarily believe that anything has to be removed. I just think that it would be nice if it was a bit more organized. I only have one final criticism. Once upon a time, many years ago, there was a button that played a random sleepcast. Since I am incredibly lazy, I would very much like it if this was reinstated. It‚Äôs fine if it isn‚Äôt, but since I can already see how that would be coded, I don‚Äôt think that it‚Äôs (programming wise) much of a challenge for the incredible designers working at Headspace. I know that it may sound like I‚Äôm throwing a lot of criticism out there, but I do truly love the app and these are just some of my suggestions for how it could be improved.

review: I have been challenged with TBI and the recovering journey has been trying. After a long bout with symptoms and coping on my own, thankfully I was introduced to a TBI rehabilitation program. There are specific techniques used within that program that I have not been able to find anywhere else, until coming to find this app Headspace. My desire is that when I am outside of the TBI program I can continue my healing journey in a mindful way. I am not one to sign up for subscriptions, however this is truly an exception and well worth its value. The tools and approach of this app are realistic for day to day use, practical in all circumstances, and valuable. This isn‚Äôt just breathing, this isn‚Äôt just music, this app is set apart from all others out there. It provides education, mindful stretching, yoga, wake up and wind down meditation, and so on. All areas we forget about when our day begins, all those moments in between can now have guidance to a better response to life and outcome. As a TBI patient there are limitations unfortunately, noise, sound, colors, etc. There are highs and lows and coming to grips with that is a feat all to itself. This app is incredibly calming it allows the moment to be and pass naturally as it may. It is a must have, whether you are improving your quality of life or whether you are medically challenged‚Ä¶ this is a diverse app that speaks to all. It will meet you where you‚Äôre at, just as you are and you‚Äôll always leave with more that you came with. What a god send. Thank you to all who collaborated and created such an app. It is a gift üôèüèΩ
title: Headspace is truly a gift üôåüèΩ

review:
I have used this app for about two years now and it has helped me in so many aspects of my life. From breathing techniques all the way to positive affirmations, this app has everything you need to become less stressed and anxious. I have lived most of my life with anxiety and being an athlete has also led to increased levels of stress in my everyday life. I have always heard that meditation can possibly help with these symptoms I have faced with generalized anxiety, but up until recently I didnt know that there was actual science behind the forms of 'therapy' that these meditations and techniques teach me. This app has something called "Wind downs" which I still use almost every night because they help to calm my busy mind before falling asleep. One feature that is one of my favorites to use on this app is the "daily meditation". This section of the app has great positive ways to start your morning and has motivational speakers along with simple breathing exercises in order to prepare your mind for the day ahead. These techniques have been researched by the psychology field and it is proven that reshaping your ways of viewing yourself and attitudes can lead to positive results when living with generalized anxiety. 

Overall, I love this app and highly recommend it. I started with the free plan-which is still amazing and offers so many free resources to help you 'calm your mind', but I then got the subscription through the student plan and have noticed such a difference in the overall ways that I think about myself, and I truely think it has to do with increase mindfulness that this app has allowed me to tap into.
title: Great meditation and breathing app for people with anxiety or generalized stress

review:
Edit: Please add airplay! Especially for things like the Sleepcasts! I‚Äôd love to play it through my HomePod Mini! Thanks! üôèüèª 

This app has helped me so much! When I am suffering from stress, health anxiety, or fibro/stress related body pains I turn to this app and go through some meditations with the teachers. It‚Äôs an excellent way for me to relax. Calm my mind. Stop thinking about myself. And to recover in the moment. Hopefully in time this will help me heal, as previously I‚Äôve just been getting worse and worse without any therapy since my therapist‚Äôs practice permanently shutdown from COVID. This has been a great help and is something I can just pull out of my pocket and sit in my bedroom for a bit to calm down. Well worth the 1 year subscription price I‚Äôve paid. Thank you! üòäüôèüèª *There is only one thing that I‚Äôd change. This would be for some of the workout audios. I need to walk a lot for a heart condition I have (which is a big cause of my health anxiety), and I‚Äôd love to see the audios for walks and runs to be a bit longer. The longest run audio I see is 20 minutes, when recommended cardio workout lengths realistically should be at least 30 minutes. I‚Äôd really like to have an audio similar to the bedtime audios that are lengthy, have soothing talk, and tips to reduce anxiety made to be listened while walking. And if there could be a variety to choose from. Overall this would be the only change I can think of. An hour long walk audio to help calm my mind. üòÅ‚ù§Ô∏è

review: I have had a subscription to this app for a very long time. I first started using it for sleep.  I could never fall asleep... I would toss and turn for hrs, sometimes all night and not even get a min of sleep. This was extremely frustrating and it was affecting many aspects of my life in a negative way.  I have chronic back pain, and I could never get comfortable, so I thought about this pain all night. My mind racing, knowing that I had work in the morning and I was just miserable.  So, I started using the wind downs.  I incorporated that with a beginners course on meditation.  After some time and practice, I was beginning to see real improvement.  Then I added the sleep stories, I didn‚Äôt think they would work at first, because I believed that the story would have me too focused on the story and not fall asleep. Again, after a week or two, I was falling asleep before the story ended.  Then I did the pain course...to help me understand my relationship with pain.  It did wonders. Over months I was dedicating at least one time a day to meditation.  I also have anxiety, and have been working on that.  But there is so much more on this app. Yoga, healthy eating, music, and a lot of helpful info and meditations.  I have tried other apps while using this one. Some were pretty good and some just weren‚Äôt for me. This app is honestly an app I can‚Äôt live without.  I love it!  I am living a healthier lifestyle and also sleeping so much better. I recommend this app to ANYONE & everyone.  They add new courses and different aspects to it all the time.  I will NEVER cancel this app.  I have begun to look at life different. My mood is more positive, I am focusing more, and I encourage anyone looking for a place to start a meditation journey to start with this app.  There‚Äôs so much information and I can‚Äôt go a day without it.  It‚Äôs the best out there!

review: I tried the 14 day free subscription and truly enjoyed it. I ended up purchasing the app because overtime I've noticed how it has enhanced my everyday living and honestly made life a little bit easier. The things that would stress me out no longer stressed me out as much because I was able to control my mind due to the breathing techniques. In my abnormal psychology class, we learned that anxiety appears in various conditions and looks different for everyone. Anxiety as an emotion can have three different components: physical response, cognitive symptoms and avoidance or escape. For me, I find myself most anxious at night worried about the future and the safety of myself and loved ones. So at night I would refer to the app the most and try what helped me the most‚Ä¶ which would be the breathing techniques. In class we tried breathing techniques as well but the difference is being at home is much more relaxing than being in a class with 20+ students. We learned that breathing exercises increases oxygen, which slows down your heart rate and reduces your blood pressure. Not to mention that once an abundance of oxygen is exposed in your body, it will eventually reach your brain and nervous system. The anxiousness in one‚Äôs body is then replaces with a plethora of calmness. This app is really great for anyone who would like to reach a sense of mindfulness through a variety of breathing techniques, sleepcasts, meditation. The app offers way more than what I listed but those were the most helpful for me.

review: About seven years ago, I was in the most consistent meditation practice of my life, meditating twice a day every day for 15-30 minutes. Looking back, this practice helped cultivate the most inner peace and stability I‚Äôve ever felt. I‚Äôve fallen on and off the bandwagon since, but this app has sincerely helped me get back on track in such an easy way. It is designed to help people who may feel uncomfortable with the idea of mediation, to help those who think they‚Äôre ‚Äúdoing it wrong‚Äù or for those who have trouble sitting still or in silence. I think a lot of people misunderstand the ‚Äúpoint‚Äù of meditation; Headspace does well to illustrate that the point is to slow down an overactive mind so that we can observe, but not attach ourselves to, the deluge of thoughts in order to create inner space so that you can see the world around you more clearly and without judgment. Additionally, Headspace keeps track of the minutes you‚Äôve spent meditating and the daily streak of checking in, which are just little things that help to make us feel good about the time we‚Äôve spent and to make it a little easier to hold ourselves accountable for taking care of ourselves. Whether you are prone to depression or anxiety, have difficulties falling asleep, trouble managing your priorities or letting anger get the best of you, among many other issues people face on a daily basis, there is a mediation (often several!) that, with CONSISTENT practice, will help to minimize those difficulties in daily life. Can‚Äôt recommend highly enough‚Äîworth every cent!

review: My son bought me Headspace for my birthday ü•≥ last year after I had talked with him about a perceived crisis I was having. My son is 38, I am 68 and we are very close. He said ‚Äúdo you meditate?‚Äù I thought then said ‚Äúwell no I wouldn‚Äôt know where to start.‚Äù When my birthday rolled around he told me he purchased a year of Headspace so I could learn to meditate. That is the most thoughtful gift üéÅ I have ever received. I was feeling like I was having a meltdown starting on the inside, so I started the impermanence process. My day starts better with the little bit of time I devote to myself. There are many issues I am working on and the more I examine the list in Headspace I see they have a session for each issue. I am certainly on a journey that is aiding me with the tools and skills to manage issues better. I use to have a difficult time getting to sleep and now I put on Rainday Antiques to help me sleep and I have yet to hear it to the end... I am sleeping very well. With the discipline of having the breathing to center me and give me a moment or two to get a perspective rather than react I feel much more in control. I am so not there yet (where ever there is üòÇ) and I feel that Headspace will always have a session for me on this wonderful journey my son gifted me.  After a bit of Headspace I feel able to meet my day with the idea every day is a journey of something different and exciting to explore. I thank Headspace for being a wonderful part of my life‚Äôs journey.

review: Headspace‚Äôs meditation teachers taught me so much about mindfulness and I‚Äôve been mediating afford two years as a high schooler. And Andy was a former Buddhist monk, so I learned sooo much about mindfulness that it‚Äôs improving my quality of life A LOT. There are so many things I want to say but I want to keep this short. Even though mediation sounds ‚Äòdumb‚Äô for some people, Headspace is the very opposite; it gives me mindfulness tips and follow up with a mediation, making the mindfulness lesson more memorable, and what I learned so far (and all of them are so freaking helpful) are: observe thoughts instead of reacting and getting carried away with them, if we‚Äôre reacting to thoughts we are keeping the emotion alive, adding more fuel to the fire; let‚Äôs thoughts come and go, with a gentle or effortless focus; having a daydream sense of mind let‚Äôs us take things less seriously and it gives us more freedom, and sooooo many more (I can‚Äôt remember all at the moment). But some improvements I‚Äôd want to see are: being able to review the daily mediations in the ‚ÄúToday‚Äù tab, because they are so freaking useful and I want to keep listening to them, I don‚Äôt want them to be just ‚Äúdaily‚Äù, I want it to exist in the library forever; another improvement is that it‚Äôs kind of expensive for high schoolers, and since I‚Äôm a high schooler and I think this app should be used more by students, I think it should have a reduced price for high schoolers as well (thankfully I got a free one-year trial and I‚Äôm waiting for the sale, because I‚Äôm paying using my own money).
title: Sounds cheesy but this changed my life, and it still continues to as I use it everyday

review: I was just diagnosed with breast cancer and overwhelmed with fear and other emotions. The ‚Äúcoping with cancer‚Äù meditations are very helpful, particularly what Andy says at the beginning and end of each session. I‚Äôd like to recommend two improvements: (1) make each session longer - perhaps 15-20 minutes or more, as a lot of emotions come up during the ‚Äúdistracted‚Äù moments and a longer session would help calm back down into the breathing and guided journey; and (2) since coping with cancer is usually a long journey of many months or years, have more packs for coping with the cancer journey so that there is a guided meditation journey of 60 or 90 sessions. Of course, I listen to other packs and the stand alone guided sessions but the cancer journey is unique and Andy‚Äôs guidance through it is very meditative as well as therapeutic. I‚Äôd also like to suggest you create a 30+ session pack for people with fear of flying (like my younger adult son) in addition to the one-session you have - 30-session pack similar in process of coping as you have for the ‚Äòcoping with cancer.‚Äô There are very few fear of flying therapeutic workshops in the country; they are outrageously expensive; and psychological therapy sessions are also very expensive. I believe a headspace pack would help many people. I‚Äôve been a headspace devotee for a couple of years but had ‚Äòlapsed‚Äô until my son reminded me to begin listening and meditating again. I even bought apple blu tooth headphones to listen to headspace on the NYC subway on my long commute to and from work, in addition to listening/meditating at night to help prepare for what been restless sleeps recently. Thanks for headspace- and for Andy sharing his own cancer journey. Eva B. from NYC
title: Coping with cancer

I wrote customer service on June 9th and explained I completely forgot to cancel it and requested a refund less than maybe 13 hours or so after the transaction. 

They wrote back ‚Äú The time for auto-renew cancellation has passed ‚Äú 

Nice redirect to my request for a refund. 

Deleting app and sticking with insight timer.

review: An unbelievable app! I have been using this for meditation and sleep and I have to say it is having a positive affect on my mental health. There are many, many different types of guided meditation courses for different needs and levels of expertise. They have really helped me get into meditating by taking some of the mystery out of it. But as someone who struggles with sleep, the real star of the show are the sleepcasts. If the app was just sleepcasts, I‚Äôd still pay full price. The sleepcasts are MASTERPIECES. Whoever is writing these‚Ä¶please give them a raise. Beautifully written, engaging enough to focus your mind but not so gripping that you can‚Äôt drift off to sleep (they are detail based not plot based- so someone describing beautiful locations, etc and the paragraphs shift in order so you can‚Äôt tell what point in the story you are and get anxious about how much time it‚Äôs taking you to fall asleep- genius!). A variety of gentle voices (without being annoyingly whispering), and enchanting soundscapes accompany the stories. There are so many to choose from, it‚Äôs overwhelming, and when I put my favorite ones on, it‚Äôs like I took a sleeping pill, but with no side affects. I look forward to using them every night. I chose this app over its competitor because I didn‚Äôt like the celebrity aspect of the other app- I don‚Äôt like lying in bed and thinking, ‚Äúhuh. This is that actor from that movie.‚Äù This app is truly a treasure, and I think the low-key vibe of the app (soothing colors, soft voices, cute and creative animations) paired with super high quality features make it truly the best out there. This should honestly be covered by medical insurance- because I think it counts as healthcare.
title: Worth every penny and then some

developerResponse:
{'id': 672639, 'body': "Hi there,

We're so sorry to hear you're experiencing some issues.

My apologies for the delay in our response, we have been experiencing a high volume of inquiries since the release of the New Headspace.

It sounds like your app could use a quick re-install, which will hopefully refresh things! To do this just follow these few steps:

From your home screen, uninstall the app by holding down on the app icon until it starts wobbling. Then, tap on the 'x' in the upper left-hand corner of the icon to delete.
Turn your iPhone off and then back on. This is very important.
Download the app again by visiting the App Store and searching for 'Headspace'. Press the cloud icon or 'Install' to re-download.
Sign back in to your app.

Reinstalling the app does not affect your progress, and you will be able to pick up from where you left off.

Hopefully, that helps! If the problem persists, please send us an email at help@headspace.com.

Warm wishes,
Kateland, HQ", 'modified': '2017-06-29T17:57:37Z'}

review:
I can‚Äôt say enough good things about the content. I did not think I was going to be in to meditation. But the science behind it and it‚Äôs benefits to mental and physical health are overwhelming so I gave it a try. The first few sessions I‚Äôll say didn‚Äôt do a ton for me but with every additional 10 minute session, the power of this practice to improve my mental heath and well being increases. After 36 sessions I can say it‚Äôs been life changing and impacted almost every area of my life. I‚Äôm sleeping more now than I have in years. I‚Äôm less angry. Even my dreams are better: I used to have mostly nightmares, and now i find myself enjoying my dreams. And this is with pretty sporadic use. I probably average two sessions per week. I‚Äôm a doctor and a dad, so I‚Äôm busy. But some days I tell myself I don‚Äôt have the time NOT to do a 10 minute session, because the improved focus I‚Äôm sure makes the day more productive over all. I give four and not 5 stars because of the poorly designed app. The app used to be well organized but it‚Äôs just not anymore. I‚Äôll never understand how operations this big and successful end up with such poorly designed apps. Why it can‚Äôt just be a catalogue or index, organized rationally by course from beginner to intermediate to advanced, and l with an option to view courses and sessions organized by other topics, I just don‚Äôt get. 
[UPDATE: In an earlier version of this review, I criticized the app for not being searchable but they have added a search function. Strong work!!!]

An app like this doesn‚Äôt need to be ‚Äîand I submit should not be‚Äî innovative, flashy, quirky, etc. or at least it should not be these things to the detriment of its usability. The focus should be on enabling users to quickly and easily find the content that will benefit them most. They have clearly not focus grouped these features. My wife is a doctor also and she independently arrived at the exact same conclusion: incredible content, incredibly poorly designed app, to the point of interfering with its usefulness. Guys, wake up. But I don‚Äôt want to end on a negative. Because the positive FAR FAR outweighs the negative. This is life changing material that will give you skills and tools to improve your quality of life, Reduce depression & anxiety, improve sleep and focus, decrease unhealthy levels of or expressions of anger, improve relationships, and help you make positive changes in your life. All of these have been true for me, and, the science supporting this experience in the typical user is strong. I‚Äôm a physician and I recommend this app specifically to most of my patients. Everyone should learn this. It‚Äôs not spiritual or new agey or ‚Äúout there,‚Äù or hokey. I have however experienced things while meditating that were quite transcendental. I urge any beginner to start with the ‚Äúbasics 1, 2, and 3‚Äù courses, led by Andy. Don‚Äôt wait. Do this today and get started. It will change your life.
title: Life changing content, app needs work

review: Overall, Headspace should be rated as a four out of five stars app for adolescents. This aesthetically pleasing, mindfulness app encourages users to pause and exist within the present moment as a way of coping with life‚Äôs stressors. While most of the content within the app can only be accessed with the purchase of a subscription, there is a free option to help users learn the basic principles of mindfulness. For students specifically, there is a discounted, annual plan available, making the app more affordable for adolescents, who arguably need it the most. With the purchase of this subscription, users have access to pages of organized content, including singles and courses centered on improving mindfulness skills related to focus, movement, sleep, and meditation. Since this app can be used by all ages, content ranges from developmentally appropriate courses for young children to more adult-centered sessions pertaining to pregnancy and unemployment. Furthermore, given the customization options of Headspace, users can choose the length of their session with an option to download content, allowing the app to be used more flexibly when on the go. For those that want to share their mindfulness journey, the app allows options to connect one‚Äôs Headspace account to their Facebook account, where users can invite their buddies and update their progress within sessions. When looking at Headspace‚Äôs privacy policy, their data-sharing section is vague; however, it appears that Headspace tries to gather minimal data about its users. Along with adding more details to the privacy policy, Headspace can also be improved by adding more accessibility features and movement modifications within their audiovisual content for those with different abilities within the app.
title: An App for Adolescents!

review: I have been using Headspace plus for 3 years now, and can honestly say it was worth every penny spent. I primarily use the sleep functionalities (sleep casts, winddowns, sleep radio) as I have trouble falling and staying asleep. This app has helped me turn my brain off and focus on sleep. Recently, there was an update though, that changed the interface of the app‚Äîlayout, design, and now whenever a notification comes through on my phone while using the app, whatever I am listening to will stop playing and when I go into the app, I have to start from the landing page and go into the Sleep section and start the program I was playing from the beginning. For example, when a text message comes through, the Sleepcast I‚Äôm listening to will stop playing. As I get notifications all night (mind you, my phone is on do not disturb, so I am not actually hearing the notification come through), the app constantly stops and I have to restart whatever thing I was listening to. This did not used to be the case, in the past, if a notification came through on my phone, the Headspace app would not be interrupted, and would continue to play. I never had to go back into the app during the night. And since I‚Äôm a very sensitive sleeper, when the app stops playing I immediately notice, especially if I am not yet fully asleep. I so wish there was a fix for this. I just renewed for another yearly membership, but I‚Äôm starting to wondering if there is another option out there for me that will allow me to listen to ‚Äúwhite noise-eque background noise‚Äù uninterrupted through the night. I love you Headspace, but I loved you so much more several months ago before you changed whatever it was you changed! Please go back to how you were. From, someone who desperately needs sleep!
title: Headspace is wonderful, but I miss the old version
