I‚Äôm already anxious in making it paycheck to paycheck. Honestly disappointed, the only other option is YouTube but with loud annoying ads.
title: What‚Äôs the purpose?

review:
Hello! I am around 9-15 years old (don‚Äôt want to give anyone my exact age) I have ADHD and I also deal with a lot of stress and anxiety and depression in my life. I have no idea what is triggering my stress to lead to anxiety, which also leads to me feeling depressed about myself. I loose my temper very easily, I can‚Äôt focus in class and loose all the important details my teacher is saying and when I get called on to answer a question, I don‚Äôt know what to say and it is really embarrassing. I feel life people are talking about me behind my back, I feel like I‚Äôm the one who always gets rejected. I feel like people are nice to me just to get me to shut up and walk away. I feel like I‚Äôm not wanted. I feel like I‚Äôm falling into an endless hole of nothing.   
      When my mom got a new job and her insurance changed, the insurance company said that they‚Äôll make an exception to my doctor, but they said she needed to call the doctors office to verify that I am a current patient. So she called the doctor‚Äôs office. (And the girl that talked to her- I can‚Äôt even use the word I want to describe her) Anyways, when my mom called, the person at the front desk was supposed call the insurance company, but the girl said NO! The rest is kind of a long story and I can‚Äôt remember much, so I‚Äôll move on to the ending of the phone call. And by the way, my mom cal almost YELLING to that girl that I cannot go off my meds. (also because they get into my immune system and don‚Äôt work anymore) Then she hung up on the girl. So I‚Äôm pretty sure I‚Äôm stuck without a doctor üò≠ That did not help any. 
      Before I go to bed, I take my bedtime meds, usually to make me tired. But there‚Äôs always something on my mind that always keeps me awake, and usually what I do what I can‚Äôt sleep is think myself to sleep, and that takes about 25-40 minutes. And when I have a mindfulness story CD playing, it‚Äôs hard to ignore my thoughts and it feels like the CD doesn‚Äôt help anything. When I‚Äôm at my grandma‚Äôs house, I play guitar music and pretend I‚Äôm with my friends and having a good time in Hawaii. (Don‚Äôt question it, that‚Äôs how I am lol üòÇ) I pretend I‚Äôm in Hawaii because that‚Äôs my happy place and I wanna go there again someday ü•∫. Then there‚Äôs my friends that keep me company because then I‚Äôm lonely. But after a while, I get that anxiety again. Like where my phone might go off in the night, like emergency alerts, calls, WhatsApp notifications (I have a friend that lives in Dubai and we have a 9 hour time difference). And I get that anxiety even when I turn my volume off, turn on do not disturb, turn on silent mode, and turn on airplane mode. I guess I‚Äôm more nervous about the emergency alerts because of the horrible noise it makes.
     When I try to go to sleep, I usually think of how my day went. But other than that, I think of all the bad stuff that might happen to me for some reason. I feel like someone‚Äôs watching me. (I gotta stop watching those Life of Luxury videos on YouTube even though they‚Äôre pretty good and funny at the same time.) When I‚Äôm scared, I usually recite the Lord‚Äôs Prayer. That usually helps.
     I didn‚Äôt really know how to do many mindful exercises, other than the breathe in and hold and breathe out one. And when I first saw the ad for this, I payed attention. I felt like something was telling me I needed the help with this mindfulness thing. I actually just got this and I have a good feeling about it. I am hoping to see a better view of myself and sleep better and most importantly, think mindfully. Thank you üòä

(If you read this far, thank you so much it took me almost 40 minutes to write this. If you can relate, I tell you that you are not alone and there are many people like you and me who can relate. Once again, thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏è)

Even tho my review is short, this app helps with many things, when I finished that ad, I was pleased, I thought‚Äù how about I meditate today?‚Äù Since I was feeling so much, thank you for making this app, it has helped me a lot! Even for when I just wanna relax, it‚Äôs so relaxing and calming, I sincerely recommend this app, one of my favorite meditation apps, and, thank you for making this, my rage and anxiety has went down, and I‚Äôm gladüòÅüòä

Highly recommended for new or experienced meditator. 
Recently I have been watching the headspace series on Netflix and like how it illustrates how meditation can help all aspects of your life.

review:
Thank you Andy for introducing me to sleep meditation. I‚Äôve never meditated before but this Covid crisis has changed many of our lives. Being introduced to headspace has changed my life and I‚Äôm so grateful for your voice, your influence and your ability to let me calm down and go to sleep.As a healthcare provider with many new stresses your entire team and many topics has gotten me through the past 18 months.Thank you Andy

I‚Äôm also interested to look into some of the other people that are featured‚Äîe.g., Kevin Hart & John Legend‚ÄîI just have not done a lot of that yet

review: Headspace is great. I‚Äôve been using it since 2019 and it essentially introduced me to meditation and mindfulness practices which I am eternally grateful for. Thank you for this app and I hope you see this review and make dark/light theme setting within the app itself similar to the way YouTube has theirs.

review: I don‚Äôt meditate but this was recommended to me for sleeping. It unhelpful. The wind downs have these really annoying breathing exercises that are the opposite of relaxing and even more annoying to listen to the counting. It sounded more like a fitness class countdown. Countdowns from 1000? Even more annoying. The voices aren‚Äôt that soothing. Eve is okay and I typically enjoy foreign accents but there are exceptions for me (cockney, Aussie). No offense but usually you find at least multiple voices that are soothing. I did enjoy the Cat Marina sleep story but that was about it. I‚Äôd rather listen to V on Snoozecast or the hypnotic voice of Tracks to Relax. The soundscapes are also not very good. The sleep music is even worse. It‚Äôs jarring and they all seem to have the same tones. I‚Äôve given this 3 weeks and it‚Äôs actually making my sleep worse so hoping this 30 day money back guarantee is legit because I‚Äôve exercised it. I bought directly from Headspace so there ought not be any issue, but these other poor reviews have me concerned. I‚Äôll update this review if it becomes problematic. The team behind this app should add me to a research panel. I‚Äôd really like to see them improve the sleep portion of this app.
title: Unimpressed - not helpful for sleep

review:
I have tried the free features of this app in the past, I follow the Podcast on Spotify and I have no doubt that headspace is great, but the motivation to leave this poor review -temporarily I hope- comes from a different aspect of my experience.

Today, just about 6 minutes ago, I finished a 3-minute session and after being seduced by the ‚Äústart your free trial button‚Äù I decided to go for it and test the premium features for a while. What I didn‚Äôt know is that It was going to charge me immediately for a ‚Äúfree trial‚Äù?

I love the app, I appreciate Andy‚Äôs vision and the hardworking team behind every aspect of this ecosystem, but I am disappointed that I was charge a whole ‚Äúanual subscription‚Äù and being honest, I am more stressed than before I even started the free 3-minute session.

I see no button to contact support. I find no space where I could solve this situation and It would mean a lot to me If I could be refunded. 

I was planning on writing a different review after trying the premium features and few minutes after, a sudden twist and here we are. How could I enjoy my free trial when I didn‚Äôt get what the ‚ÄúCTA button‚Äù didn‚Äôt delivered what it promised?

I hope somebody can contact me and help me. I would in return update this review to reflect what I originally expected to try after a couple of days.
title: They charged me when I hit ‚ÄúStart free Trial‚Äù

review: I love Headspace, and in the past year they have increased their offerings tenfold: the WakeUp, high quality short videos about people and nature. The offerings on meditation have also increased as well as sounds for sleep that I have used many times. My only beef with Headspace is they had me on auto renew for $99 a month. I did not know that until the charge came through on my Amex. What made it worse is while on YouTube unrelatedly I saw a new customer discount with all the bells and whistles for about half what I paid. I took a picture, contacted them and never got a straight answer. I know it‚Äôs common practice for SaaS products to offer discounts to new customers, but they should honor the price if an existing customer sees it. So I have kept the subscription but I am ripe for new options. Loyalty is a two-way street.

review:
I started using Headspace in 2014, which was a great entry point into meditation for a total beginner. 

I stopped using it in 2017 for financial reasons but came back to it because I think it beats out the other free meditation apps due to the consistent quality of the meditations and the guided courses (without courses I ended up barely meditating anymore).

My only qualm is the new app interface/experience. I don‚Äôt know when it changed but it‚Äôs a lot more content-heavy and kind of confusing to navigate. I liked the simplicity of the old app (2014-2017 version I suppose). It also just feels like a different vibe a bit with all the social justicia content throughout, not really what I‚Äôd associate a meditation app with.

All in all, still a great app but hope it doesn‚Äôt get too detached from what it started as, a simple meditation app.
title: Overall, a Great App for Meditation
